loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Beatriz is a 39-year-old married woman who has 3 children. The oldest child is 20 years of age.

Beatriz raises pigs for a living. She has a backyard piggery where she raises the pigs. Beatriz works hard to improve her business and to support her family. She has requested this loan to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies. Beatriz hopes that this loan will help to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena cooks plain rice and serves it with tomato sauce, macaroni, and fried fish; she has done this for six years. She is married to a driver and has five dependents. Abena uses her earnings to support her husband in paying their children's school fees and other household expenses. Abena will use the loan to purchase rice, tomatoes, cooking oil, and so on. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, cooking oil, and other food items to prepare her food for sale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a single lady and she currently has no children.  She describes herself as a good and principled woman.  For the past year, she has run a retail store, selling furniture, such as tables and chairs, and electronics, such as televisions, for use in the home.  Her primary business challenge is the high cost of the items she sells.  She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more electronics.  In the next five years, Mercy hopes to run a larger general store.

loans.use: to buy more electronics, like televisions, to sell.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 51 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children. 

Conchita has a used clothing business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more used clothes to sell for her business.
 
Conchita has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Conchita hopes to build a new house and wants her children to finish their studies. 

Conchita is a hardworking mother and has a happy family. She is also a loving wife to her husband and a loving mother to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell for her business.

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Here is Khachatur, farmer living in Uyts village of Syunik region. He is 38 years old and lives with his mother, wife and two little kids. 
Khachatur has a university degree, but it has been many years he is involved in farming business. Because of severe climate of the region, locals here are mostly involved in cattle breeding. Khachatur also keeps a livestock of cows, oxen, calves and bees, as well as cultivates wheat, potato, apple and walnut. 
The requested loan is important for his farming business to purchase 5 oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. This will allow Khachatur to strengthen his farm as a business and sustain it during coming cold season.

loans.use: to pay for 5 oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
I have been a chairperson for a self help group called Kaganda Magdalene Mothers for three years. I am married and have five children.

I started my business in 1987 and it is always improving. I sell a variety of household commodities at Kaganda shopping centre in Muranga, Kenya. I have been able to look after my family as well as educating my children.

Also, i have been able to repay four small loans which I received from my group.

loans.use: The money am requesting for will be used to buy more stock such as sugar, wheat flour, household commondities which are used frequently. The demand for household commodities keep changing and this calls for one to keep monitoring the market in order to  stock what is highly demanded by customers.

loans.name: Mercis

texts.en:
Mercis is applying for her second loan with Kiva and Mifex. She is a 42 year-old single mother with 4 children, one of whom still lives in the household. When she took out her first loan, Mercis had a stand a where she sold fish to the public during the morning and early afternoon. Thanks to the extra profits from her first loan, she now also sells food in a market starting around 8 pm. She buys extra fish every morning for her stand and she prepares the food with whatever is leftover. Now that her business is growing, Mercis hopes to be able to invest in the necessary utensils and tables for the business. She hopes that she will eventually be able to own a restaurant with her hard work. Most of all though, Mercis wants to finish raising her last child and live with peace of mind.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy fish for her stand and restaurant, as well as tables and chairs

loans.name: Mohammad Akbar

texts.en: Mohammad Akbar is 45 years old and lives in district 8 of Kabul, the capital of Afghanistan.  He has a catering shop and needs a loan because his shop doesn’t have enough dishes, forks, spoons, etc. He has completed 3 loan cycles with AFSG and now wants to start a 4th cycle. Before taking loans he shared a business with his friend, but it was difficult for them to earn enough income to fulfill both their needs. Therefore, they decided that one of them should keep the shop, and Mohammad Akbar agreed to take it. It was very difficult for him at the beginning to manage the shop, but after taking loans he has developed his business step by step.  Now, with more money, he wants to expand it even further.

loans.use: Buying dishes, spoons, forks, etc.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jaqueline’s passion is in the beauty salon business! She started her own business about a year ago. Her loan request is to buy shampoo and rinse products for her clients. These are a rare commodity in the impoverished area where her salon is located. By having them, she expects to increase salon activity, attracting more customers. Before this line of business, she used to work in various other salons. This gave her the experience and desire to start her own.

Jaqueline is married with three sons: Luis Fernando (10), Jean Luis (8), and Joan (8 months), and she has lived in the area for 9 years.

loans.use: Buying new hair products for her clients.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mr. Phan N. is 32 years old and married and lives with his wife in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. He is self-employed as a blacksmith earning around $4 each day, while his wife works in a rice paddy earning only a meager sum. He and his wife have three children. Two of them are students, and the third is too young to attend school. Mr. Phan N. is currently requesting a loan to purchase tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his blacksmith business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a mother of four girls. She lost her husband due to cancer a couple years ago and because of this tragedy she had to take all the family responsabilities on her own. She decided to make typical meals and sell them at the market in her city, in order to be able to get an income that would resolve her family financial problems. Soon after things got better, she had a problem because all the merchants in her area were relocated. As a result she had to move her business to her small house. The demand of her delicious cooking is very high and now she has a lot of people as regular clients in her business. Because of the high number of clients visiting her business her four daughthers are now working with her after they finish classes in their school “Instituto Superior” where they have a high proficiency.

Rosa plans to keep working hard and increase her sales as well to adjust the space to the number of clients and special typical meals that she offers. She is asking for a loan of U$275 to buy kitchen supplies and some ingredients for the meals. Please help her to accomplish her goal, so she can keep pleasing her very demanding clients.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa es madre D. cuatro hijas, perdió al esposo que padecía D. cáncer hace un par D. años y con la presencia D. esta tragedia tuvo que afrontar la carga familiar. Decidió preparar platos típicos en casa para ofrecerlos en el mercado D. sus ciudad a fin D. procurarse un ingreso económico que solucionara los problemas económicos D. su hogar poco tiempo después las cosas marchaban bien sin embargo se presentó un inconveniente había que reubicar a todos los comerciantes D. esa zona y debido a este hecho tuvo que desplazar su centro D. labores hasta su pequeña morada. La aceptación por tan delicioso modo D. cocinar no se hizo esperar y ahora tiene a muchas personas como comensales asiduos y para atender a este inmenso número recibe el apoyo D. sus hijas en la preparación D. las comidas y en la atención, turnándose las 4 para no entorpecer su exitoso desempeño en el colegio e instituto superior. Rosa tiene planeado seguir desempeñándose en este trabajo para acrecentar sus ventas y acondicionar un espacio acorD. a tan distinguidos platos regionales que oferta, para eso necesita la compra D. utensilios D. cocina e insumos para su preparación. La suma solicitada para llevar adelante sus proyectos es D. 275 dólares en calidad D. préstamo. Ayudemos a concretar Este anhelo para que siga deleitando los paladares D. sus exigentes comensales.

loans.use: COMPRA DE UTENSILIOS DE COCINA E INSUMOS PARA LA PREPARACIÓN DE LAS COMIDAS.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase extra crates of tomatoes and expand her stall.

loans.name: Racheal's Group

texts.en:
Rachel N. wants to take a loan in order to build a chicken house and increase her flock so that she may be able to better care for her children.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To construct a chicken house

loans.name: Akefeimbou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akefeimbou K. was born in Kara, northern Togo, on April 14, 1984. Single with no children, she quickly became involved in business after abandoning her studies. With her meager means, she opened a small general store in which she sells a bit of everything. Unfortunately she is unable to meet all the needs of her customers as she lacks the funds to buy a sufficient stock of merchandise. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $600 to establish a good supply of merchandise.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Akefeimbou K. est née à Kara au nord du Togo le 14 Avril 1984. Célibataire sans enfant, elle s’est vite lancée dans le commerce après avoir délaissé ses études. Avec ses moyens dérisoires, elle a ouvert une petite boutique d’alimentation générale dans lequel elle vend un peu de tout. Malheureusement elle n’arrive pas à couvrir tous les besoins de sa clientèle faute de moyens financiers pour constituer un stock suffisant de marchandises. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un prêt de $600 pour constituer un important stock de marchandises

loans.use: Merchandise supplies

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong S., 38, is married with four children and works as a teacher in Tmor Kor commune, part of Kampong Cham Province. As a teacher she earns on average $4 per day, which includes her salary and running a part time private class for the students on certain days of the week. To supplement the household  income, her husband, Mr. Kert Sophea, 45, sells wood and charcoal, earning $11 of income. This couple hopes to borrow $1000 to purchase more wood and charcoal to resell in large amounts.  The profit from this business will be used to support the family.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase more wood and charcoal.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Mrs. Ven S., 22, is married with two school-aged children and sells coffee, rice, noodles and other foods from her house. She earns approximately six dollars a day. Her husband supplements the household as a farmer. He grows sugar cane and rice. Normally he makes four dollars a day.

Mrs. S. is requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing more product and equipment. She sees that the demand for her products has grown and she wants to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more coffee and shop equipment, including chairs and tables to expand the business

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio L. is a responsible person, happy and optimistic. He is married and has 2 children, Sonia is 28 years old and she has a degree in Psychology and is single. His son Juan Gabriel is 23 years old and is studying Psychology, and is single. Both are living at home. He started his business because he needed to have a permenent income, seeing as he was left unemployed and he needed to help his family. He started in April 1978 when he was layed off from the company where he worked as a driver. Once he was left without a job, with the severance pay, he purchased an electric saw, a tool tha the needed for everything. Since then the owner of the company where he worked offered him a job privately so that he would work as a handy man, painting fences etc. He kept on workign for the man and at the same time he was being recommneded to friends and since then he has seen success and today he has a nubmer of good clients.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $450 that will be repaid in a term of 5 months so that he can purchase various tools and painting tools and paints so that he can better service his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Antonio López es una persona responsable, alegre y optimista. Es casado y tiene 2 hijos Sonia de 28 años, Lic. En Psicología, soltera y Juan Gabriel de 23 años, estudiante de la carrera de Psicología, soltero; ambos viven en casa Inició el negocio por la necesidad de tener un ingreso permanente, ya que quedo desempleado y tenía que sacar adelante a su familia. Comenzó en Abril de 1978, cuando fue liquidado de un Refaccionario en donde trabajaba como chofer, y al quedarse sin trabajo, con el dinero de la liquidación, se compro una máquina para cortar césped así como diversa herramienta que necesitaba. De hecho, el dueño de la empresa donde había trabajado le dio trabajo en su casa para que fuera cortando el césped, pintando cercas, etc. el le siguió dando trabajo y al mismo tiempo lo iba recomendando con sus amistades, desde entonces le ha ido bien y en la actualidad tiene un buen número de clientes.

Actualmente el solicita un crédito por US $450 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar herramienta diversa y una desorilladora de césped, así como pintura, brochas, etc. para poder proporcionar un mejor servicio a sus clientes

loans.use: To purchase building tools.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun A. lives in Chy Kreng District, Siem Reap Province.  As a fishermA. in Tonle Sap Lake, A. earns about $5.83 per day while his wife, Mrs. Dol Chhun, a farmer, earns about $1.67 per day. They have three children, all of whom are young and live in the family’s home. Two of their children fish with their father  and earn around $2.83 per day.  In order to expand business and improve the family’s living conditions, A. is now seeking a $1000 loA. to purchase a fishing boat and fishing tools. (The photo shows one of A.’s children because A. and Chhun  were not available.)

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat and fishing tools.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Mr. Pon E. lives in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mr. Pon E. is a 42 year old father of three: one of whom is a construction worker, while the other two are enrolled in school. Mr. Pon E. is a construction worker and a farmer, while his wife, Mrs. Than Lach, owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup for breakfast. His rice field has infertile soil therefore Mr. Pon E. is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizers. With the rest of the money, he would hire a laborer with a pump to water his field. Previously, Mr. Pon E. obtained a loan from AMK to start his wife's restaurant business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and hire a laborer

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Olinda is an enterprising mother who, with lots of effort, managed to open in her home a small bodega (grocery and sundries store), which has helped Olinda cover her family’s needs. Nevertheless, with three children comes greater responsibility, and greater costs, too. That’s why Olinda would like to increase her store’s profits. She would like to expand and acquire new products to satisfy her clients’ needs. To do this, she needs a loan, which she will use to purchase merchandise and supply her store with a wider range of products. Olinda trusts that you are the person who can help her with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

Olinda es una mujer emprendedora que con mucho esfuerzo logró instalar en su hogar una pequeña bodega que hasta el día de hoy ha suplido las necesidades de su familia. Sin embargo, 3 hijos es una mayor responsabilidad y mayores gastos también, es así que su desea acrecentar las ganancias que su tienda le proporciona. Olinda desea ampliar y adquirir nuevos productos que satisfagan las demandas de sus clientes. Para esto requiere de un préstamo, dinero que invertirá en la compra de mercadería y surtir su tienda con diversidad de productos. Olinda tiene fe de que usted es la persona que podrá ayudarla en su negocio.

loans.use: Expansion of her store and purchase of a variety of merchandise

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Agomé-Tomégbé, Monsieur  G.  Kossi  est célibataire et père de deux (02) enfants. Il s’est lancé spécialement dans l’élevage de porcins. Ce qui lui assure le minimum vital de la famille. Très lié à ce métier de l’élevage, il ne se décourage pas. Il  sollicite un financement pour réhabiliter son enclos et acheter de la nourriture. Ce qui l’aidera à satisfaire sa clientèle à tout moment et à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Agomé-Tomégbé, Mr. Kossi G. is single and the father of two children. He has gone into the business of raising pigs. This allows him to cover the minimum necessary to meet the needs of his family. Very attached to his business, he does not become disheartened. He is asking for a loan to renovate his pig pen and purchase more pig feed. This will allow him to satisfy his clientele at all times and also provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Baptist Primary School, Magburaka Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Baptist Primary School, Magburaka. Baptist Primary School was founded by the Baptist Church in 1974.

Since its inception in 1974, this school lacked a formal building of its own. The school depended on renting one unfinished house after another. But thanks to the government, through a World Bank-sponsored programme they had their first building constructed in 1993 with only five classrooms. This was not enough, however, to host the growing number of pupils in the community; the school was, and still remains, the only primary school around the Back of Police Community. Thus in 2000, the United Nations Observers' Mission in Sierra Leone (UNOMSL) built them another five-classroom building.

Today, they are proud of two buildings with a well trained and qualified staff of eighteen. They have a very good record in terms of public examinations. They always achieve a record of 100% at the National Primary Schools Exams (NPSE).

This is their second loan from Kiva through SMT (Kiva’s Field Partner). The previous loan was a great success for these teachers. Some used their loans to attend to their children's schooling; others invested theirs in businesses or agriculture; and others used them for personal expenses, like purchasing furniture. Still others used their loans to start or finish the construction of a house.

Their head teacher, Mr. Henry S. K. (at the back left, in green), was one among those who invested their loans in building a house. That loan (Le 1,000,000), though small he said, helped him to start the construction of a house. With this new loan (Le 1,500,000), he will now be able to push the building process to another level. This is a great help to them, said Mr. Henry, who has been a teacher for the past 35 years. With a loan, each of the teachers will be able to handle a large sum of money in bulk, invest it in something great, and then repay gradually out of their meager salaries.

Mr. Henry is now 55 years of age. He was born in a village called Bumbuna, about 30 miles from Magburaka, the Tonkolili District head-quarter town, Northern Sierra Leone. He is married with three children, who are all still in school.

loans.use: To invest in business and agriculture, pay school fees, and use for house-building projects.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La Señora María Esther, socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las Vencedoras de Villa Universitaria”, vive en la región  y  provincia de  San Martín, distrito de  Tarapoto. Es enfermera de profesión, carrera que no ejerce por razones ajenas a su voluntad y ahora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, útiles escolares, medicinas, y artículos para regalos. Tiene bastante tiempo en este negocio y le va bien. Su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Cenepa Mz. D – Lt. 22, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes los cuales son mayormente los vecinos de su  barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/.900, el cual será cancelado en 6  meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, entre otros,  para poder surtir bien su negocio y que sus clientes encuentren lo que buscan. 

Maria Esther tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos quienes la apoyan en sus decisiones. Es una mujer creativa, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando para seguir creciendo en su negocio, porque le gusta lo que hace y su meta  es ampliar su negocio con una botica en vista de que ella estudio enfermería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Esther is a member of the group " Las Vencedoras de la Villa Universitaria," (The conquerors of the University villa) and lives in the region and province of San Martin, in the district of Tarapoto. She is a nurse, but cannot practice medicine because of circumstances that lay outside of her power and now she sells groceries, school supplies, medicines and gift items. She has spent a long time running her business and she runs it well. Her store is located in her home, where she welcomes customers on a daily basis, the majority of whom are her neighbors. With this loan, which will be repaid in 6 month, she will purchase grocery items such as rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, jams of various sizes, toilet paper, detergents and soaps of different brands and sizes, in order to supply her store and so that her customers will be able to find what they are looking for. Maria Esther is 40 years old and she lives with her husband and her children, who all help her in her decision making. She is a creative and hard working woman with a desire to work to see her business grow and succeed because she likes what she does for a living. Her next goal is to open a small pharmacy so that she can be able to practice a bit of her educated profession in medicine.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her store

loans.name: Nevenka

texts.en: Nevenka was born in 1978. She lives in Bratunac, a village close to Srebrenica in a region that endured some of the worst damage of the Bosnian War in the 1990s. Nevenka is married and has two children. Her husband is a high school teacher. Nevenka is a housewife, but she wants to start a business to help support her family. She requests a 600KM loan from Women for Women, International, which she will use to build a special type of smokehouse that can be used to dry meat and plums. She plans to sell these products at the local marketplace, where they are considered a specialty.

loans.use: To build a smokehouse to prepare dried meat and dried plums.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda se dedica a la venta de pollo, tiene su negocio en una colonia de la ciudad Guatemala, tiene 20 años de tener su negocio, a demás vende chompipes (pavos).  Ella tiene seis hijos, y  tres están estudiando actualmente, los otros trabajan y ya no dependen económicamente de sus padres. Hermelinda cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, ella tiene una empleada que le ayuda a trabajar en la preparación de los pollos.  Todos los días ella se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana para poder iniciar su negocio temprano y terminarlo a buena hora. Ella necesita  el préstamo para poder comprar  pollo, gallinas y chompipes ya que en esta época de fin de año se vende más. Le da gracias a Dios  de tener su negocio y  desea el préstamo para aumentar sus ventas,  y así poder brindarles la ayuda necesaria a sus hijos y apoyarle en sus  estudios.
texts.en:
Hermelinda sells poultry for a living. She operates her business in a "colonia" of Guatemala City. She's has had the business for 20 years. She also sells "chompipes" (turkeys). She has six children, three of whom are in school. The others work and no longer depend on their parents. Hermelinda's husband supports her work. She has an employee that helps her prepare the poultry. She gets up everyday at four in the morning in order to start work early and finish at an early hour. She needs the loan to be able to buy chickens, roosters and chompipes because sales are especially brisk this time of year. She thanks God for her business and hopes the loan will increase her sales and provide the income she needs to support her children's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poultry for resale.

loans.name: Rosminda

texts.es:
Rosminda se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, donde vende a crédito y cobra cada día a la semana y al mes.
Vive en la zona Camiri de la ciudad de La Paz en casa propia y tiene dos hijos que están a su cargo
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su experiencia las ganas de trabajar le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito ya que con su actividad le ayuda a su esposa para solventar los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Rosminda dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of clothing, which she sells on credit and charges each day of the week and by month. She lives in the Camiri zone of the city of La Paz in her own home, and she has two children who are in her care. This is the first time she requests a loan in Impro, and her experience and desire to work give her the opportunity to access this credit given that, with her activity, she helps meet the household’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es agricultora y también se dedica a la producción y venta  de leche a la Industria PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), con eso cubre los gastos de estudio y alimentación de su familia, es divorciada tiene tres hijos, vive en casa propia ubicado en comunidad de Arasaya  sección Achacachi.  


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de ganado ya que en este tiempo es que baja  de precio el ganado. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Natividad is a farmer and she also works in the production and sale of milk for Industria PIL (an industrial milk processing plant). With the money she earns, she covers the expenses of school and food for her family. She is divorced with three children. She lives in a house of her own in the Achacachi section of the Arasaya community. She will use the loan to buy cattle since the price of cattle has dropped recently. This is her first loan with Impro, and an evaluation has been conducted that qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose O. earns a living selling provisions like noodles, milk, sugar, and detergent. She hopes to expand her business. She therefore needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more provisions to sell.

She is 37 years old. She is married with 6 children.

She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela  es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas, Adela vive en la comunidad de Orcasitas que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Adela es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Adela junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de peones, sus ventas lo realiza en la misma comunidad.
Adela necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ladrillos crudos y el pago de peones.
Los sueños de Adela son construir su casa de material noble y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Adela is a member of the Orcasitas Microfinance Institute. She lives in the community of Orcasitas, which is located 30 minutes away from the city of Ayacucho. Adela is a 36-year-old, married mother of 4 children. She and her husband produce handmade bricks, for which they have the support of laborers. They sell their products in their own community. Adela needs a loan of 900.00 PEN, which she will invest in purchasing raw clay and paying the laborers. Adela dreams of building a house with sturdy materials and seeing her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw clay and pay laborers

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del comité fue la Señora Blanca O. quien vive en la zona del km 7 ½ Bº Maria Auxiliadora Ciudad Del Este. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas  para formar el comité en dicha zona.

El comité se denomina “Maria Auxiliadora”, está constituido por 21 señoras muy activas y solidarias todas de la misma zona.  Ellas tienen actividades diferentes como ser venta de Pantalones, remeras, tomates, cebollas, Ajo, cremas para el rostro,  manzanas, bananas, gaseosas, galletitas, caramelos, melones, sandias, azúcar, leche, aceite, escobas, Trapo de piso, detergente, suavizante, Carnes etc., y otras que emprenderán una nueva labor y cuentan con un  ingreso fijo.

Las señoras retiran un crédito de Gs 300.000 a Gs 800.000 c/u.  El crédito destinaran a la compra de mercaderías para y artículos de primera necesidad para la venta.

Miran I.	Venta de Plásticos
 Teófila G.	Despensa
Blanca O.	Costura
Mirian Pereira	Cantina
Maria B.	Venta De Pollo y Huevo
Ana Maria R.	Despensa
Rosani S.	Venta de Verdura
Mirian R.	Venta de Comidas
Sabina R.	Venta De Huevo
Maria Luisa F.	Venta de Ropa
Catalina M.	Venta de Ropa
Idalina A.	Venta de Verdura
Valentina V.	Copetín
Nancy B.	Venta de Bebidas
Catalina V.	Venta de Ropa
Luz Álvarez	Despensa
Gloria A.	Venta de Bijouteries
Blanca T.	Venta de Cosméticos
Ana C.	Venta de Ropa
Fidelina Vázquez	Copetín
Liz A.	Costura
texts.en:
This group was formed by Mrs. Blanca O., who lives in Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood of Ciudad del Este. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form a group in this neighborhood. This group, called “Maria Auxiliadora”, consists of 21 very active and united women from the same area. They have different activities like selling pants, T-shirts, tomatoes, onions, garlic, face creams, apples, bananas, soft drinks, cookies, caramels, melons, watermelons, sugar, milk, oil, brooms, floor coverings, detergent, fabric softener, meats, etc. Others are starting a new job and need a fixed income. The ladies are taking out a loan of 300,000 to 800,000 guaranis each. They will use the loan to buy merchandise and primary necessities to sell. Miran I. - Plastics sales Teófila G. - Shop Blanca O. - Tailoring Mirian Pereira - Cantina Maria B. - Chicken and egg sales Ana Maria R. - Shop Rosani S. - Vegetable sales Mirian R. - Food sales Sabina R. - Egg sales Maria Luisa F. - Clothing sales Catalina M. - Clothing sales Idalina A. - Vegetable sales Valentina V. - Snack sales Nancy B. - Beverage sales Catalina V. - Clothing sales Luz Álvarez - Shop Gloria A. - Jewelry sales Blanca T. - Cosmetics sales Ana C. - Clothing sales Fidelina Vázquez - Snack sales Liz A. - Tailoring

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, chickens, cosmetics, caramels, beverages, blankets, plastics, clothing, groceries, ice creams, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric M. sells spare parts for cars at Siwdo near Cape Coast. Eric has received junior high schooling. He is single and has no child. He is responsible for paying utility bills.

Eric has been selling spare parts for cars since 2002. His loan will be used as additional capital to enable him to increase the sale of spare parts to meet the increase in demand by his customers. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest for the expansion of his trade.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to meet the increase in demand by his customers

loans.name: Mahkam

texts.ru: Дадобоев Махкам , мужчина 26 лет, женат имеет одну дочку. Сам занимается торговлей репчатого лука оптом. Его точка реализации расположена возле его дома. Проживает он в Костакозе.Также параллельно Махкам занимается откормом и продажей крупного скота. Для закупа корма и увеличения голов скота Махкам решил получить повторный кредит.
texts.en:
Mahkam D. is a 26-year-old man, married and has one daughter. He is an onion wholesaler, and his sales outlet is near his home in Kostakoz. In addition, Mahkam raises and sells large-horned cattle. Mahkam decided to take out another loan to purchase feed and increase the size of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia R. y su conyuge Evan Cesar tienen dos hijos pequeños , de los cuales uno va al colegio, ella atiende su venta en su domicilio y su cónyuge es técnico en mantenimiento de heladeras, esta pareja jóven hacen de sus actividades la principal fuente de ingresos y gracias a la ayuda de Emprender que le da financiamiento han logrado sobresalir economicamente. La Sra. Silvia es socia antigua de emprender.
texts.en:
Silvia R. and her spouse Evan Cesar have two small children, one of which attends school. She attends to her sales in her home and her spouse is refrigerator maintenance technician. This young couple has made their principal activities their source of income and thanks to the help from Emprender who has granted them loans they have been able to get ahead economically. Silvia is an old member of Emprender.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase work capital and purchase a phone booth.

loans.name: Jairo Rufino

texts.es:
el sr. Jairo F. cuenta con una pulperia que opera bajo el nombre de Pulperia F., el tiene mas de 2 años de dedicarse a su negocio, durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien, el esta casado y tiene dos hijos, a los que les brinda educacion, vestimenta y salud. el es un padre muy responsable y siempre ha pensado en el bienestar y aseguarar el futuro de su familia, a la vez tambien trabaja en UNIMER que es una empresa de distribucion de mercaderia al por mayor, el negocio por las mañanas cuando el anda trabajando lo atiende su esposa y luego en las tardes y noches lo atiende el personalmente.
el esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas su negocio, asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jairo F. has a mini market called Pulpería F.. He has had this business for over two years. During all this time it has gone very well. He is married and has two children. He gives them an education, clothing, and takes care of their health. He is a very responsible father. He has always thought of their well being and securing a good future for his family. He also works in UNIMER, which is a business that distributes wholesale merchandise. His wife takes care of the mini market in the mornings when he is working. Then, he takes care of it in the afternoons and evenings. He is asking for a loan to better stock his store and get better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, beans, tortillas, shortening, margarine, bread, crackers, soup, pasta, milk products, cold cuts, chicken

loans.name: Peka

texts.en: Peka P., 39, is married with 4 children.  She has experience in the canteen business.  She sells to a local school and to villagers 5 days per week.  Peka has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~110USD).  SPBD loans are Peka’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase tables, sugar, rice, oil, plastic bag, cups, flour.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
V. Nguyễn Thị is a 40 year-old woman living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, V. owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling mattresses to local businesses and community members. V. has been engaged in this business for more than 16 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, V. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. V. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her operation.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia S. is from the village of Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Delia is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a retail store buying and selling rice in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Delia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Delia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Christian

texts.es: Christian es madre de 2 niños, quienes son su mayor tesoro y por quienes tiene que trabajar arduamente, ya que asumió el rol de madre y padre dentro de casa. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en la tienda que tiene en su casa, la cual viene funcionando hace 3 años con un horario de atención de 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, dedicando todo el día en la atención de sus clientes, por quienes trata siempre de mejorar los productos que ofrece. Sin embargo para mantener su negocio tiene que realizar sus compras en el centro de Lima, ya que los grandes mercados mayoristas se encuentran allí, por lo que cada quincena se traslada hasta allá para comprar la mercadería necesaria para un mes. La atención de las necesidades de sus clientes es una de las mayores satisfacciones que tiene, por lo que espera con el tiempo tener un minimarket con el cual mejorar sus ventas y consolidar su negocio dentro de su localidad, para ello seguirá con el mismo espíritu emprendedor que le ayudará a lograr sus metas. Con este, ya son 13 créditos que tiene con MFP, siendo la responsabilidad y la organización lo que más le gusta de su banco comunal. Los 3000 soles que viene solicitando le permitirán fortalecer su negocio con nuevos productos para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Ernesto Jr.

texts.en: Ernesto Jr. R. is from the village of Dalapang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 32 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Ernesto Jr. owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ernesto Jr. joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ernesto Jr. is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle to enable him to provide better service. This loan will be his second from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children’s tuition fees and for daily needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle to provide better service

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is engaged in the hog raising business. He also drives a van transport for him to generate additional income for the maintenance of his hog raising business and to meet the immediate needs of his family. Vincent is happily married to Jesusa. The couple is blessed with two children who were King James - 19 years old and John Michael - 18 years old. The couple is doing all their best to raise their children well and somehow give them education for their future jobs. 

Vincent is asking for loan amounting to PHP5, 000 as added business capital to his hog raising. He wanted to supply his livestock with enough feeds for their foods daily. He believes that through the said business, his family, especially the education of his children will be sustained. In this regard, Vincent is working hard and patiently doing his best to become successful in the business someday.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Gerjes

texts.en:
Gerjes is a 46 year old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon. Gerjes has been selling bread in his car. He sells to grocers stores, to other shops and he also sells in villages. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work. Gerjes is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients; since he sees them a lot, they became friends. His clients are his friends, neighbors and shops. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulty excepting the traffic in the street to get from one place to another. Gerjes decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his income. In the future, he plans on expanding his work by going to other villages in the North.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo de l’association Horonya est composé de dix femmes toutes mariées de la ville de Tominian, région de Ségou quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 31 ans et au moins  6 enfants.
Les femmes du groupe font comme activité le petit commerce d’articles         divers  tels, le riz, le poisson, le tissu, le savon, les haricots etc. à Tominian il y’a environ 17 ans. 
Pour rentabiliser leurs activités, les membres du groupe Djekafo de l’association Horonya ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année. Ils sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.    
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour l’achat d’articles  divers de commerce auprès des grossistes de la place. Ces activités d’achat et de vente sont très rentables pour ces femmes du groupe Djekafo qui vendent leurs marchandises au comptant en détail et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Les membres du groupe Djekafo comptent réaliser chacun un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000 FCFA à 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Djekafo group belonging to the Horonya Association is composed of 10 women, all married, from the town of Tominian, Ségou region, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They live in traditional families and have an average age of 31 and on average, 6 children each.

The women of this group have been selling various small items such as rice, fish, cloth, soap, dried beans, etc. in Tominian for about 17 years.

In order to make their businesses more productive, the member of the Djekafo group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso this year. They are on their first loan with the institution.

This loan will be used to buy items for resale from local wholesalers. Their commercial businesses bring in a good income for the Djekafo members who sell their goods for cash, retail, and for credit to a diverse and varied clientele.

Each of the members of the Djekafo group expects to make a monthly profit of 10,000 to 15,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is 39 years old. He is married with five children.

Ziad is an entrepreneur who sells different kinds of food stuffs such as sweets, produce, preserved foods, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store.

Ziad is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to increase his stock.

He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To increase his stock.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Mrs. Modesta F. owns a hectare (2.5 acres) of rice field. She is 45 years old and married. She is now preparing her land for the planting season.

Modesta is a member of CEVI and she said that the impact brought by its financial services was positive. She is thankful its program was offered to farmers like her who are not able to accumulate capital on their own.

Now Modesta is applying for a loan of Php 9,000, which she will use to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es pequeño agricultor de durazno, pera y chirimoya y en temporadas secas trabaja como transportista inter provincial La Paz – Sataqui. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Sapaqui a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto, también tiene su pequeña vivienda en  la zona de Senkata de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de semillas de durazno para su posterior siembra.
 
Es segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Pedro has a small farm growing peaches, pears, and chirimoya. In the dry season he drives a truck between La Paz and Sataqui. This is his main source of income to support his family. His home is located in the community of Sapaqui, about 2 and a half hours from the city of El Alto. He also has a small home in the Senkata area of El Alto. Pedro plans to use the loan to buy peach seeds for the next planting season. This is his second loan with Kiva partner, Impro; because he paid back the first on time, he was allowed to ask for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Juana P. tiene 54 años, está separada, tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad. Ella vive en un sector urbano marginal al sur de la ciudad de Guayaquil, el área donde vive no posee todos los servicios básicos y tiene alto índice de inseguridad.
Hace unos cuantos años se quedó desempleada y empezó a preparar comida y poco a poco fue teniendo más clientes. Sus hijos la ayudan en el negocio, con una parte préstamo va a comprar pollo, carne y arroz para su negocio y la otra parte lo va a utilizar para mejorar su casa.
Su meta a futuro es construir su casa de dos pisos para alquilar departamentos.
texts.en:
Juana P., 54, is separated and has three adult children. She lives in an outlying area on the south side of Guayaquil that does not have all the basic services and has a high incidence of insecurity. A few years ago she lost her job so she began to prepare meals and little by little began to acquire a regular clientele. Her children help her with the business. Part of the financing will be used to buy chicken, meat and rice for her meal preparations and part will be used for home improvements. Her goal for the future is to build a two-storey house in order to have rooms to rent.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken, rice and meat.

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.en:
Abdukodir M. is a 31 year-old man who runs a small farm. He raises cattle and sells them to the local market traders for meat production. Abdukodir says that people in his community like meat very much. He works very hard to raise cattle and raise them as healthy animals. He has 7 years of experience in breeding animals and now he needs more funds to continue to improve conditions for his cattle. Abdukodir has asked for a loan of 5000 Somoni in order to purchase more cattle.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle  .

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is 42 years old, married to Ruth Nduku, and they have three children who go to school. He has been selling household retail goods in Naivasha town for the last three years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He plans to buy more goods for sale in his retail shop, including dry food stuff (maize flour, sugar).

His future plans are to grow his business and not just sell retail but also wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more food stuff for sale.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Luis V. is 45 years old and married to Agueda Martinez, who is 48 years old.  They have 11 children, five daughters and six sons, who help support the family.  Luis has been working at the same business since 1990, providing local businesses with screws and other construction materials.  Along with his parents, Luis saved all of his money so that he would have capital and would be able to work independently and earn a better living.  Luis will use this loan to purchase milking cows, which will give him another source of income.

loans.use: Purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Arvie

texts.en:
Arvie A. is from the village of Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old. Arvie is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Arvie owns & operates a business selling bags and pouches in the local community. Arvie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 13,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arvie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arvie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arvie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misa

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Mrs. Vuthy S. is 35 years old and lives in Preak Phum village in Kandal province. She is a pig breeder, earning a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, therefore she has decided to ask for a loan to buy 10 additional piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Hor Horn (pictured on the left), is a construction worker who helps to support his family on a small salary. The couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy 10 more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita, 49, is a rice farmer in Norala, South Cotabato. Her business in rice farming is a big help to her family. It is the way they will get the food they eat every day. And also a way wherein they can pay the amount borrowed from Community Economic Ventures, Inc.

She is a mother of two children. Her eldest child is still 18 years old. She lacks capital to provide all the farm supplies needed for her farm. That’s why she sought help from CEVI and asked a loan of 8,000 Php. This will really help on her business venture.

loans.use: farm inputs

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Esperanza inicia su ciclo 22  con 23 socias. 
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comidas, cosméticos, ropa, golosinas, abarrotes en general, verduras, cereales, leña y animales menores.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Marcelina que es la presidenta del Banco Comunal, Marcelina es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Marcelina tiene una tienda en su C. en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, negocio que inicio hace pocos meses y sus ventas están mejorando, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. arroz, aceite, azúcar. Los sueños D. Marcelina son surtir su negocio, comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios en la universidad.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles haciendo un total D. 12,600 soles.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Esperanza” (Hope) is starting its 22nd loan cycle with 23 members. They are engaged in different businesses selling food, cosmetics, clothing, candy, groceries, vegetables, grains, firewood, and small animals.

Such is the case with Sra. Marcelina, who serves as the Communal Bank President. She is 39 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Marcelina has a store in her home where she sells groceries. She started this business a few months ago and her sales have been improving. Marcelina's loan will be invested in the purchase of rice, oil, and sugar. Her dreams are to restock her business, purchase a car for her husband to use for work, and see her children finish their studies through university.

The members needed different loan amounts ranging from 300 PEN, 450 PEN, 600 PEN, to 1050 PEN, for a grand total of 12,600 PEN to the entire Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Odongerel

texts.en:
Odongerel B., 39, is married and the mother of three children. She and her family live together in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Odongerel operates a jean selling business with her husband at a Narantuul, the largest market in Mongolia. They have been operating their business since 2002, and have steadily expanded their business over the past eight years. 

Odongerel and her husband gained much experience in previous years and have built a loyal customer base. Her monthly revenue is 300,000 – 500,000 MNT.  Her profit is in 40 – 50%. Odongerel plans to expand her product line in the future. With her last two years' profit,  she purchased a car for her family.  She is a responsible person who has paid her loans on time in the past. Odongerel is also a very hardworking person. She plans to provide higher education for her three children in the future. 

Odongerel is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more jeans from China in order to sell them at Narantuul market.

loans.use: To purchase more jeans to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Sophea Chhorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine people who live in Preaek Touch village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sophea C. is the village bank president selected by all the members, who will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sophea C. is a housewife who cooks tasty food for her family and her husband, Mr. Sophorn Yorn, is a fisherman. Through this activity, the couple supports eight children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others attend the local public school. Although this family’s members work hard, they earn little income. To improve their family's living conditions, they want to start a new business but they do not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Sophea C. is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase materials for his store

loans.name: Isidro Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr. Isidro  está casado con la Sra. Rumilda hace varios años, tienen 1 hijo menor edad que aún está cursando la escuela primaria.

Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que esta ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizaron anteriormente como asalariados.

Además de la despensa trabajan con reparto de mercaderías ya que  la zona  está muy poblada y  existen muchos otros pequeños negocios a quienes les proveen de mercaderías.

Gracias al trabajo que están realizando pueden educan a su hijo y compran todas las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de artículos de primera necesidad como: azúcar en bolsas de 50 kg. Harinas en bolsa de 30 kg. Aceite en tambores de 100 litros y otros productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Isidro has been married to Rumilda for several years. They have one young child who is still in elementary school. Together they opened a store in their home, which is located in a highly populated neighbourhood. They started with a small amount of capital that they obtained through other work that they did previously as wage-earners. On top of the store, they work in goods distribution since their area is highly populated and there are many other small businesses to whom they provide merchandise. Thanks to the work that they are doing they can educate their child and buy all of their basic household necessities. Isidro is requesting this loan for the purchase of staples such as: sugar in bags of 50kg; flour in bags of 30 kg; oil in drums of 100 liters; and other staples.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of sugar, pasta, rice, flour, oil and other staples

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao O. is 44 years old and she is the village bank president, having been selected by its thirteen members who live in Samraong Mreah village, Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Mao O. and her husband, Mr. Kong Paong, are farmers who owns a plot of land they use to cultivate rice and they work very hard to support their family living. Aside from farming, Mr. Kong Paon is also a construction worker.

In order to increase their income to improve their family living, Mrs. Mao O. will use the loan to buy a cow for breeding.

This couple has five children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory while the other three are students in the local school.

Mrs. Srun K., Mr. Saem Phoeun, Mrs. Yoeung Meas and Mrs. Yeng O., who are group guarantors, are also are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es:
Aura Lila de 52 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Octavio Lazo quien le apoya en la administracion de su pequeño negocio de venta de comida. Junto a ella y su esposo viven sus 2 hijos menores de 17 y 14 años respectivamente, estudiando la secundaria.  

Aura Lila esta solicitando su 7mo credito con el objetivo de fortalecer su negocio, comprando productos (arroz, aceite, otros) al por mayor para conseguirlos mas baratos y a la hora de procesarlos obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan el sosten familiar.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos quienes trabajan junto a ella.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder brindarle a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias para que viva bien.
texts.en:
Aura Lila is 52 years old and is married to Mr. Octavio Lazo who helps her in the administration of her small business selling food. She and her husband live together with their 2 minor children, age 17 and 14 years, respectively. They are studying at the High School. Aura Lila will be taking out her 7th loan with the objective of strengthening her business, buying products (rice, oil, etc) in bulk to get them cheaper so that they make a better profits that supports the family. She counts on the support of her husband and children who work together with her. Her biggest dream is to be able to support her children under the conditions necessary to live well.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase inventory

loans.name: Bufumbe Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
34 year old M. Bena has taken steps over the last 7 years that have made the chances of success in her restaurant business sky rocket. Her optimism has always been sky high and she has never wavered, for 7 years so far. Her restaurant business profits have helped her shoulder her responsibilities, especially family-related. In a week, she makes 35,000 shillings as profits. She also operates a retail shop business in the same town of Bufumbe in Lugazi.

M. has 8 children, 7 of whom are in school. With this loan, she wants to purchase more food, in bulk, for her restaurant. Foods such as sweet potatoes, yams, rice, beans, maize flour and cassava are high on her shopping list.

loans.use: The purchase of more foods in bulk for her restaurant.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora A. is from the village of Cabisera 8. She is 47 years old. Flora is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Flora owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling meat, fish, fruit and vegetables in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Flora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Flora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Samba

texts.fr: Monsieur Samba D. est un jeune cultivateur qui s'active dans le maraichage dans la communauté rurale de FISSEL, marié et père de famille il a une expérience de 10 ans dans le secteur . Ce prêt intervient dans le cadre de l'acquisition de semence et de produits phytosanitaires liés à son exploitation agricole .Ainsi il pourra produire plus de légumes et lui permettra de survivre et de générer plus de bénéfices et être en même temps auto suffisant
texts.en:
Mr. Samba D. is a young farmer who engages in truck farming in the rural community of FISSEL. Married and the head of household, he has 10 years experience in the sector. This loan is for the purpose of purchasing seeds and phytosanitary products for his farm. Thus, he will be able to produce more vegetables, which will enable him to survive and to make a larger profit. At the same time, this will make him self-sufficient.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Truck Farming

loans.name: Rusaria

texts.en:
Rusaria is a fifty-seven-year-old widowed mother of 9 children between 15 and 30. Two of the children are currently attending school. She is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for the last 10 years. Her farm produces tea, bananas, beans, maize, and tomatoes which are sold both locally and through Kenya Tea Development Authority. She also earns income from the sale of clothes at the local market.

Rusaria has requested this loan of 45,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow that will increase her milk production and improve her family's health. Her biggest challenge is disease which affects her production. She hopes that in five years time, she will be able to acquire at least 6 quality cows.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tess

texts.en:
Tess D. is from the village of Divisoria Santiago. She is 34 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Tess owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling scrap metal & other used products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Tess joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This will be Tess’s 13th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zachariah

texts.en:
Zachariah M. is 59 years old and married with seven grown children. Three of his children are currently attending school. He is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been farming for 30 years and employs three farmhands. His farm produces tea, bananas, maize and milk, which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his bookshop in the same area.

He has requested this loan of 45000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children and expand his business operations. His primary challenges have been lack of enough money to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and animal feeds, as well as low market prices and the poor road network in the area, which hinders transportation to the market.

He aspires to have 10 dairy cows in five years and to expand his bookshop. He is grateful to Juhudi for helping rural people improve their lives.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sabina Ama Tawiah

texts.en: Sabina Ama Tawiah C. is married and has four children. She has junior high level of education. Sabina smokes fish at Ntranoa near Elmina. Sabina uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Sabina is requesting to use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sabina plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.ar:
محمد في عمر ال 22 سنة غير متزوج يعمل في مصلحة الادوات الصحية منذ 6 سنوات يعمل بجد ونشاط  يحب عمله فهو 
يعمل به منذ كان في عمر صغير وهذه المصلحة وريثها عن والده طموح يسعى الى زيادة مدخوله وتأمين عيش افضل له ولعائلته محبوب   
يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى توسيع المصلحة وشراء بضاعة جديدة زبائنه من محيطه  وجيرانه يلقى دعم من عائلته فهو    جدي  في التعامل                                                                                                    
يسعى الى طلب الرزق وزيادة المدخول لتحسين الاوضاع المادية وخاصة انه في ريعان شبابه
texts.en: Mohamed is 22 years old. He is single and has been working in the field of sanitary ware for six years. He is diligent, active and loves his job.  Mohamed has been in the business since he was very young. He inherited his business from his father, and strives to increase his income, ensuring a better future for him and his family. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, Mohamed seeks to expand his business and purchase new products.  Mohamed’s clients are his friends and neighbors.  He has the support of his family as he is a responsible individual. Mohamed hopes to be able to increase his income, especially since he is very young.

loans.use: To purchase new products and expand business

loans.name: Hotel Lane Traders Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Hotel Lander Traders” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Isatu K. is the leader of this group. The thirty-five-year-old is married to a businessman and they have three children. Isatu has been a businesswoman for three years now, selling ready-to-wear-clothes. With her share of this loan she will be able to expand her business by buying more clothes at wholesale to add to her current stock. This will help her increase her business sales and profitability. 

The inserted photo is of a group member who was not able to be present.

loans.use: Buy ready-to-wear-clothes at wholesale to add to her current stock

loans.name: Julius Jayson

texts.en:
Julius Jayson D. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 38 years old. Julius Jayson is single. To make a living, Julius Jayson owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing mug painting or designing services to local community members. Julius Jayson has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Julius Jayson joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julius Jayson is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Julius Jayson from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Amada Brudulbudura

texts.en: Amada R. R. is 58 years old and single. She lives in a house made of cement in an urban area in Guayaquil called Primavera de Duran.  Amada was very young when she started her manicure and pedicure business. With her $1,000 loan, she plans to buy merchandise for her business, such as earrings and bracelets. In the future she hopes to expand her merchandise selection so she can provide more beauty services. Her main problem is her health as she suffers from stomach aches due to gastritis.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for beauty services

loans.name: Fazilat Bibi

texts.en:
Fazilat bibi is a resident of Kasur, located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its sweetmeats. She owns a two-room brick house there and lives in it with her family. 

A hardworking lady, Fazilat owns and operates a sewing business at her home. She does this work to supplement the income of her family. She is good at her work and receives orders from neighboring areas. She learned this art at her mother’s home and is now benefitting from it.  She charges $1.42 for a simple dress and $2.14 for a designer dress. Her customers don’t argue with her on rates because of her good quality work.
 
Her husband's name is A. R. and he is a butcher by profession. He operates a shop in the market where he sells chicken meat exclusively to the customers. People at the market know him for his good behavior and the quality of his meat. 

Fazilat has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy chickens in larger quantities to increase his sales and to earn maximum profits. Fazilat is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband will be able to fill the larger orders of his customers on time and make his business more profitable.

loans.use: To buy chickens for her husband's meat-selling business

loans.name: Keut

texts.en:
From the Phnom Penh City of Cambodia, Keut N. is 41 years of age and currently works as a repairman in a motor company. 

Keut N. has a life partner in his wife, who works as a sewing worker in industry.
