The couple has three teenage children. One is no longer in school and is working in construction, and the remaining two are students. 

Keut N. always uses his motorbike to ride to his workplace. He is concerned because it breaks down very often. He really wants to change to a new one, but his cash on hand is not sufficient to make it possible. To deal with this problem, Keut N. has decided to apply for loan from Kiva to buy a motorcycle in order to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle in order to replace the broken one

loans.name: Mira Clementina

texts.es:
Mira es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona rural que tiene como principal actividad a la agricultura, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio tiene una antigüedad de tres años y cuenta con muy buena acogida, gracias  a la buena atención que brinda. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que su bodega ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Mira es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Mira, 32, is a mother living with her family in Olmos district, a rural zone whose main activity is farming, located in Lambayeque province over two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small, home-based grocery store.  She offers for sale to her neighbors and customers in the area a variety of daily use items consisting of  first need items and groceries.  She’s been in business for three years and is well received thanks to the good customer service she provides.  These activities allow her to help her husband support the family.

The growing demand her store has been experiencing has led her to think of expanding it acquiring more products.  She has, therefore, deemed it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan.

Mira is quite a hard working woman and of very good character.  People who know her hold her in high esteem and affection.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds to plant

loans.name: Lem

texts.en:
Lem C. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. Lem sells eggs, earning an income of 3 USD per day. Her husband is hired to help plow rice fields, earning an income of 2 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 66 USD on food and 50 USD on the other necessary expenses.

Lem is requesting a loan of 600 USD. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. She would like to purchase a motorized plow for her husband to provide plowing services. In the future she would like to use any additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorized plow to provide plowing services

loans.name: Cristopher Marsall

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Christopher; él tiene 26 años de edad, soltero; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de artefactos eléctricos como licuadoras, planchas entre otros y ropa para niños, adultos el viaja hasta la ciudad de Tacna para comprar su mercadería y así poder venderlos a sus amistades  y clientes que le solicitan ,el trabaja de forma independiente, a la vez el socio es estudiante de la carrera de guía de turismo de un instituto privado ya está en media carrera y espera poder seguir adelante para poder trabajar en lo que le gusta.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas mercadería para su negocio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "LOS LIDERES" communal bank which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Christopher is 26 years old, single, and alternates his daily activities with his business of buying and selling electric appliances such as blenders, irons, etc., and other items such as clothing for children and adults.  He travels to the city of Tacna to buy the merchandise he then sells to friends and customers.  He works independently and also studies in a private institute to be a tour guide.  He is halfway through his education and hopes to be able to get ahead so he can work in the area he likes best.

He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for his business.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn Z. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Evelyn is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business buying and selling health and generic medicinal products. She also buys and sells curtains, pillow cases and blankets. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP to purchase additional generic drugs and blankets. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional generic drugs & blankets

loans.name: John Kamau

texts.en:
John is 41 years old and married to Lucy Wanjiru, who contributes to the family income. They have six children and he has been running his motorcycle business for a period of about 8 years with an income of approximately 3500 Kenya shillings a month.

This is his first loan cycle in Kadet after being introduced by a staff member. He wants to use the loan to buy a piece of land with other members of his group. He hopes to improve his family's living standard and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Maria Asunciona

texts.es:
Maria tiene 37 años D. edad, ella es Casada, con 2 hijos en edad escolar, cuenta con  casa propia y vive en la zona rural del distrito D. Mórrope donD. no cuenta con los servicios D. agua y luz su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado D. 200  familias.

Maria es la crianza y  comercialización  D. animales, como pavos, patos, ect. Esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 6 años, el negocio está situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad D. sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.  Además se dedica hacer bordados y artesanías, negocio del cual recibe ingresos adicionales para solventar sus gastos diarios.

El destino del crédito será para la construcción D. corrales y compra D. alimento balanceado para sus animales. Este tipo D. negocio cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.

Maria es una mujer trabajadora, empeñosa, responsable y puntual, la cual esta convencida su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old.  She is married and has 2 school aged children.  She has her own home and she lives in the rural zone of the district of Mórrope, where there are no water or light services.  Her community is small, with about 200 families.

Maria works raising and selling animals, like turkeys, ducks, etc.  She has done this work for the past 6 years.  The business is located in her home.  She learned this activity from her parents, which is to say she knows the routine to perfection.  Also, she works making embroidery and handicrafts, a business from which she receives additional income to meet her daily expenses.

This loan will be destined for the construction of animal pens and the purchase of balanced food for her animals.  She is competent in this type of business, but she also has a big market to sell to.

Maria is a hardworking woman who takes pains with her work.  She is responsible and punctual.  She is convinced that her best option is to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To buy animal pens

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
La señora Kattyusca Roció es socia de la alcancia comunal san isidro, tiene 30 años de edad vive en huari Huancayo Perú, tiene 2 hijos menores,  Mery de 6 años y Yermy de 1 año, la socia  siempre se dedicó a la confeccion de peluches artesanales, elaboradas con lanas y tejidos, su madre quien la enseñó a confeccionarlos y con el apoyo de su esposo Juan quien también lo ayuda a elaborar las lanas a hilos para los tejidos. y asi venden los peluches artezanales en las ferias dominicales,la socia logra mantener el hogar con sua ahorros, su esposo  se dedica exclusivamente a la venta de condimentos. El Préstamo es para la compra de pellejos (piel de anímales) para la producción de peluches Artesanales.La socia esta en la primera fila derecha con chompra rojo cuvierta con una tela artezanal hecha a tejidos coloridos y elegantes.  
El Préstamo es de s/. 600.00 Nuevo Soles
texts.en:
Kattyusca Rocío is a member of the “San Isidro” communal bank. She’s 30 years old and lives in Huari, Huancayo, Perú.  She has two minor children: Mery, 6 and Yermy, 1. 

She has always made artisanal stuffed toys from wool and fabric.  Her mother taught her how to make them and her husband, Juan, helps her too to change the yarn into fabric.  They sell their artisanal stuffed toys at the Sunday farmers markets.  She is able to support her home with her savings.  Her husband sells condiments exclusively. The loan is to buy animal pelts to use in the artisanal stuffed toy making.

She is in the first row on the right wearing a red sweater covered with colorful and elegant artisanal fabric.

The loan is for 600 new soles.

loans.use: to make stuffed toys.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is married with five children. She is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines.

She is a farmer and grows rubber trees to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to redeem her land for her plantation of rubber trees.

Maribeth has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to redeem her land for her plantation of rubber trees.

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Sop Serigne Khadim Mbacke Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Serigne Khadim Mbacké du Banc Villageois de Darou Baïla 2 est créé en décembre 2010, il est au cycle 2; il est composé de trente trois femmes issues du même quartier, elles sont voisines,parentes et amies. La principale activité menée par le groupe est le petit commerce mais parallèlement certaines font de la couture et d'autres de la transformation d'huile artisanale.


Madame Amy la responsable est âgée de 29 ans; elle est mariée mère de 7 enfants et a un neveu en charge. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de chaussures et de vêtements et aussi elle fait du raffinage artisanale d'huile d'arachide et a une bonne expérience de plus de dix ans. Sur la photo elle est tout à fait à droite habillée en tissu wax vert jaune et a mis les mains sur ses reins.

Elle achéte ses chaussures et vêtements pour femmes,hommes, enfants à Dakar où elle vend également son huile.


Amy souhaite avec son prêt renforcer son activité en achetant en quantité et en qualité ses produits afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et se faire assez de revenus.


Elle compte avec les bénéfices attendus subvenir aux besoins familiaux; tout en pensant à épargner pour obtenir un crédit plus élevé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Khadim Mbacké of the Darou Baïla Village Loan Group was created in December 2010 and is on its second loan cycle. It is composed of 33 women who come from the same area; they are neighbours, family relations, and friends. The main activity of the group members is the running of small retail businesses, but some of the members also make dresses while others prepare traditional hand-made oils.

Ms. Amy, the group leader, is 29 years old. She is a married mother of seven, and also has a nephew in her care. She runs a small business selling shoes and clothing and also makes peanut oil by hand - she has gained over ten years of solid experience in this field. In the photo, she is all the way on the right, dressed in yellow and green 'tissu wax' fabric with her hands on her lower back.

She buys shoes and clothing for women, men, and children in Dakar, where she also sells her oil.

With this loan, Amy hopes to strengthen her business by buying her goods in sufficient quantity and quality in order to satisfy her customers and earn enough income.

She intends to use the future profits to provide for her family, all the while thinking about increasing her savings in order to obtain a greater loan.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell various products.

loans.name: Co

texts.en:
Co is a 51-year-old married woman with 2 children. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City.  Co has run a business selling thread for textile production for the past 2 years. Her husband is a truck driver.  

Co would like a loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity and variety of thread as stock for her business. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of thread

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 29 years old and is a married woman with three children aged 8, 5 and 3. Marilyn has been a rice farmer for four years now. She and her husband own and till a plot of land in Trinidad, Bohol. Marilyn works hard to support her family and save for her children's education.

Marilyn is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. She hopes for their farm business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Dourgham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married and has two children. 

Dourgham has had a barber shop since 2005. He has good experience and a deep understanding of the local consumer. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,700 loan to buy an air conditioner and to renovate the furniture in his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To buy an air conditioner and to renovate the furniture in his shop.

loans.name: Hawah

texts.en:
Hawah lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married, with 3 children.  One of her children goes to school.   She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis.  She has been in business for the last 4 years. She works seven day a week.  

She has requested a loan of 200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal and matooke.  Her major challenge is transportation. Her goal is to educate her children up to university level and also to sell at wholesale only.   She lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses are power and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est  un homme âgée de 34 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.
Koffi travaille comme mécanographe depuis 2009. Il a une boutique et sert ses clients. 
Koffi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter et vendre des photocopieurs. Il veut relancer son activité de vente de photocopieurs.
Dans les prochaines années, Koffi voudrait agrandir son activité en répondant plus à la demande. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit se marier et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Koffi, age 34, is single and without children. He's been working as a terminal operator since 2009. He has a shop where he serves his customers. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy and resell photocopiers.

He wants to revitalize his business. In the forthcoming years, he would like to expand his business to better meet customer demand. He says that with his profits, he intends to get married and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy and resell photocopiers

loans.name: Javid

texts.en: Javid  is 27 years old and a cattle breeder. He is married and has one son. Javid resells grown cattle in the livestock bazaar as well as dairy products. The total income he generates from both is 250 USD. He is going to increase his income and purchase more cattle. His wish is to buy a car one day and he is doing his best to save money and work even more to attain his goals. His wife actively helps Javid in looking after their cows and other livestock. Javid applied for a 1000 AZN loan.

loans.use: purchase three cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.ru: Хосият проживает в районе Пяндж. Возраст, 40 лет. Она разведена. Она уже четыре года занимается торговлей. Хосият занимается торговлей нижнего белья, пастельного белья и мужских брюк. Она берет кредит для приобретения теплых свитеров, женского и мужского нижнего белья, футболок и шапок.
texts.en: Khosiyat lives in the Pyandj district.  She is 40 years old and divorced.  She has been involved in retail sales for four years.  Khosiyat sells undergarments, bedding and men's trousers.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of new warm sweaters, women's and men's undergarments, tee-shirts and hats.

loans.use: to buy new warm sweaters, women's and men's undergarments, tee-shirts and hats

loans.name: Lary

texts.en:
Lary is 43 years old and married with three children. (Lary is female, though her name sounds male.)  She lives in Magsaysay, Baliangao Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Lary operates a business in the agricultural sector, specializing in rice production.  She has been in this trade for six years.  Each month, Lary earns PHP 6,800.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000.00 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds. 

Lary joined GDMPC in 2009. Lary hopes that, in the future, she can buy another plot of rice field.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Areli

texts.es: Areli es sotera de 29 años y hace seis años compro una casa en la que vive ella con sus papas,  para ella lo mas importante hoy en día no es el casarse y formar una familia si no el apoyar a sus papás en que ellos tengan mejor calidad de vida puesto que ellos son personas ya de la tercera edad y requieren de comodidades mayores a las de una persona en edad media, Areli se preocupa mucho por ellos y quiere recompensar de alguna manera todo lo que ellos le dieron durante su infancia y juventud hablando de cosas materiales como los alimentación, un techo donde vivir cómodamente, educación y lo mas importante el amor. Ella requiere levantar una barda en la parte de atrás de su casa para que cuando sus papas estén solos tengan seguridad de que nadie podrá entrar a su casa y ocasionar daños en el patio o robo de algún artículo que se encuentre en el patio. Para comenzar con la construcción necesita cemento, arena, varillas y pagar a la persona que hará el trabajo.
texts.en:
Areli is single and 29 years old.  Six years ago, she bought a house where she lives with her parents.  The most important thing in her life today isn't getting married and having children, but helping her parents to have a better quality of life.  Her parents are elderly and need more comforts than middle-aged people.  Areli is very concerned about them and wants in some way to give back to them everything that they gave her during her infancy and younger days.  By this, she means material things such as food, a roof over her head where she could live in comfort, education, and most importantly, love.

She wants to put up a fence behind her house so that when her parents are on their own, they can have security.  No-one will be able to enter the house and cause damage to the yard or steal anything that's in the yard.  

In order to start construction, she needs cement, sand, and posts, and to pay for someone to do the work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Melek

texts.en:
Melek has been doing her work for eight years. Since she started, she has increased her customer base and expanded her sales. 

Melek finished primary school, married at age 17 and had her first of three children at age 18. Her oldest child is 10 and the youngest is 4. After she finished primary school, while she sat at home taking care of her children, she thought she had the capacity to work from home. She asked her sister to teach her how to customize towels, tablecloths, runners, etc. At first, she made them for herself.  Those around her liked her designs and started to give her orders. She also receives orders from Turks in Germany for customized presents.

This is her second loan form Maya. She will use this loan to buy her materials in bulk for a better price and bring some different designs to the market as well as expand her products so she can sell them from other shops. 

Through her work, she wants to improve her family’s income and to enable her children to have a better future.

In the future, Melek wants to open her own workshop, bringing other women like herself together in order to earn money.

She is self-confident, decisive and determined.

Note: Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.

Melek Hanım,bu işi sekiz yıldır yapıyor.  Bu işe başladığından bu yana müşteri potansiyelini ve satışlarını arttırdı.

Melek ilkokulu bitirdi,17 yaşında evlendi ve 18 yaşında ilk çocuğunu dünyaya getirdi.  En büyüğü 10 ve en küçüğü 4 yaşında.  İlkokuldan mezun olduktan sonra,evde çocuklarına bakarken,kendinde yetenek olduğunu düşündü ve ablasına çeyiz işlerini öğretmesini söyledi.  İlk once kendisi için yaptı.  Etrafındakiler yaptığı işleri beğendi and sipariş almaya başladı.  Üstelik siparişlerini Almanya’daki Türkler’den alıyor.

Bu Maya’dan aldığı ikinci kredi.  Bu kredi ile daha iyi fiyattan malzeme alıcak,pazarlardan farklı tasarımlar getirtecek ve diğer esnaflara ürünlerini satmayı planlıyor.

İşi ile ailesinin gelirini arttırmayı düşünüyor ve çocukları için daha iyi bir gelecek istiyor.

Gelecekte kendi işini açıp diğer kadınlara da iş sağlayıp para kazanmalarını istiyor.

Melek Hanım,kendine güvenen,azimli ve kararlı.

loans.use: to buy her materials in bulk for a better price.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra, de 44 años es una mujer seria. Vive en compañía de Bernabé, su esposo hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo viven con 7 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Acocra. Desde que su esposo comenzó a trabajar en la mina de cobre, su calidad de vida aumento. Ahora no se preocupa por mantener sus sembríos estables y sembrar en gran cantidad. Pero, sabe que ello no durará mucho, por esa razón continúa cuidando de sus cultivos de papa y maíz, los cuales siembra para consumo y si le sobra los vende a los comerciantes mayoristas que visitan su zona constantemente. Paralelo a su trabajo, cuida también de sus vacas y ovejas que enseba para luego venderlas a un mayor precio. En la ganadería está ganando dinero, por eso desea seguir comprando más ganado y así aumentar su capital de trabajo. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Jooc sonjolla” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Alejandra de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa, además de varias cabezas de ganado ovino.
texts.en: Alejandra, age 44, is a serious woman. She lives with Bernabé, her husband of 20 years. Together they have 9 children, only 7 of whom live with them in their own home in the Acocra annex. Their quality of life increased when her husband started working in a copper mine. Now, she doesn't have to worry about maintaining a bountiful and stable harvest--but she knows that this good period won't last long, so she continues to care for her potato and corn crops. She plants them for her family's consumption, and if she has an excess she sells them to the merchants who are always visiting the area. On top of this work, Alexandra also cares for her cows and sheep, which she fattens up so that she can later sell them at a better price. She is making money from working in livestock, so she wants to keep buying more livestock and increase her working capital. She belongs to the "Jooc Sonjolla" solidarity group, and this is her first loan with MFP. She hopes for your collaboration so that she can see her plan to fruition. She promises to repay her quotas on time, as she did with previous loans. She is grateful to be part of this association because all of the members are responsible and very united. Upon receiving your support, Alejandra will invest this loan in the purchase of natural fertilizers for her potato crops. She will also buy several heads of sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath, 41, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sambath is a cleaner at a gas station and her husband is a soldier. Sambath is requesting a loan of US $500 to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 48 años y vive en en municipio de Choloma. Vive en unión libre con su pareja Marco y ellos tienen un hijo de 12 años, lo cual está estudiando. Marco trabaja junto con Maria en el negocio para cubrir los gastos familiares.  

Maria se especializa en la elaboración y venta de cameras (ropa de cama), cortinas y forros de muebles. Maria tiene un segundo negocio donde elabora y vende tamales en el barrio. Inició sus negocios hace 5 años invirtiendo la liquidación que recibió en su último trabajo. No hay mucha competencia en la zona, así que le ha ido bien en sus negocios. 

Solicitó este crédito de L5500 para la compra de tela y hilo para la elaboración de cameras.
texts.en:
María, 48, lives in the town of Choloma.  She’s in a common law relationship with her spouse, Marco, and they have a 12-year-old son who attends school.  Marco works in the business with María to cover family expenses.

María specializes in making and selling ‘cameras’ (bedspreads), drapes and furniture slipcovers.  María has a second business making tamales to sell around the neighborhood.  She started her businesses five years ago investing her severance pay from a previous job into them.  She does not have much competition in the zone so she’s done well in her businesses.  She requested this L5500 loan to buy fabric and thread to make the ‘cameras.’

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino is 48 years of age and is married to Nenita. They have been blessed with four children. 

Rufino is a responsible father; that's why he devotes himself full time to his hog-raising business. He has been in this business for ten years and earns approximately PHP 7,000 per head. 

Rufino dreams of lifting his family from poor living. That is why he works hard through his hog-raising business. He also wants to provide the necessities for his pigs, so he is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for his pigs. He hopes this will make them fit and well-nourished to provide higher sales at disposing time. 

He hopes to grow his business to secure his family’s living.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 64 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, así como alegre y amable, esta separada de su pareja, vive en compañía de su madre, su hija de 38 años de edad, su yerno y su nieto de 9 años de edad, instalada cómodamente en su propia casa.
El negocio que tiene María es la venta de mercaderías que trae desde la ciudad de Lima como sabanas, edredones, colchas, cubrecamas, y otros, para eso cuenta co una sobria que vive en la ciudad de Lima quien le realiza las compras para que luego María pueda venderlo entre sus amistades, vecinos y familiares, vendiendo de forma ambulatoria y desde su casa, dejando a crédito de hasta 2 meses gracias a que se hizo conocida a logrado tener una regular clientela, durante estos 06 años que viene desempeñando ese negocio ella sola.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un oficio, así como tener un ingreso económico para pagar sus gastos personales y de su hogar. Por lo contario lo que le incomoda es que algunos de sus clientes se demoran en el pago de sus créditos, pero aun así logra tener buenas ganancias, por eso tiene planes de mantenerse en su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus integrantes ser personas tranquilas y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de mas mercaderías de su negocio al por mayor para ésta campaña navideña.
texts.en:
María, age 64, is a hard-working, enterprising, happy, and kind woman.  She is separated from her life partner.  She lives comfortably in her own house with her mother, her 38 year old daughter, her son-in-law, and her nine year old grandson. 

Maria’s business is selling merchandise that she gets in the city of Lima.  She sells things like sheets, comforters, quilts, bedspreads, and others.  To do this she has a niece who lives in the city of Lima.  Her niece makes the purchases so that later María is able to sell them to her friends, neighbors and relatives.  She sells in an itinerant manner and from her house.  

She gives credit for up to two months.  Thanks to becoming well-known she has managed to have a regular clientele.  She has been carrying out this work in her business by herself for six years.  She likes her business as it allows her to have an occupation.  It also allows her to have income to pay for her personal and household expenses.  What annoys her is that some customers delay paying off their credit.  However, she still manages to have good income.  That is why she plans to maintain her business.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP.  She hopes for your collaboration in order to continue with her objectives.  She says that she feels good with her communal bank as she considers the members to be calm and responsible people.

She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy more wholesale merchandise for her business during this Chrismas season. 
.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale merchandise like sheets, comforters, quilts, bedspreads, and others.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 24 years old and married with one child aged five years.

Beatrice has owned a computer lab for the past three years. She has employed one person. She also earns extra income from her farming activities.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya Beatrice has been able to save her income. She has applied for a 10,000 KES loan to buy a computer.

Beatrice hopes to expand her business and to employ many people in the future.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her lab.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 47 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is married and has five children. Juanita has a used clothing business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more used clothes for her business. Juanita has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Massène

texts.fr:
Massène est un cultivateur âgé de 47 ans établi dans le village de Diawar, il a commencé à exercer cette activité de culture de riz de la variété sahel 108 depuis son enfance accompagné de ses parents, avec ce crédit, il va acheter du semence de riz, de l'engrais, de l'herbicide et du gasoil.

Il envisage à l'avenir d'augmenter sa surface de riz cultivable afin d'avoir une production en quantité et en qualité. il souhaite aussi conquérir d'autres marchés au niveau des villages environnants.

loans.use: Achat de semence (variété sahel 108), d'engrais, d'herbicide et de gasoil

loans.name: Luann

texts.en: Luann is 36 years of age. She lives with her fiancé, three sons and one daughter. Luann is a very pleasant, easy-going, disciplined and industrious young lady. She has a special talent and passion for doing hair, it has always been her dream to open her own beauty salon but start up capital was her problem. Luann currently rents a chair at another beauty salon and decided it was time she branched off on her own. She is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase a portable standing hair dryer, one chair with shower ceramic basin, one leather hair drying chair,one Gold N' Hot complete Stove Iron Set and a deposit on the location she would be occupying. Help Luann's dream become a reality by funding her loan.

loans.use: to pay for equipment and supplies to start up her own beauty salon

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of Unity  Group, located in Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone. This is a group of hard working traders who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to request for a loan of SLL … . They will use this loan in order to meet their most immediate financial needs – some will use it to buy a plot of land, pieces of furniture, pay school fees for their children, etc. And at the end of each month, the group leader will collect their repayment and repay SMT/Kiva on their behalf.
Nancy is the featured leader of this group. Born in Jajoima, eastern Sierra Leone, she is 35 years old and has 2 children.  All two are in primary school. Nancy has been in business for 10 years now. She has requested for this loan in order to buy more ready- made clothes to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy more ready- made clothes to increase her stock.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr:
Jeannette a 49 ans, elle est marié, le mari travaille comme manœuvre. Le nombre d’enfants est de cinq dont trois déjà mariés, l’un de 15 ans en classe de première et le quatrième appuie la famille dans l’activité. 
Jeannette dirige un magasin général depuis 2004. Elle avait commencé par la vente de légumes. Elle a trouvé le local actuel  et a décidé  l’extension de l’activité par la diversification des produits qui est l’un des facteurs de réussite d'un "general store". 
L’objectif est de pouvoir constituer une épargne  dans le but d’investir dans l’amélioration du point de vente car le local actuel est étroit et peu exposé à la lumière.

loans.use: acheter des produits de première nécessité (riz, huile, sucre,), des légumes secs, des pâtes alimentaires (spaghetti, macaroni) etc..

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes R. is a 46 year old mother of five, although she now only has the responsibility of her 11 year old daughter. She owns a small restaurant that serves breakfast and dinner mainly to her loyal customers who are workers in the area. She opens at 6 AM and closes at 4 PM. She is in need of this loan in order to buy food in bulk and make some minor improvements to her location.

loans.use: Buy food in bulk; make improvements on restaurant

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif has been working as a druggist for 10 years. He has his own drugstore. He sees this business as his future. He has many customers who come to buy medicines at his drugstore.
He was born in 1961 in Fizuli region Garakhanbeyli village.
Arif is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region Garakhanbeyli village, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporary  on front line in Fizuli region. Being busy with this business he supports his family. 
In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan amount of $400 and extensive repaired his drugstore.
For he second time he borrowed a loan amount of $600 and bought medicinal preparations.
Now he needs a loan amount of $1200 to expand the area of his drugstore and to buy the medicinal preparations

loans.use: To expand the area of his drugstore and to buy medicines

loans.name: Terki

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Terki is a resident of this town and is a seamstress. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $850.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru:
A. Mavzuna is selling children’s clothes on a Panjshanbe central market. She has been an entrepreneur for no more than 5 years, but she became a client of Microinvest only recently. She started her business from selling chilren’s clothes. She is obtaining and delivering his products by herself. She is divorced and has 3 children. Her children go to school; she is working days and nights for their education. She has nowhere to get the help from; that is why she asked Microinvest for support. She is hoping to receive a loan for 400$ for buying and selling goods and to use profits to provide her children with all the necessary needs.

Translated from Russian by Asya Lisak, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдувалиева Мавзуна торгует детской одеждой в центральном рынке «Панчшанбе». Предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не более 5 лет, но клиенткой «Микроинвест» стала только недавно. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. За товаром ездит сама. Она разведена и у нее подрастают 3 детей. Ее дети учатся в школе, и для их обучения она трудится день и ночь. Ей не откуда ждать помощи, поэтому она обратилась в Микроинвест за поддержкой. Она надеется получить займ 400$ для приобретения и реализации товаров, а от прибыли обеспечить своих детей всеми необходимыми нуждами.

loans.use: To extend the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Planting pine trees

loans.name: Mirna Griselda

texts.es:
My name is Mirna Griselda. My main activity is commerce. I have a small clothing business. I distribute new clothes as a street peddler in different neighborhoods and colonies around my community.

I have a good client portfolio and many years of experience. Thanks to this business I have been able to generate income to contribute with my family's expenses and I have been able to take care of my children.

Currently, I need to restock my business because the busiest time of year is about to start and I want to be able to offer my clients enough product variety.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Mirna Griselda, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa nueva, la que distribuyo de manera ambulante en los diferentes barios y colonias de mi comunidad, cuento con buena clientela y con varios años de experiencia, gracias a este negocio puedo generar ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y cuidar de mis hijos. Actualmente necesito surtir mas mi negocio ya que se aproxima la epoca de mayor venta y asi poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de productos.

loans.use: Purchase men's and women's trousers, sport shirts, wome's blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Dimitar

texts.en: Dimitar M. breeds two cows and two calves. He and his wife also work in the village mayoralty. They live in their own house in the village and have about two acres of land on which they produce their own fodder to feed their animals. Now they need to buy a small machine to cultivate the land so they apply for a $ 750 loan.

loans.use: To buy a small machine to cultivate the land

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
Teddy N. is requesting a loan because she wants to buy a photocopying machine for her shop. In addition, she intends to use the loan to increase the stationery in her shop.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor S., a forty six year old father with three daughters, lives with his wife in their own house near the city of Encarnación. All three daughters are currently in school. Victor owns a small bread bakery that is located in their house. From there he sells his goods, and also transports them to the houses around the city. While he is in charge of the baking of all the goods, his wife and oldest daughter are in charge of the sales in the store and throughout the different neighborhoods in the city.

They are a united family in the business and both children and parents have worked very hard to keep the business popular. The earnings form their business are the sole means of paying for daily expenses and sending their children to school. The work has paid off and their bakery has gained a great reputation in the city.

The loan that Victor is asking for the is to help him purchase the ingredients for a popular Paraguayan desert, sweet Christmas bread. He buys the ingredients from Argentina. This bread along with many other goods are requested by not only his customers, but to supermarkets as well.

loans.use: To buy the materials to make Christmas Sweet Bread.

loans.name: Thi Xuan's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Xuân (group leader) is 54 years old. She request a loan from Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) to buy more merchandise to resell, raising her income. Her husband is a state employee. He does share the workload with her. Mrs Xuân's income is 9 USD a day. She will be able to pay back the loan.
Mrs Ba will use the loan to buy construction material.
Mrs Năm will use the loan to buy vegetables to sell at the market.
Mrs Thuỷ & Hương will use the loan to buy mechandise to resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Xuân, 54 tuổi, vay vốn của Chương trình binhminh cdc để lấy thêm một số mặt hàng đi bán thêm phong phú, tăng thêm lãi, phụ giúp gia đình. Anh Hùng, chồng chị, làm chịng nhân viên chức Nhà nước cũng giúp chị phần nào gánh vác gia đình. Chị đã vay của phụ nữ nhưng với mức thu nhập 150000đồng/ ngày, chị sẽ hoàn trả tốt các loại vốn vay.
Chị Ba vay vốn mua sắm nguyên vật liệu phục vụ cho việc đi làm xây dựng (là nguồn thu nhập chính của chị).
Chị Năm vay vốn để mua rau về bán lẻ, tạo thu nhập.
Chị Thuỷ, chị Hương vay vốn để hỗ trợ cho việc bán hàng.

loans.use: Bán hàng, đi làm thuê

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey O. is 48 years old and lives in Preah Trapeang Village in Siem Reap Province. She earns $2.83 a day selling rice soup and raising pigs from home. Her husband, Mr. Lous Veasna, is 49 years old and earns $5.60 per day repairing and washing motorcycles. They have four children, all of whom are students. They seek a $1,000 loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport products to and from the market, thus making it easier to increase their income and continue their children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport products to and from the market

loans.name: Maria Del Refugio

texts.es:
Maria del Refugio sells wholesale stuffed animals for a living. She is a divorced mother of 2 grown-up children who are both married. She started this business because she did not receive enough pension money to cover the household expenses. Eight years ago, she started selling stuffed animals for floral arrangements. After that, she started selling them wholesale because it yields greater profits.

She is requesting a loan of $500 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase display shelves for her business. With your help, María will advance.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del Refugio se dedica a la venta de muñecos de peluche por mayoreo es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores y están casados. Inicio el negocio ya que no completaba con el dinero que se le otorgaba como pensión para solventar los gastos de su casa. Hace 8 años inicio vendiendo peluches para los arreglos florales, y posteriormente empezó a hacerlo por mayoreo ya que le dan mas ganancias.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar exhibidores para su negocio. Con tu ayuda María progresara.

loans.use: Purchase display shelves

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret M. is a seamstress who specializes in sewing women’s clothing. She is married and has 5 dependants. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family so Margaret is working very hard to help with the family’s expenses. She wishes to improve her conditions of service to attract more customers, so she is asking for a loan to buy modern sewing tools and materials to make her work easier.

loans.use: To buy modern sewing tools and materials to make her work easier

loans.name: Hammat

texts.en:
Mr. Hammat Y. and his wife, Mrs. Srifas Mat, who live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for nine years and have one daughter in school and three more who are still too young and stay home.

Mr. Hammat and his wife have been fishing since they were young. However, fishing is not allowed during the season when fish lay their eggs. Therefore, the couple is creating another business of buying recycleable materials from villagers for resale to middlemen, who then take the items to Phnom Penh for sale.

Mr. Hammat is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase recycling materials for resale.

loans.use: To invest in a recycling business.

loans.name: Pauai's Group

texts.en: Malae Faga is a beautiful village with natural and beautiful beaches in front. In their backyard, they also have very fertile soil suitable for farming and planting. Malae Faga is one of the new centers, and these ladies work on different agricultural businesses such as cattle farming, taro plantations, and vegetable plantations in order to earn income for their families. They are on their first loans and they applied for 750 Tala each. This is the fifth week since they got disbursed and they are doing well with their payments as well as their businesses.

loans.use: Buy tools, equipment, and chemicals to start up their businesses

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr:
Née à Attitogon en 1978, Madame A. Delphine vit actuellement à Blama condji avec ses trois enfants et son mari paysan. Cultivatrice elle aussi, Delphine associe à ce travail, la production d’huile de palme. 

Reconnue pour la bonne qualité de son huile, elle n’est plus à la hauteur des demandes de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter les noix de palme afin de produire de l’huile.

Après la vente, le bénéfice lui servira à mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Delphine A. was born in 1978 in Attitogon. She currently lives with her husband and three children in Blama. Her husband is a farmer. Delphine is in business of making palm oil. She is well known for the quality of her product and is having trouble keeping up with the demand. In order to be able to satisfy her clients she is seeking to obtain a loan in order to purchase palm tree seeds in order to make more oil. Increasing turnover will help her better take care of her family.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production of palm tree oil

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: Dame G. Pascaline est née vers 1973 à Aguégué. Elle est mariée à TANDE Sègbégnon qui est vendeur de sable fluvial et est mère de 3 enfants tous à la charge des deux parents. Elle revend du poissons au marché Saint Michel de Cotonou. Ses clients devenu encore plus exigeants, elle avait sollicité un premier crédit pour faire face à leur demande. Aujourd'hui elle est à son quatrième crédit. Elle est analphabète et est née dans le commerce de poissons, ce qu'elle même fait depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle habite  Ladji depuis 15 ans et fait aussi la distribution vente de quelques articles que ses clients désirent.
texts.en:
Pascaline G. was born about 1973 in Aguegue. She is married to Segbegnon Tande, who sells river sand, and she and her husband have three children. Pascaline sells fish at the Saint Michel market in Cotonou. She requested her first loan to meet the ever-increasing needs of her customers, and now is on her fourth loan. She is illiterate, and was born into the fish trade, a business in which she has worked for more than 20 years. She has lived in Ladji for the past 15 years and in addition trades in other items her customers might want.

Translated from French by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fresh fish

loans.name: Ipagala D Group

texts.en:
Zena has been selling charcoal in Dodoma for three years. She is seeking her first loan so that she can purchase a greater quantity of charcoal to sell for profit. She works 10 hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $35 each month. She is hoping that the growth of her business as a result of the loan will result in increased profits that allow her to buy more food for her family and continue to expand her business.

Zena is 33 years old and single with one 13-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Margeth, Beatris, Veronica, and Atupele.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
A pesar de sus 61 años, la señora María sigue siendo más que un paradigma para su familia por su perseverancia y valores intactos. Con ya 10 años de puesta su tienda, también tiene su carro sanguchero por las noches. Viviendo con su hija mayor, sus 3 hijos (sus nietos) y su esposo que viene mensualmente por laborar en provincias, es el sostén económico del hogar por lo que no puede ni declina ante tamaña responsabilidad. 

Ante esta situación, ella quiere implementar su bodega (panetones y juguetes por temporada navideña) y los insumos que necesite para su carro sanguchero, por ello, la señora María requiere la suma de 2000 soles, los que le servirían como capital para sus 2 negocios.
texts.en:
Despite being 61 years old, Maria continues to set an example for her family through her perseverance and values. With 10 years of running her shop, she also runs a food stand at night. She lives with her oldest daughter, her three grandchildren and her husband who comes home monthly from working in other provinces. He is the main source of income and he cannot decline such a responsibility. Faced with this situation, she wants to open her store (paneton [sweet bread served around Christmas] and toys for the Christmas season) and the materials that she needs for her food stand. For that, Maria requires the sum of 2000 soles to act as capital for her two businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open her store with sweet bread, toys and other things in order to meet her clients demands in the Christmas season

loans.name: Adeliz

texts.es: Adeliz tiene 20 años, vive sola, ya que es soltera. Ella es una joven emprendedora, que a pesar de su juventud piensa muy seriamente en el trabajo y quiere progresar. Se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, trabaja para una empresa muy conocida de distribución de productos, siendo muy buena en las ventas logrando buenos ingresos económicos. Adeliz no encuentra dificultad en su trabajo, ya que gracias a su facilidad de palabra sabe que se abrirá un camino prometedor. Se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Este dinero será invertido en la adquisición de productos por campaña navideña, ella sabe que logrará muy buenas ventas, para lo cual necesita de nuestra ayuda.
texts.en:
Adeliz is 20 years old, single, and lives alone. She is an entrepreneurial young woman, who despite her age thinks very seriously about her career and wants to get ahead. For four years she has sold beauty products from the Avon catalog. Sales are good and she earns a good income. Adeliz has not encountered any problems in her work, and, thanks to her excellent communication skills, has a promising future.

This is her second loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. She has been punctual in repaying her first loan. This loan will be used to purchase products for the Christmas season. Adeliz knows that she can sell a lot this season, and for this she needs our help.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the supply of products available for sale

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Noemí L. L. tiene 31 años y pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II, vive en la calle Orbegoso 213 del Puerto Marítimo de Salaverry de la provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa pero ya no continuó con estudios superiores porque más le gustaba trabajar con negocio. Se comprometió con su pareja a los 22 años. Tiene 2 hijas que son estudiantes.
Noemí tiene un restaurant y también vende ropa, estas actividades las realiza en su casa.
El primer crédito fue de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en comprar ropa.
Con este crédito de 1700 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas invertirá en mercadería para Navidad e insumos para su restaurant.
Noemí sueña con tener una cadena de restaurantes en esta zona y en Bagua.
texts.en:
Mrs. Noemí L. L. is 31 years old and belongs to the Community Bank "Las Emprendedoras II" (The Enterprising Women II). She lives at 213 Orbegoso Street in the Salaverry Port in the province of Trujillo, in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She completed her secondary education but did not continue her studies because she liked working with business more. She was engaged to her husband when she was 22 years old. She has 2 daughters who are students. Noemí has a restaurant and she also sells clothes out of her home. Her first loan was for 300 soles, repaid in 4 payments. She used it to buy clothing. With this loan of 1,700 soles, which she will repay in 6 payments, she will invest in merchandise for the holidays and supplies for her restaurant. Noemí dreams of having a restaurant chain in the region and in Bagua [a nearby region].

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and restaurant supplies

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Mrs. Rio B. is 27 years old, married and lives at Lao Proper, Plaridel, Mismais Occidental. Her husband is a driver and at the same time a businessman. Rio desired to help her husband, so she decided to become an active member of Paglaum MPC. The cooperative offers various programs and services. Loan windows for instance to fund their capital needs have been a good venue for the couple.

Without delay and taking risks, they have ventured into mango production. They have applied to Paglaum for the much needed capital for fertilizer. They find that their business runs smoothly and though there are difficulties, they are able to manage. Rio decided to get into business expansion slowly and with caution. For 4 years of being a member, she has enjoyed the add-on benefits of the cooperative. What she dreams of for the future is that her 2 children would finish their studies and have good life ahead.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizer

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Mr Kossi K. est né le 07 Juillet 1960 à Hagnigbatodji dans la préfecture de Kloto au Sud du Togo. Marié avec douze (12) personnes à charge, il a comme activité principale la gestion d’un moulin décortiqueuse de riz à Kovié dans la préfecture du Zio. C’est la principale zone rizicole du pays où les rizières sont concentrées le long de la vallée du fleuve Zio. 
Compte de l’intensification de l’activité rizicole dans le milieu, il n’arrive plus avec le seul moulin à décortiquer toute la production des riziculteurs. De plus son moulin tombe de temps en temps en panne engendrant le mécontentement des paysans. Pour y remédier, il sollicite un financement pour acquérir un moulin neuf. Cela lui permettra de faire face aux exigences des riziculteurs et d’accroître considérablement ses recettes et bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mr. Kossi K. was born on July 7, 1960 in Hagnigbatodji in Kloto prefecture in southern Togo. He is married and has twelve people to support. His main work involves running a mill for husking rice, in Kovié in Zio prefecture, which is the principal rice-growing area of the country where rice fields are concentrated along the Zio River valley.

Given the intensification of rice farming in the area and having only one mill, he is no longer able to husk all the rice the growers produce. What’s more, his mill breaks down from time to time, thus engendering discontent among rural people. To remedy the situation, he’s requesting financing to acquire a new mill. This will enable him to address the demands of the rice growers and to increase his receipts and profits considerably.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a mill for processing rice

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces de Compañía, Paulina vive en la comunidad de Compañía que se encuentra a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Herlinda es conviviente tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Herlinda junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de verduras variadas, sus productos los comercializan en le mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Herlinda se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos.
Herlinda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tierra.
Herlinda sueña con mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Herlinda is a member of the community bank “Los Sauces de Compañía”. She lives in the village of Compañía, located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Herlinda is 29 years old and lives with her common-law husband and 2 children. Herlinda and her husband both work in agriculture—growing various vegetables. They sell their vegetables in the market in the city of Ayacucho. Herlinda also works as a brick-maker. She needs a loan for 900 soles that she will use to buy land. Herlinda dreams of improving her business and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba G. is forty-five years old and a petty trader. She is divorced with three children. All are currently attending school through the help of government free compulsory education. It is her daily dream to provide quality education for her children to give them better future life. She divorced when her husband was not faithful to her, she said.

Through the help of God, Aba owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With increased stocks of different varieties, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children. She hopes to repay the loan on time because she believes the loan will boost her business growth. She belongs to a village bank called "God is alive".

loans.use: to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya T. lives in a single family with her husband and two children in the town of Kuleshwor. Her husband's name is Kul Bahadur T. and he is a driver. Mrs. T. has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying for a BBS (Bachelor in Business Studies) and her daughter is studying in grade 8.

Mrs. T. opened her vegetable shop five years ago. She sells different types of vegetables, which she buys from the Kalimati market. She opened the vegetable shop to increase the living standards of her family.

Now Mrs. T. is requesting a loan of Rs 20000.00 to buy various types of vegetables, like potatoes and tomatoes, for her shop. She also wants to purchase new furniture for her shop.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en:
S. Farzona is an enterprising woman with a deep desire of improving her family's quality of life. She is a married mother of a little daughter. Farzona has been a seamstress since she was very young, and she learned tailoring at her mother's office. With a lot of effort, she has been able to open her own shop at her home and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Farzona is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni for 9 months to purchase new fabrics for sewing national dresses. You can help improve her family's quality of life. Farzona is very grateful for your generosity and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La Sra. Flora S., vive en la localidad de Cañada Strongerst, perteneciente al municipio del Torno cuidad de Santa Cruz. Es nacida en la cuidad de Chuquisaca pero hace 8 años que se vino a vivir a esta cuidad donde ahora vive con sus esposo y su hijo.
Ella tanto como su esposo el Sr. Mariano Retamozo se dedican a la actividad de la agricultura. El préstamo que fue solicitado fue para aumentar su capital  para la siembra de papa,  se encuentran en plena época para la siembra de este producto. Tienen una parcela de 10 hectáreas. Además cuenta con tres vacas, cinco chanchos y 50 gallinas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Flora S. lives in Cañada Strongerst, in the Torno municipality of Santa Cruz. She was born in the city of Chuquisaca, and came here 8 years ago to live with her husband and her son. Alongside her husband, Mr. Mariano Retamozo, Flora works in agriculture. She is asking for a loan to increase her capital and plant her fields with potatoes, as it is currently high season for potato planting. Flora has 10 hectares of land, 3 cows, 5 pigs, and 50 chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potato seedlings.

loans.name: San Pedro Y Pablo Group

texts.es: El Grupo “San pedro y Pablo” se encuentran representado por la señora Yolanda y conformado por 12 miembros  que en su mayoría se dedican al comercio de productos como cosméticos por catálogos, vidrio, ropa, comida y otros se dedican al trasporte público de pasajeros y a la chapería de vehículos. La competencia en el rubro comercial es elevada pero las socias saben como salir adelante como lo han demostrado en su anterior ciclo con la Institución. El destino del nuevo financiamiento es para la adquisición de mercaderías, materiales y herramientas para seguir incrementando sus ingresos y poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. Su experiencia en el anterior ciclo les ayudo a tener una mayor capacidad de pago y un apoyo económico para seguir luchando por sacar adelante sus negocios y crecer junto a la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The "San Pedro y Pablo" Group is represented by Yolanda and is made up of 12 members who, for the most part, are dedicated to selling products such as catalog cosmetics, glass, clothing, and food while others are dedicated to public transportation and car detailing. Competition in the commercial area is high, but the members know how to get ahead, as they demonstrated with their last loan with this institution. This new loan is destined for the acquisition of merchandise, materials and tools so they may continue increasing their income and are able to provide their families a better quality of life. Their experience with the last loan helped them to have a better capacity to pay and economic support to keep fighting to get their businesses ahead and grow along with Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Falemalu

texts.en:
Falemalu A., 32, is married with four children.  She has three years of experience in the taro plantation and vegetables business. She sells to the village people and the public three days per week. 

She has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala.  SPBD loans are Falemalu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase iron roofing, cement and timber, wheelbarrow, spade, bushknives, fertilizers, weedkiller, barred wire and gromozones.

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Yacine est une femme mariée qui s’active dans la vente de jus de fruits. Elle veut renforcer son activité. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’acheter du pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du sucre, du bissap et d’autres produits pour la préparation et vente de jus.
texts.en:
Yacine is a young married woman who works at selling fruit juice. She wants to bolster her business. The loan that she is requesting will permit her to buy monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree), sugar, dried hibiscus flowers, and other products for the preparation and sale of juice.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparation and sale of fruit juice

loans.name: Khamida

texts.ru: Холикова Хамида 1955 года рождения, замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж Хамиды работает маляром в частной фирме. Хамида 15 лет занимается продажей кондитерских изделий и больше года является активной клиенткой МЗФ Микроинвест. Она ездит продавать товар в Мастчинский район. Спрос на её товар большой, потому что у неё очень вкусные печёные изделия. Хамида планирует в свой ассортимент добавить мясные изделия; колбасы, сосиски, ветчину и тд.
texts.en:
Khamida K. was born in 1955. She’s married and has three children. Her husband works as a painter for a private company. For the past 15 years, Khamida has earned her living selling pastries, and she’s been a client of MLF Microinvest for more than a year. She travels to the Mastchin region to sell her products, which are in high demand, because she makes really delicious baked goods. Khamida plans to expand her offerings to include meat products, sausages, hot dogs, ham, etc.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pastries and meat products

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Rosa Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 70 años y es madre D. 05 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.Anteriormente Rosa Mercedes, se dedicaba a la confección D. vestidos. Lleva varios años dedicándose a la venta D. abarrotes. Rosita se inicio y tuvo que pasar por altas y bajas, para llegar a ser una pequeña empresaria y administrar su propio negocio y generar sus propios ingresos, sin dar cuentas a nadie. Con su esfuerzo y vigor, llego a implementar su bodega, es muy conocida por sus clientes en el barrio donD. vive y sus ventas diarias son buenas. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su misma casa.Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, comprará más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, insumos para el aseo personal, gaseosas en paquetes y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela. Ella es una mujer con muchas ganas D. salir adelante para el bienestar D. su familia y D. ella misma. Rosa Mercedes, manifiesta su agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que también quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Mercedes belongs to the María Auxiliadora Communal Bank in the Tarapoto District, Province and Department of San Martín. She is a widow, 70 years of age and the mother of five children, all of them now living independently. She has worked for many years at selling groceries. Rosita started out and had many ups-and-downs on her way to becoming a small businesswoman, running her own business and earning her own income without being obligated to anyone. With her effort and vigor she got her store up-and-running. She is well known by her customers in the neighborhood where she lives and her daily sales volume is good. Currently she is continuing with the same business which is located in her own house. With this loan of 1,000 Sols she will buy more products to stock up her store, such as: sacks of rice and sugar, products for personal hygiene, packages of soft drinks and other products to keep her customers satisfied. She is a woman with a great desire to get ahead for the well-being of her family and herself. Rosa Mercedes expresses her gratituD. to the Manuela Ramos Movement for allowing her to grow as a business owner and as a Woman, and for helping other women who also want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries for her inventory.

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Kunthy R., 26 (pictured with her son), and her husband, Mr. Leab Lorn, 37, have been married since 2003. They have a daughter and a son. Besides her children, she also has her mother living with her. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers fR. Phnom Penh City. 

Kunthy has been selling groceries for six years. She buys grocery items fR. the Phnom Penh market for resale in her village. Her husband is a wood house builder. Kunthy's grocery store is old and broken down in some places, so she is applying for her first loan of $300 to build a new one.

loans.use: To build a new grocery store

loans.name: Dorjpurev

texts.en: Dorjpurev is 55 years old and lives with his wife and youngest daughter in Uyurkhangai province in Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  A father of three, Dorjpurev is supporting his youngest daughter while she attends university while the other two children live and work in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Dorjpurev is a craftsman of wooden products, specifically gers and ger furniture.  He started his business in 2004, and has grown it since then.  The summer and fall months are particularly busy for Dorjpurev, because of wedding season, but the winter and spring are slower. He would like to expand his product line to include different types of wooden products so that he can attract more customers during those winter and spring months.  He is requesting a 430,000 tugrug (~300 USD) loan to purchase more wood and supplies for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more wood and supplies

loans.name: Djanati

texts.en: Djanati U. is 32 years old, is married with 3 children ages 10 years, 7 years and 5 years. Djanati has an experience of 6 years selling eggs as a wholeseller. Djanati employs 3 people in her business.  She sells to locals and passersby everyday from 6AM - 630PM. Djanati is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more eggs for her to sell.

loans.use: eggs

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina N. is from the town of Pinig, Dumalinao, ZDS. She is 41 years old. Faustina is married and has six school-age children. To make a living, Faustina owns and operates a business raising crops. She plants and harvests rice for sale. Faustina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Faustina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Faustina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Faustina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Faustina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works to support her husband in providing for the family. 

Adwoa is a trader. She is in the palm-oil production business. She buys the fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies to retailers in her community. She also sells at the local market. Adwoa has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruits in bulk

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita has been married to her husband Wilfredo for 33 years. They are blessed with five children. The oldest among her kids is now 28 years old. Lolita is a rice farmer. She enjoys working at her farm and keeping it in good condition, for it is her main source of income. She wants to earn more so she can help improve her family’s living conditions.

Lolita is a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She requested a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos. With this loan, she will buy seed and fertilizer, and will also pay the laborers who helped at her farm. This loan will be helpful to Lolita and her family.

loans.use: Farm supplies and payroll

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en: Ever since their marriage, Almaz E. and her husband have made a living buying and selling sheep. They do their work with lots of care because they enjoy it and because it allows them to meet their expenses and provide an education for their son. This hard-working mother buys her sheep in nearby towns, then feeds and raises them until they are large enough to sell. Her dream is to give her four beloved children security and an education. She has applied for a loan to make this dream possible by buying more sheep and a calf. She needs your help, and thanks you in advance for your kind support.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and one calf

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” desD. hace 1 año atrás, del distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno, tiene 47 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 04 hijos, D. ellos 2 están a su lado. Ella estudió secundaria incompleta, se dedica a la artesanía.
	
Tomasa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  bayeta, lana.

Su sueño para el futuro es seguir trabajando y comprarse mejores cosas. 

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro que gana.
texts.en:
Tomasa, 47, has been a member of the “La Juleñita” communal bank, which is in Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department, for the last year.
