She is married and has 4 children, 2 of whom are still dependent on her. She did not finish secondary school and she is an artisan. She tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement to increase her capital. She now is requesting 300 new soles with which to by flannel and wool. Her dream for the future is to continue working and to buy herself better things. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flannel and wool.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cows for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Tub-making materials and instruments

loans.name: Rosa Amanda

texts.es:
Muy comprometida con el mejoramiento de su vivienda y el bienestar de su familia, la señora Rosa R. se dedica a laborar arduamente como ama de casa y en conjunto con su esposo ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus dos hijos que dependen de ellos.
Ella ha tomado la decisión de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda iniciando por medio del mejoramiento del área de la cocina y para ello está solicitando un crédito que le permita realizar la compra de los materiales de construcción para crear dicha área de cocina y también crear un pantris.
Ella espera fielmente que su crédito sea otorgado satisfactoriamente y de esta manera llevar a cabo dicha obra para beneficio de sus hijos que tanto ama ya que tendrán una vivienda con mejores condiciones en su localidad en León.
texts.en:
Very determined to improve her home and her family's well-being, Rosa R. works hard as a homemaker. Together with her husband, she has been able to improve the living conditions of their two dependent children. Rosa has decided to improve the condition of her home, beginning with the kitchen area. For this reason she is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy construction materials, to improve this area and create a pantry. With good faith, she hopes that her loan will be funded so that she can realize this project. It will benefit her children, whom she loves very much, because they will have a better home in the town where they live, in the state of León, Nicaragua .

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina T. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old. Avelina is married and has four adult-age children. To make a living, Avelina owns a sari-sari (variety) retail store which primarily sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Avelina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Avelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Avelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Najmuddin

texts.ru: Абдулоев Нажмуддин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Вместе с отцом занимается строительными работами. Короме того разводит крупно- рогатый скот у себя дома. Покупает молодых бычков, откармливает и продает на рынке. Животноводством занимается более 5 лет. Этот бизнес является дополнительным источником дохода. Кредит берет для закупа мелко- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Najmuddin A. lives in the Yavan district. He is 30 years old, married and has 3 children. His wife is a homemaker. Najmuddin and his father do construction work. Besides this, Najmuddin breeds cattle at home. He buys young bulls, fattens and resells them at the market. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years. This business is a sufficient source of income for Najmuddin. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of small livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. is from the city of Mabini Santiago. She is 56 years old and the leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elizabeth E.'s group. Elizabeth is married and has three school-aged children. She has run a general store for the past two years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy C. A. sells rechargeable units for mobile phones at Akotokyire. Lucy has received a senior high education.  She is a single parent with one child. Lucy has been selling mobile phone rechargeable units for not very long. She is responsible for paying school fees, utility bills and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more units cards for all the mobile phone networks to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy more cards to sell.

loans.use: To buy more rechargeable units cards to resell

loans.name: Noem

texts.en:
Mrs. Noem K. is a villager in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province and she was born in 1976. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local public school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

Mrs. Noem K. is a farmer who owns one hectare of land where she grows rice and vegetables to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Phall K., is a palm juice collector who sells sugar palm juice to support the family.

Although they work hard, these jobs do not let them earn much income, so they want to start a new business. Because they do not have enough money to support the new business, Mrs. Noem K. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy fertilizer and rice seed to do farming this current year.

loans.use: To buy a cow, fertilizer and rice seed to do farming.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo S., 58, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country.

She sells fish for an income of about 2 USD per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and a fisherman, earning an income of 4 USD per day to help cover the family expenses.

S. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Burulkan's Group

texts.en:
Burulkan B. 49, is the leader of this group. She has two daughters, both of whom are married and live separately with their families. In order to make money Burulkan and her husband breed cattle to sell. They started this activity three years ago with an initial investment of 6000 soms ($130.26) with which Burulkan bought sheep to breed. She also sells milk, making 4600 soms ($100) per month. Now Burulkan wants to purchase bathrobes to resell. In the future she plans to repair the house and build a shed. 

Kunduzhon N. is 25. Her husband works as a taxi-driver. They have two small sons and a daughter that Kunduzhon cares for. She breeds cattle and cultivates different fruits and vegetables. She wants a loan to purchase a bull-calf for breeding. In the future Kunduzhon plans to increase the number of cattle and save money to purchase a new house in Bishkek.

Zhenishai K. 34, is the treasurer of the group. Her husband works at a sawmill. They have two sons and a daughter. Four years ago Zhenishai, with the initial investment of 5000 soms ($108.55), began to purchase clothes from the sewing workshop in order to resell them. In this way she makes 10000 soms ($217.1) per month. Now she wants to get a loan to purchase summer-season clothes to increase the turnover of her business. 

Tolkunai K. is 36. Her husband works as a welder. They have three sons; the older one goes to school and the others are still too small. Tolkunai takes orders and sews clothes at home. She started this activity three years ago with an initial investment of 2000 soms($53.42) and now she earns 5000 soms ($108.55) per month. With money from the loan she wants to purchase fabrics and increase her turnover. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society); Planet (being environmentally friendly); and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team -- Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: to purchase summer-season clothes to resell

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.en:
Ruslana is married with a teenage daughter. She is a clothing sales entrepreneur selling children's merchandise in the central marketplace of Ivano-Frankivsk called "Trayan". Ruslana has been in this business for 12 years. Her monthly net profit amounts to 4,000 Grivnyas. 

Ruslana is seeking a 5,000 Grivnya loan to purchase 50 jackets, 30 caps, 100 crawler pants and 50 baby underpads. This business is the main source of income for the family. One of the short-term plans Ruslana has is to open one more vending location in her home town, thus expanding her trade and increasing her income.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing merchandise

loans.name: Sokny's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokny C. is 45 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its sixteen members who are located in Pou Khvet village, Takeo province. With their loans, the members of this village will use the money to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Sokny C. is a farmer who owns 1.20-hectares (3-acres) of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, she is also a fruit and Khmer cake seller who is able to earn a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Saroeun Horm, is a government worker who receives a small salary to add to his wife’s income to improve the family living.This couple has two children: one is attending the local school while the youngest one is three years old.


In order to increase her income to improve the family living, Mrs. Sokny C. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig feed for a pig-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and pig feed

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa de 48 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella tiene una tienda en la ventana de su casa (aparece en la foto) para solventar sus gastos.

Ella comenzó a comprar víveres para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos y también pasar mas tiempo con sus hijos, compro bebidas, granos, aceites etc. Cuando crecieron ella continuo con su negocio como no tuvo oportunidad de un local construyo un puesto para la tienda afuera de su casa.  Ahora desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción para su casa como cemento, pinturas. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 year old. She lives in Primavera de Duran (an area in the outskirts of Guayaquil with a deteriorating ecosystem). She has a store in a window of her house (as shown in the photo) to help her meet her expenses. She started buying provisions to help her husband with their expenses, and also to be able to spend more time with her children. She purchased drinks, grains, oils etc. When her children grew up, she continued with the business. Since she didn't have a separate a store, she made a stand outside her home. Since then, she has worked in it from 6:30am until 9:00pm every day. With the loan, she wants to purchase construction materials for her house; materials like cement and paint. In the future, she wants to finish construction on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, paint

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen S. is currently in the business of owning and operating a restaurant that is being managed by two young ladies. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of foodstuffs in the restaurant.

Hellen is 39 years old and is married to a major in the army. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar and install a DStv (Digital Satellite Television) for football channels.

loans.use: To stock more bags of foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila  M. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Cangcu-ay, Brgy. Tan-awan, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  sari-sari (general) store and livestock fattening businesses. Her husband Jorge M., who is 53 years old, works as a welder to support his family. 

Nila joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nila has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of their children. Nila  M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: additional working capital for business

loans.name: Martha Edith

texts.es:
Martha de 54 años, vende comida y distribuye bebidas. Vive en una zona urbana llamada “Orquídeas” fue llamada así porque encontraron una gran cantidad de flores orquídeas en su descubrimiento.  

Ella es madre soltera tiene una hija de 21 años que aun vive con ella, comenzó a vender almuerzos y meriendas para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, también con esfuerzo comenzó a vender agua en botellones y colas. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días con ayuda de su hija. Vende la botella de cola a $ 0.50, la botella de agua a $ 0.30. 

Para poder surtir mas el negocio de bebidas quiere comprar con el préstamo botellas de colas, aguas. En el futuro tiene pensado tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Martha, aged 54, sells meals and drinks. She lives in a urban area called “Orquídeas” (“Orchids”) after the huge number of orchids encountered there when the area was discovered. She is a single mother and her daughter, aged 21, lives with her. She started selling packed lunches and snacks in order to pay for her family’s expenses, to this she then added the sale of water jugs and colas, thus working even harder. She now works form 7 am to 10 pm every day and she can also count on her daughter’s help. She sells a bottle of cola for $ 0.50 and a bottle of water for $ 0.30. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bottles of cola and of water, in order to better supply her drinks stock. In the future she wishes to have a shop of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bottles of waters and colas.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Fatmata T.. She is married and has four children, ages 40, 38, 36 and 16 years. She has four additional dependents who live with her because they are her stepchildren and need support while they are doing their tertiary education. In 2005, Fatmata T. established her business selling provisions such as milk, Ovaltine, sugar, etc., as well as cosmetics and drinks. She began her business in order to generate more income to cover their household expenditures. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 1,448,960 leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

Fatmata T. requires a loan of 4,500,000 SLL in order to purchase more drinks, provisions and some cosmetics. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profit by approximately 173,875 SLL. In the future, Fatmata T. plans to assist her stepchildren with their education and provide support to her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, drinks and some cosmetics

loans.name: Espiranza

texts.en:
Espiranza C. is from the village of Centro 2, San Guillermo, Isabela. She is 28 years old. Espiranza is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Espiranza sells home products such as kitchen supplies, slippers, & other products to local community members. Espiranza has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Espiranza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Espiranza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Espiranza is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Espiranza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Tulia

texts.es:
TULIA M. A.
Tulia es una socia del banco comunal Mujeres Valientes que pertenece a la provincia de Coronel Portillo. Tiene de 55 años de edad,  casada,  su esposo se desempeña como chofer y es madre de 4 hijos,  queriendo mejorar  la situación de su hogar decide sacar un primer préstamo en Manuela Ramos  e invertirlo en venta de comida el cual le alcanzaba para empezar dicho negocio.
Viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos hace 7 años,  se dedica la venta de comida, dando desayunos  desde las primeras horas de la mañana, termina  a las 9 de la mañana y luego se dedica a otra actividad.
Para dar más comodidad a sus clientes, Ha decidido  invertir   los S/. 1,800.00 soles que Manuela Ramos le prestó  en  estos días, comprando  4 juegos de mesas, 4 manteles, 5 paquetes de servilleta,  1 ½ doc. de tazas, 2 docenas de vasos, 1 doc. Platos hondos y 2 fuentes.
La señora Tulia ahora podrá coberturar y/o atender más clientes, el que le da cierta tranquilidad por el trabajo que tiene, le generará mayores ingresos a su hogar, y está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Tulia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valientes” (Courageous Women), which in Coronel Portillo Province. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Her husband works as a chauffeur. Tulia wanted to improve her household situation, so she decided to request her first loan from Manuela Ramos and used the funds to sell food, thereby starting her business.

She started working with Manuela Ramos seven years ago. Tulia sells food, preparing breakfasts in the early morning hours until 9am. Afterwards, she spends time in her other activities. In order to make her customers more comfortable, she decided to invest the loan of 1800 PEN from Manuela Ramos in the purchase of four sets of tables, four tablecloths, five packs of napkins, one and a half dozen cups, two dozen glasses, one dozen plates, and two dozen bowls.

Sra. Tulia will now be able to accommodate and serve more customers, which gives her more peace of mind in her work. Since she will able to generate more income for her home, Tulia is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs, and dishes

loans.name: Lane-Kuru Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Lane-Kuru” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Fatmata K. is the leader of this group. The 32-year-old is married to a businessman and they have two children who are attending primary school. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for three years now; she sells rice. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of rice to sell.

loans.use: buy bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Mona

texts.ar:
منى عمرها حوالي 57 سنة تعمل في بيع الالبسة الجاهزة لها في عملها حوالي 7 سنوات هي متزوجة لديها 2 اولاد تعمل بجد ونشاط تحب عائلتها
تعيل زوجها واولادها تتلقى دعم كبير من محيطها تريد تحسين مستواها المعيشي وتأمين الراحة لعائلتها فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة
جديدة لتطوير المصلحة وزيادة المدخول لا تجد صعوبة في عملها لها سمعة جيدة في محيطها العملي زبائنها جيرانها واقاربها
texts.en: Mona is 57 years old. She has been selling ready-made clothes for seven years. She is married with seven children. Mona works diligently, loves her family, and supports her husband and children. She receives lots of help from those closest to her. Mona strives to increase her income and secure a comfortable life for her family. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, she seeks to purchase new clothes to sell, thereby expanding business and increasing her income. Mona does not find difficulty in her work.  She has a good reputation within the field. Her clients are mainly her neighbors and relatives.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell and expand business

loans.name: Ali Mulwa

texts.en: Ali Mulwa N. is a 55 year old man. He is married to Joecy Ali, who is a housewife, and they are blessed with five children. Ali has been a retail shop owner for the past year. This is his sixth loan from KADET. He plans to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and soap. From the anticipated profits, he plans to add cereals to his business.  He hopes to expand to a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and soap

loans.name: Silviya

texts.en:
Silviya is a small entrepreneur from Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. She runs a food sales business in one of the wholesale markets in her home town. Her vending kiosk is located right next to the market entrance, which has always been a busy spot crowded with potential customers. Silviya has been working as a private entrepreneur for seven years. Presently, she has about 75,000 UAH in inventory. Her income amounts to 6,000 UAH.
Silviya realizes the benefit her business has gained from available lending assistance. She is requesting a 12,000 UAH loan to increase her turnover capital and, as a result, her sales. Silviya realizes there are always needs to be met, especially if you have a family. She is willing to work hard to ensure a decent living for her family. One of her business goals is to open an additional vending location and continue developing her trade in the future.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Teresa es socia del banco comunal El Crédito y vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, también es muy rica en su cultura, tradiciones y gastronomía, Cuenca es cuna de grandes poetas y deportistas.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 64 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes son todos mayores de edad y 3 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su  hijo soltero vive en su casa, trabaja y ayuda  en la economía del hogar. Su esposo es comerciante ambulante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Teresa se dedica a la venta de confitería  actividad que la realiza hace 17 años, tiene un puesto propio y trabaja de 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde  de lunes a viernes.

Es socia de la banca comunal hace 12 años, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más confitería para su negocio. Su meta es  crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa is a member of the communal  bank El Crédito and lives in the center of the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for the archeological beauty of its historical center.  It is also rich in culture, traditions and gastronomy.  Cuenca is the birthplace of great poets and sportsmen.

Our member is 64 years old, married and has 4 children.  All are adults and 3 are married and live on their own.  Her single son lives at home, works and helps with household expenses.  Her husband is a street vendor.  They don’t own their own home so they rent.

Mrs. Teresa works selling sweets which she has done for 17 years.  She has her own stall and works from 6 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon from Monday to Friday.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 12 years.  She will invest her new loan in the purchase of more sweets for her business.  Her goal is to further grow her business.

loans.use: Purchase sweets such as chocolates, candy, gum, lollipops, etc.

loans.name: Unidos Para Vencer 3 Group

texts.en:
Fiordaliza is the coordinator of her group “Unidos para Vencer 3” (United to Win 3). She lives in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. She says that her dream is to have her own house. In the meantime, she enjoys studying. Fiordaliza is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza. She successfully repaid her previous loan that she used to start her business selling shoes. She will use her current loan to buy more shoes to sell.

Fiordaliza joined Esperanza because she wanted to improve her life and have a business. Her story is representative of her fellow group members and of Esperanza’s Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Fiordaliza’s group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water—none of which is potable.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora E. is from the village of Seti in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Nora is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Nora owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of fruits and vegetables for sale. Nora is just starting this business.

In 2011, Nora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Joilyn

texts.en:
Joilyn P. is from the village of Poblacion 1, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 29 years old. Joilyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joilyn owns & operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) shop.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, snack foods, canned goods & toothpaste in the local community. Joilyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Joilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joilyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & sncak foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Joilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Yonita

texts.en:
Yonita J. is from the village of Western Poblacion. She is 58 years old and single. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling seafood products, such as fish and shrimp, in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $119 a month for these activities.

In 2001, Yonita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Yonita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be her 19th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en: Sherlita is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a piggery. She lives in Victorias City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her piggery business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,500. Sherlita is borrowing PHP 17,000 to buy feed for her pigs. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Sherlita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Hebert

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Hebert; él tiene 26 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; el socio es guía de turismo y trabaja con distintas agencias del Cusco operando turismo de aventura y turismo convencional como Valle Sagrado, City tours y tours a Machupicchu, Choquequirao entre otros, el socio es una persona bien alegre y le gusta mucho su carrera ya que le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales y de esta forma el apoya a su hijo que es lo más importante que tiene.

El socio solicita el préstamo para Los estudios de su hijo.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Always Together". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

His name is Hebert. He is 26 years old, married common-law, and he has 1 child. He is a tourist guide and he works with different agencies in Cusco offering adventure and conventional tourism.  He works for agencies such as Valle Sagrado and City Tours offering tours to Machupicchu, Choquequirao and others. He is someone who is very happy and he loves his career because it brings him satisfaction, both financially and personally. This is how he is able to support his child, which is the most important thing. 

He requests a loan to pay for his son's schooling fees.

He is happy to have this loan and he is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to pay for his son's schooling fees

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina A. is 38 years old and is currently in the business of selling alcoholic beverages. She is married to a farmer, and they have five children in school. Her future goal is to take care of her children's educations.

loans.use: stock more alcoholic beverages for resale

loans.name: Gunjmaa

texts.en:
Gunjmaa, age 37, manages an Internet cafe from a rented apartment. She has been engaged in her business for eight months. Before that, she operated a Canon photocopying service for about eight years.
  
Gunjmaa lives with her husband and two children in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a guard at APU Co., Ltd., the country's number one manufacturer of alcoholic drinks. They have two daughters: one is still a baby and the other, age 3, is enrolled in a local kindergarten. 
 
Gunjmaa has worked hard to stabilize her business and has built a strong customer base. She tells us that she plans to open an additional branch in the near future. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy a new computer and computer equipment in order to increase her business revenue.

loans.use: to buy a new computer and computer equipment

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad, vive con sus cuatro hijos y su pareja en su casa propia la cual cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz, ubicado en la zona urbana del Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la ciudad de Calca a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad, agrícola, ganadera y turística que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Actualmente,  Catalina tiene un puesto de venta en el Mercado Modelo de Calca pero el puesto es alquilado. Ya son 10 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En su puesto de venta sus vecinos encuentran toda clase de verduras  (lechuga, asnapa, papa,  perejil, repollo, todo tipo de hortalizas, etc.), con el pequeño negocio que ha colocado Catalina  trata en lo posible de brindar un mejor nivel de vida para su familia mediante los ingresos de sus ventas diarias. Catalina se va dedicar también a la crianza de animales menores como pollos, ella en días festivos se dedica a la venta de caldo de pollo y gallina. 

Mediante una visita a la Asociación Arariwa Catalina trata de adquirir un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para abastecer su puesto de venta de más verduras y así pueda satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, y de paso incrementa sus ingresos.

Catalina es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y una madre responsable con el objetivo de que como familia salgan adelante apunta de esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Catalina is a 34 year-old mother who lives with her four children and partner in her own home which has basic services of water and electricity.  Her home is located in the urban area of The Sacred Valley of the Incas, in the city of Calca, 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.  These areas are noted for their high level of commercial activity and the farming, livestock raising and tourism that their residents work in.

Currently, Catalina has a sales stall in the Mercado Modelo market in Calco but her stall is rented.  She has been in this business for ten years and it is doing very well thanks to the hard work that she puts into her work.  On Catalina's stall, her neighbors find all kinds of vegetables: lettuce, asnapa (a herb), potatoes, parsley, cabbage, etc.  Through her small business and the income from her daily sales, Catalina tries to provide her family with a better quality of life.  Catalina also raises animals such as chickens.  On public holidays she sells chicken and hen soup.

Catalina visited Asociación Arariwa to acquire a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to stock her sales stall with more vegetables so that she could meet her customers' needs and, at the same time, increase her income.

Catalina is known by her neighbors as a cheerful woman who is ready to help others.  She is also a responsible woman whose goal is to get her family ahead in life through her effort and hard work.

loans.use: to stock her sales stall with more vegetables

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rufina; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de fruta al por mayor, ella vende manzanas, naranjas, plátanos, uvas y mandarinas y lo distribuye en los diferentes mercados del distrito de Urubamba, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de fruta. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar frutas al por mayor. 
                                                             
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to the communal bank "Munay Tika." The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the Urubamba province and the department of Cusco.

She is Sra. Rufina. She is 44 years old and is married with four children. She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling fruit wholesale. She sells apples, oranges, bananas, grapes, and mandarins, and she distributes them in different markets in the district of Urubamba. Through this business, she is raising her family. She wants to expand her fruit-selling business. She is applying for the loan to buy more fruit wholesale.

This bank member is happy to have the loan and she promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to buy more fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 46-year-old married man with eight children living in his own permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He takes care of his family with the help of his wife who is a farmer. Their dream is to set up a farm and educate their children.
Patrick has been in the retail business for a year after saving up from the sale of bananas. He has the challenge of limited capital to meet the demands of his customers. His dream is to become a wholesaler. Patrick is requesting a loan to buy salt, sugar and cassava flour for sale.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar and cassava flour for resale.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is married and has a 2-year-old daughter. He runs an educational center, teaching children who are as young as pre-school. Meshack has been running this business for 6 years and employs 8 people. Meshack intends to use his loan to furnish the classes. 

Meshack hopes to continue running a stable business educating children. In the future, he hopes to become a school director at a big school. Meshack describes himself as committed and honest.

loans.use: to furnish the classes in his educational center

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 25 years old, single, and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  Angie owns and operates a service-based business providing passenger services, which she has done for over three years.  Each month, she earns a total of PHP 4,000 from these activities.  

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to pay for the motorcycle registration renewal and maintenance.  Angie has been a member of GDMPc for three months. In the future, Angie hopes to purchase an additional motorcycle and add another business.

loans.use: To pay for the motorcycle registration renewal and maintenance.

loans.name: Baatartsogt

texts.en: Mr. Baatartsogt,  36, lives with his wife and two-year-old son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He has been running a taxi business for eight years and owns three cars for rent, earning MNT 20.000 in a day. Baatartsogt recently bought a small plot of land and now needs to build a fence for it. He is therefore requesting a loan to buy some blocks upon which to build the fence.

loans.use: to buy some blocks to build a fence on his own land.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agnes has five children. Three of the children are in school. She is a married woman.

She has been in this business for four years. She took a loan from BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business .She says that the extra income from this loan will help in building a small store for her business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and green vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mwanakama

texts.en:
Mwanakame is a widowed woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a vegetables stall business, buying tomatoes and potatoes for resale. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation from the market to her place of sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Zina

texts.en:
Zina is from the village of Tsveri, East Georgia. She lives with her husband Amiran. 

Zina and Amiran earn their living through agriculture. They own 1.3 hectares of land, where tomatoes, cabbages, onions, haricot beans, cherries and berries are grown. They sell harvested products locally to greengrocery retailers. The total average income of the family is 1000 laris per month. 

Zina and Amiran decided to start a dairy farm in addition to their other farming activities. Zina requested credit for construction of a cattle shed. After the harvest season, with the earned money they will purchase 2 milk cows. Zina will produce cheese and sell it on the local open market. The new business initiative will increase the income of the family by 30-40%.  Zina and Amiran will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for cattle-shed construction.

loans.name: My

texts.en:
My is 41 years old and is the mother of three children. She is married and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 
My and her husband run a food stall, which they have been operating for over a year. They sell noodles and many kinds of dishes for vegetarians. 
My is requesting a loan to buy new furniture for her stall and purchase more types of food to sell. She hopes this will help her earn more money so she can reinvest in her current business and save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and more types of food to sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Montaser

texts.en:
Montaser is a 40-year-old man who is married and has one son and two daughters. He is a school teacher with a decent salary. 

Montaser has a project of raising poultry and he wants to purchase new feeding and drinking equipment, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Montaser gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay for purchasing new feeding and drinking equipment for the poultry he is raising. In this way, he will improve his project and increase his income to provide better life conditions for the family. Montaser is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new feeding and drinking equipment for poultry.

loans.name: Balikyewuunya Group

texts.en:
Teddy is a 50-year-old, single mother of four children who lives in Kyenjojo,Uganda.  She bears the responsibility of looking after her family.  Teddy's dream is to educate her children to the university level.  For eight years she has been selling local brew.  The income she has earned has enabled her to pay the school fees for her children.  Her challenge is price fluctuation and her dream is to own a store that can supply the whole region.

Teddy requests a loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew for to sell.

loans.name: Jenny Masiel

texts.es: La Sra. Jenny es una mujer casada con 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad; su esposo se dedica a prestar el servicio de taxi, ella es una mujer luchadora con deseos de superación y por ello que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, etc.), artículos de escritorio y escolares, venta de ropa, juguetes  y cosméticos, lleva trabajando así alrededor de 4 años y gana semanalmente S/. 300 nuevos soles. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería (ropa, juguetes, cosméticos, abarrotes) para así surtir más su negocio. Su principal sueño de la Sra. Jenny es tener mas tiendas por toda la ciudad de Ica y tener su propio carro y así darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia. Ella esta muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que con ello va a mejorar sus ventas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Jenny is a married woman with two children, ages 5 and 3; her husband works offering taxi service.  Jenny is a fighter who wants to improve herself, which is why she works selling groceries (rice, sugar, oil, milk, etc.), stationery and school items, clothing, toys, and cosmetics.  She has been doing this work for around four years and earns 300 PEN a week.

With the loan she is going to buy merchandise (clothing, toys, cosmetics, and groceries) to supply her business.

Jenny's main dream is to have more stores throughout the whole city of Ica and have her own car, and so give her family a better standard of living.

She is very grateful for the loan granted since she is going to improve sales in her business with it.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing, toys, cosmetics, and groceries).

loans.name: Babek

texts.en:
Babek, 37, is married and has three children. 

Three years ago he decided to cultivate the land he owned. He did so to generate more income so he could support his family. 

Babek grows wheat, corn, seasonal fruits and vegetables, which he carefully tends so that he can produce a full, healthy harvest. 

He will use the loan of 1,000 AZN to buy seeds and fertilizer that will enable him to improve his yield. Babek enjoys doing this job and that's why he will continue to use loans so he can improve his farm and become a better farmer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Ronal

texts.es: El señor Ronal  tiene como actividad  la producción de estuco y la vende por fanegas a personas que están haciendo construir su casita,  esta actividad la realiza juntamente con su esposa, juntos realizan los trabajos, el momento de la visita se encontraban disparando dinamitas, lo venden quincenalmente en el mismo lugar, esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ellos, en esta ocasión solicitan financiamiento para la compra de un motor para una de las maquinas que el Sr. Ronal  utiliza y así  cubrir la demanda actual que tiene ya que tiene muchos clientes, es una persona trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Ronal has a business producing stucco and sells it by the bucket to people who are building their homes.  He and his wife work together in this business.  At the time of this visit, Ronal was blasting dynamite.  

He sells from the same place every two weeks.  This business is the main source of income for his family.  On this occasion, Ronal is requesting a loan to buy a motor for one of the machines that he uses.  This will help him keep up with the current demand since he already has many customers.  Ronal is a hardworking individual who is grateful for the support that Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy a motor for one of his machines.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin has been in the farming business for almost 25 years. He plants his farm with corn crops.He is 56 years old and married with five children. It is through farming that he was able to earn an income to provide for his family needs. 

Benjamin would like to request a loan of PHP 27,000 which will be used to buy necessary materials for his farming business. He believes that through his sacrifices and proper management of his corn farm he could become a successful farmer someday. In addition, he could also send his children to a higher level of education and save some money for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy materials necessary for his farming business

loans.name: Bienvenida De Jesus

texts.es:
La joven Bienvenida de Jesus tiene 26 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio propio que es la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, ahi vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica familiar, sus clientes son sus vecinos y amigos, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio, tambien desea comprar ropa, ya que la epoca de navidad esta por llegar y quiere aprovechar a vender ropa que es uno de los productos que mas se venden en la navidad.
Junto con ella vive su esposo y su hija, por quien dia a dia trabaja muy fuerte para sacarla adelante.
texts.en: Bienvenida de Jesus, 26, is a young woman, entrepreunerial and determined to make her own way in the world.  She owns a retail business selling everyday products.  She operates the business from a space in her house.  Her customers are her friends and neighbors.  She will use this loan to stock her business.  She also wants to buy seasonal clothing because Christmas is coming and clothing is among the merchandise most in demand this time of year.  Beinvenida de Jesus lives with her husband and daughter and she's working night and day to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Rikas Group

texts.en:
Ireen is a fifty-six-year-old woman who lives in a small town called Kwekwe. She is married and has four children. She is in the agriculture business of poultry and has been in the business for 12 years. 

Ireen says challenges being faced in the business include shortage of chicken feed, shortage of equipment during the winter period, late payments by debtors and regular power cuts as well as competition. Ireen has requested a loan of $400. With the income generated from this loan she will better the standard of living of her family and also increase disposable income together with her husband's salary.

In future Ireen is  planning to own a chicken meat market in Kwekwe's central business district and also expand into wholesaling eggs.

loans.use: To buy chicks, chicken feed and medication.

loans.name: Gloria Orlinda

texts.es: La señora Gloria Orlinda a sus 44 años de edad se dedica en su propio taller ubicado en su casa a la confección de ropa de mujer, con una experiencia de mas de 10 años en esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a sus dos hijos y apoyado económicamente a sus padres. La señora Gloria desea sacar una producción de camisas para dama para ofrecer a sus clientes, pero no cuenta con los insumos necesarios para tal fin, por lo que necesita de la compra de telas e hilos con lo cual pueda hacer sus prendas y así generar los recursos necesarios para su sustento y el de sus padres.
texts.en: 44-year-old Gloria Orlinda makes women's clothes, and has her own workshop at home. She has more than 10 years experience of more than 10 years in this business and has raised her two children and financially supported her parents. Gloria want to produce blouses to offer her customers, but does not have the supplies needed for this product. She needs to purchase fabric and thread with which to make the garments and generate the income to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread for producing blouses.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 28 years old and married. They have two children. She has been running a used clothing sales business for the last seven years earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 30,000. She will use the loan to purchase additional stocks of trousers, shirts,T-shirts and tracksuits. With the anticipated profits, she will educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to start another business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy trousers, tracksuits, skirts and T-shirts to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Elvira has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Lado's Group

texts.en:
Lado is a very talented lady and has skills of making artificial jewelry, particularly nose pins. These jewelry items are very popular in marriages due to the fact that gold has become very costly and not everyone can afford it. 

Her husband is a vegetable seller while 3 of her 4 children work to financially contribute to the family. 

Lado has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further improvement of her artificial jewelry-making business. 

With the loan investment, she will buy beads and other materials for making artificial jewelry in larger quantities which will help her fulfill client orders on time and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy beads and other materials for her artificial jewelry-making business.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is a hairdresser living in Kapan town of Syuniq region. 
She lives with her husband and works at the local beauty salon. 
Because of her nice attitude and professional work as a hairdresser, she has a big client base. Ani requested this loan to purchase hair paints, materials and tools for hairdressing service. This will help Ani a lot in her work as a hairdresser and she greatly hopes to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for hair paints, materials and tools for hairdressing service

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is married with 4 children all of them in college. She is a Chairlady of a home cell in her church and a retired primary teacher.

She has a stall at Mizizi market where she sells vegetables while carrying on her teaching profession. She says she would not have managed to educate her children to university level had it not been the income from this small business. Her husband comes in once in a while when she needs help and this has helped her very much.

loans.use: She wants to buy a dairy cow to start selling milk because in her area there aren’t many people who sell milk yet the demand is so high. This will give her the opportunity to improve her diet and earn extra income.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is divorced with a teenage son. After her husband left the family, Ludmila was forced to find ways to provide for her family. She did some market research and decided to take a risk and borrow some money to start a business selling warm clothing. She rented a large shipping container at the local city market and purchased coats, jackets and other winter clothing to offer for sale. Ludmila has now been in business for 8 years, working hard to meet the needs of her customers. At her kiosk patrons always feel welcome as she gives each one her full attention and serves them politely and with respect. Her reasonable pricing and variety of inventory appeal to many modest clients. Ludmila has promptly repaid all 8 loans she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”. She understands the value of lending services that have helped her business grow and become self-sustainable. Ludmila is requesting a loan of $1,000 to increase her retail inventory. She is planning to purchase a variety of weatherproof, insulated jackets, parkas, and vests as well as jean outfits that will be both durable and practical for a variety of customers. Having an assortment of inventory at exceptional prices will meet customer demand and draw many potential new clients to her business. In the future Ludmila would like to purchase another container and hire a person to help her with sales allowing her to generate additional profits to help finance her son’s education.

Людмила – одружена, в неї є син-підліток. Після того, як чоловік покинув родину, Людмила була змушена сама шукати можливостей забезпечити родину. Вона дослідила ринок, вирішила ризикнути та позичила грошей для того, щоб почати власний бізнес з продажу теплого одягу. Людмила орендувала велику крамницю-контейнер на міському ринку, купила пальта, куртки та інший теплий зимовий одяг для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Людмила займається цим бізнесом вже 8 років. Вона наполегливо працює для того, щоб задовольнити потреби її покупців. В її кіоску кожен клієнт завжди почувається комфортно, тому що Людмила вміє ввічливо та привітно обслужити кожного покупця. Помірні ціни та розмаїття товару приваблюють багатьох клієнтів. Людмила своєчасно сплатила 8 позик від „Надії України”. Вона розуміє цінність кредитних послуг, які сприяли зростанню та процвітанню її бізнесу. Людмила просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб збільшити обсяги товару для роздрібної торгівлі. Вона планує купити різноманітні теплі куртки, плащі, пальта, а також якісний та практичний джинсовий одяг, який сподобається багатьом покупцям. Широкий асортимент товарів за помірними цінами задовольнить попит покупців, а також привабить багатьох нових клієнтів. В майбутньому Людмила планує придбати ще одну крамницю-контейнер, а також взяти на роботу ще одну людину для торгівлі на ринку. Це допоможе Людмилі отримати додатковий прибуток, а також сплатити за навчання її сина.

loans.use: To increase clothing inventory

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large marking centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Juliana D. is a resident of Nkurankan and sells plastic containers house to house. She is also a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is however seeking a Kiva loan of $700.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: Sells plastic containers house to house.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru:
A. Mavzuna is selling children’s clothes on a Panjshanbe central market. She has been an entrepreneur for no more than 5 years, but she became a client of Microinvest only recently. She started her business from selling chilren’s clothes. She is obtaining and delivering his products by herself. She is divorced and has 3 children. Her children go to school; she is working days and nights for their education. She has nowhere to get the help from; that is why she asked Microinvest for support. She is hoping to receive a loan for 400$ for buying and selling goods and to use profits to provide her children with all the necessary needs.

Translated from Russian by Asya Lisak, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдувалиева Мавзуна торгует детской одеждой в центральном рынке «Панчшанбе». Предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не более 5 лет, но клиенткой «Микроинвест» стала только недавно. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. За товаром ездит сама. Она разведена и у нее подрастают 3 детей. Ее дети учатся в школе, и для их обучения она трудится день и ночь. Ей не откуда ждать помощи, поэтому она обратилась в Микроинвест за поддержкой. Она надеется получить займ 400$ для приобретения и реализации товаров, а от прибыли обеспечить своих детей всеми необходимыми нуждами.

loans.use: для расширения бизнеса

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
José Ángel is an enthusiastic and enterprising man. He is single. Five years ago he started his own business selling cheeses. He only studied as far as secondary school. His lack of education was allowing him to take only poorly paying, temporary jobs. At the suggestion of family members, he started selling these products. He has succeeded in developing himself as a microentrepreneur, and continues to expand his sales area. José's desire to get ahead motivates him to improve the quality of his service and to continue growing his business.

At the moment José needs a loan of $275, which he will use to purchase the merchandise he needs to cover current demand for his products. He commits to repaying the loan in 3 months. Be an important part of José's life and contribute to the development of his business. He sincerely appreciates your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

José Ángel es un hombre emprendedor y entusiasta, es soltero y desde hace cinco años comenzó su propio negocio con la venta de quesos, él solo estudio hasta la secundaria y la poca educación que tiene solo le permitía conseguir trabajos eventuales y poco remunerados, ante la invitación de unos familiares comenzó vendiendo estos productos donde se ha logrado desarrollar como microempresario, incrementando cada vez más su área de ventas. Las ganas que José tiene de salir adelante lo impulsan a mejorar la calidad de su servicio y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

En estos momentos José necesita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda por sus productos, él se compromete regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de José y contribuye al desarrollo de su negocio, él agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Melida

texts.es:
Sra. Melida belongs to the "Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Working Women) community bank in Ucayali, a region or "departamento" of Peru. She's 43 years old and the mother of 2 children.

Melida earns a living making clothes, e.g., shirts, blouses, lingerie, etc. With an initial loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$94), she was able to make a down payment on a sewing machine. She and her husband now jointly operate the business, selling her products for both cash and on credit.

With a recently granted loan of S/.1,700 (about US$575) from Manuela Ramos, to be repaid in 6 installments, Melida will be able to maintain her sewing maching and buy raw materials (20 meters of cotton cloth, a dozen spools of thread, a roll of lace and buttons).

She's very happy with her sewing business and that she'll be able to extend credit to those people who can't immediately pay in cash.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Melida pertenece al Banco Comunal "Mujeres Trabajadoras", del Jr. César Calvo de Araujo 898 del sector del arenal del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 43 años de edad y es madre de 2 hijos.

Melida se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir como son: polos, blusas, shor's, lencería, etc. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) pudo dar la inicial de una máquina de coser, ahora conjuntamente con su pareja realizan esta actividad donde venden al contado y al crédito con cuotas de pago de S/. 2.00 diarios.

Con el préstamo recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,700 (US$ 575.00 aprox.), que cancelará en 6 cuotas, podrá dar mantenimiento a la máquina de coser, además podrá comprar 20 metros de telas de algodón, 1 docena de hilos, 1 cono de blondas y un ciento de cierres.

Ella está muy contenta de trabajar en la costura y con la venta poder dar facilidades a aquellas personas que no cuentan con efectivo en ese momento.

loans.use: Buy materials and supplies at wholesale. Pay for upkeep on sewing machine.

loans.name: Jessica Tania

texts.es:
Tania is an enterprising 22-year-old girl, who four years ago decided to open her bakery with the support of her beloved parents, Juana and Samuel. Currently, thanks to the variety of bread and mainly to the good treatment with which she attends to every one of her clients' requests, this business is providing her with a lot of happiness with the favorable results that she is obtaining satistying the daily need of her small community. The dream of this beautiful young woman and her charming mother is to make their bakery one of the most popular in their native town, Ayaviri. To secure their dreams, they are willing to work much more and strive to consolidate their business to make their dreams a reality. They are requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials to keep producing their delicious and incomparable breads. With the economic benefits that they obtain from the investment of capital, they will offer a better quality of life to the members of their family. Tania and her beloved mother, Juana, are already very happy for your help and contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Tania es una emprendedora muchacha de 22 años de edad, hace cuatro años decidió aperturar su panadería contando con el apoyo de sus queridos padres, Juana y Samuel. Actualmente gracias a la variedad de panes y principalmente al buen trato con la que atiende cada una de las solicitudes de sus clientes, este negocio les está otorgando alegría, con los favorables resultados que va obteniendo está satisfaciendo la necesidad diaria de su pequeña comunidad.El deseo de esta bella joven y su encantadora madre es convertir a su panadería en una de las más y solicitadas de su pueblo natal, Ayaviri. Para concretar sus anhelos están dispuestas a trabajar mucho más y a esforzarse con el fin de consolidar su negocio y para hacer realidad sus deseos, ellas solicitan un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de insumos para seguir elaborando sus deliciosos e incomparables panes y con los beneficios económicos que obtengan luego de esta inyección de capital ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a los miembros de su familia. Tania y su querida madre Juana desde ya se encuentran muy contentas por tu ayuda y colaboración.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to keep producing her delicious bread with the goal of consolidating the family business in a short time.

loans.name: Safina's Group

texts.en:
Safina B. wants to expand her business in order to display more fish to her customers (raw and fried fish).

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To expand her business premises

loans.name: Constancio

texts.en:
Constancio Giménez is a 75 year old man who is married with a son who is a student at a local university. Since 1998 his business has been in the area of construction material sales. He originally began his store with the help of Fundación Paraguaya and it has since flourished. He sells bricks, tiles, cement, quicklime, sand and other materials.

With this business he is continuing to collect income to support his family and his son’s college expenses. At this time, Constancio is in need of a loan because demand has been high for his materials and services. He will use the money to buy supplies for his construction store.

loans.use: To buy construction materials like bricks ,tiles, cement, and quicklime.

loans.name: Taiba

texts.en:
K. Taiba is 35 years old. She is married with three children.

Taiba sells fabrics like coarse calico, cheesecloth, linen and other cotton textiles. She has been in this business for several years. The business is a family one; Taiba's  sister and the brother help her by working in the market as sellers. Together with relatives, Taiba purchases the goods and rents the store in the local market of the city.  Taiba's husband is a carpenter; his work is of a seasonal nature which is why he also  helps his wife when he has no orders.  Now Taiba is planning to expand the inventory in order to increase the range of goods available for sale. With this purpose she requests 3 400.00 Somoni (1 000.00 US Dollars) for the term of 6 months. Taiba thanks all for support and promises to pay the loan back  on time.

loans.use: Purchasing cotton textiles like coarse calico, cheesecloth, and linen for increasing the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Yen, age 48, lives with her husband and two children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her entire family members. Her husband Mr. Nou Seoun, 60, works as a motor-taxi driver, earning around four dollars a day. One of the children works at a hotel with a salary $60 a month and the other helps at home. Three other children are married and live outside the family home.

Mr. Seoun would like to request a loan to combine with his savings, and purchase a new motor-taxi for his son to begin a business to sustain the family. He is grateful for the help with this purchase. (Mrs. P. Yen and her husband Mr. Nou Seoun are pictured together)

loans.use: To purchase a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Blás

texts.en:
Blas R. is 25. He is married to Claudia Diaz (who is 21) and they have a five year old boy. Fifteen years ago, Blas started working with his father going door-to-door selling different products. This experience gave Blas a great opportunity to learn how to deal with customers.

Five years ago, he started his own business selling things door-to-door by motorbike. He calls his business “Macatero”. Blas is a well-known merchant in his town and he has the skills and experience required for a successful business; now, he has a wide range of customers. Every morning, Blas wakes up at 4 o'clock to begin his busy day.

Blas would use the money provided by the loan to purchase more products to sell, including curtains, sauce pans, and sheets.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory, including curtains, sauce pans, and sheets

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G. sells footwear and clothing. She is divorced, and has 3 children. Raising 3 children single handed has not been easy for her. Business is going very well, so Ceclia wishes to increase sales. But she is running out of stock.

She is asking for a loan to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Lor

texts.en:
Lor S., 46, sells Cambodian porridge and noodles from her house and earns around $ 3.30 per day. Her husband, Mr. Mat Sos, 47, earns around $5 per day growing crops behind their house. They have five children and live in Thlork Kambot Village, Siem Reap Province. All of their children are young and cannot generate any income.

Because she desires to increase their income, Lor S. is seeking a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase piglets to raise. The loan will help expand her business and increase the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Mrs. V. is the owner of a small grocery store where she offers a variety of products for the home. This business is run by her and her children. She lives in her own house. Aside from this source of income she also runs a small bakery where she provides work for 2 other family members.

She is married and has 4 children who are already married and do not depend on her. Her clients are people from the area. She sells bread to the grocery stores in the adjacent areas carrying on her transactions in cash and on credit, collecting payments bi-weekly.

One of her wishes is to better equip her bakery, in terms to the store structure and equipment, especially because her oven in for crafts and is not an industrial oven.

Another one of her dreams is to remodel her store to make it larger and to be able to offer all products needed for the home, from her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora V., es propietaria de una pulpería donde ofrece una variedad de productos del hogar, dicho negocio es administrado por ella misma y sus hijos, vive en casa propia, ademas de estos ingresos tiene una pequeña panadería, donde genera fuentes de empleo para 2 personas siendo familiar el negocio. Es casada tiene 4 hijos que ya estan casados, no dependen de ella, en cuanto sus clientes estos son personas del sector, venden lo que es el pan a pulperias de los barrios aledaños de contado y credito que recupera cada quince dias. Uno de sus deseos es acondicionar mejor su pequeña panadería, en cuanto a local y maquinaria, ya que su horno actual es artesanal y no industrializado. Otro de sus deseos es poder acondicionar un local mas grande para ofertar todos los productos para el hogar relacionados con su pulpería.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr:
