Né en 1966 à Aklakou, Monsieur K. Anani est marié et a huit personnes à charge. Depuis 15 ans, il s’est spécialisé dans le stockage d’huile de palme et du gari en temps d’abondance et de leur vente en période de soudure.

La commercialisation de ses aliments très consommés au sud du TOGO, lui permettait d’assurer à son ménage, le minimum vital.

Mais aujourd’hui, son bénéfice ne lui permet plus d’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie à ses enfants. Pour augmenter son pouvoir d’achat aux fins de maximiser de bénéfice et sortir sa famille de l’extrême pauvreté, il sollicite un crédit.

Ceci lui permettra de sécuriser son revenu et de dégager un bénéfice consistant dans la mesure où ce fonds lui servira de fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Aklakou, Mr. Anani K. is married with eight dependents. For 15 years, he has specialized in the storage of palm oil and gari (manioc flour) during times of surplus, and sales in times of shortage.

Selling these foods, which are widely consumed in southern Togo, has allowed him to provide the minimum necessary support to his household.

But today, his income does not allow him to provide the best living conditions for his children. To increase his purchasing power in order to maximize his profit and get his family out of extreme poverty, he is requesting a loan.

This will allow him to have a secure income and make a solid profit since this financing will be used as working capital.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stocks of flour and palm oil

loans.name: Peggy Luz

texts.es:
La señora Peggy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, ubicado en Jr: Bolognesi Nº 224, distrito de Manantay, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad que aun dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en la pesca. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de pescado.

En la actualidad cuenta con el mismo negocio. Peggy y su esposo trabajan juntos, además ambos se levantan muy temprano para cumplir con su deber y apoyar a sus queridos hijos. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,800, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de pescado. Diariamente compran de 2 a 3 bandejas para realizar su actividad.
   
Peggy siente que ha mejorado su estabilidad económica gracias a la ayuda que le brinda el banco comunal de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Peggy is a member of the communal bank “Las Brisas” which is located at Jr. Bolognesi No. 224, district of Manantay, in the Ucayali department. She is 23 years old and is the mother of three young children. She is married and her husband works as a fisherman. She invested the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos in the sale of fish.

She is currently in the same business. Peggy and her husband work together. They both get up very early to do their duty and support their much loved children.

She will invest this loan of $600, which will be repaid in 4 months, in purchasing fish. They buy 2 to 3 trays of fish every day for their business. Peggy feels that she has improved her economic stability thanks to the help that the communal bank Manuela Ramos provides her.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of fish.

loans.name: Aom

texts.en:
Mrs. Aom S. is a villager in Prey Kduoch Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who earns very little. Her husband, Mr. Ol Ann, uses a motorbike pulling a cart to transport passengers as a source of income. His motorbike is very old so he spends a lot of money on gas and repairs.

In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Aom S. has decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business. Mrs. Aom S. is 36 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom helps their father while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is also shown in the photo.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Amavi D. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de chaussures depuis 5 ans à Atakpamé, un village situé à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle espère avec ce crédit accroître la capacité de son commerce en alimentant son magasin. Cette chance lui permettra de gagner plus pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amavi D. is 40 years old, married, and the mother of two. She has been a shoes retailer for five years in Atakpamé, a village located about 170 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She hopes to use this loan to grow her commerce by filling her store. This opportunity will enable her to earn more in order to provide for her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Sra. C. es una mujer con gran decisión, tiene la gran responsabilidad de ser la jefe de familia, al igual trabaja en oficinas del gobierno para solventar la educación de sus pequeños.
Ella tiene su casita y con préstamos anteriores ha ido realizando varios cambios, sin embargo aún le falta gran cantidad de mejoras. En esta ocasión, desea levantar las bardas en la parte frontal de la vivienda, este proyecto es fundamental para salvaguardar la integridad de su familia. 
Estará muy agradecida con todos los que deseen apoyarla, en cuanto se logren los planes mencionados se les mantendrá informados.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. is a very decisive woman, with great responsibility as the head of household. In addition, she works in the offices of the government in order to pay for her children’s educations. She has a small house and, with previous loans, has completed various changes. Regardless, she still needs to make a number of improvements. On this occasion, she would like to heighten the walls on the front part of the home. This project is an integral part of safeguarding the integrity of her family. She would be very grateful to all those who would choose to support her and, as she completes the aforementioned plans, she will keep everyone informed on the progress.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For materials and labor for some walls.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena tiene 46 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos. Siempre estuvo trabajando en el comercio, pero en diversos lugares, hace 5 años pudo al fin, abrir en un mercado, su propio puesto D. plastiquería, donD. también  venD. diversos adornos para decoraciones y festividades, ahora por navidad venD. todo tipo D. adornos para que las personas decoren sus arbolitos y sus casas. Fechas como éstas hacen que su negocio sea muy rentable y pueD. tener ventas mayores, las cuales aprovecha, aunque el trabajo sea arduo y cansado por la cantidad D. personas que vienen a comprar. Magdalena está en su tercer crédito con MFP, y siempre ha sido puntual en sus pagos y como una D. las líderes da el ejemplo a las demás socias D. su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad D. mercadería para aprovechar la demanda que hay por estas fechas.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a 46-year-old single mother who lives with her two children. She has always been a businesswoman, but she’s been at many different locations. Five years ago, her “plastiquería” (plastic goods shop) opened in a market, where she also sold ornaments for decoration and holidays. Now she sells Christmas decorations for people’s homes and Christmas trees. The busiest days for Magdalena’s shop are highly profitable. The high sales are worth it, even though the work is difficult and tiring because of the sheer number of customers. Magdalena is on her third loan with MFP and has always maD. her payments on time; she’s an example to other members of her community bank. With the money she’s requested, Magdalena plans to buy plenty of merchandise to take advantage of the busiest occasions.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise for sale

loans.name: Usmonjon

texts.en:
Usmonjon N. is married with three children. This is an average family from Khujand, Tajikistan. However, Usmonjon is a unique entrepreneur. Together with his wife he has been selling women's underwear in the central city market for about 8 years. The secret of his success is simple: he tries to not only let their customers know the benefits of their products – he also gives them a sense of belonging which brings them back again and again.

However, Usmonjon doesn’t want to stop where he is with his venture. Usmonjon is seeking a loan of 1000 USD to replenish the merchandise in his store. We believe that Usmonjon’s desire to excel by pleasing his customers will determine his further success and encourage new customers to buy from him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing underwear for women for re-sale

loans.name: Juana Evelia

texts.es:
Juany inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que tuvo oportunidad de trabajar en alguna empresa porque estudio una carrera universitaria pero no quizo descuidar la educación de sus hijos, fue por eso que decidío emprender una actividad que le permitiera tener más libertad de horario. Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 2006, gracias a su abuelita que le enseño a elaborar una gran variedad de comidas y como no tenía utensilios para iniciar el negocio tuvo que pedirlos prestados a sus  vecinas la cuales la apoyaron de esta manera y  le ha ido muy bien.

Poco a poco fue comprando  utensilios de cocina como ollas, vaporeras, cucharas, vasijas, etc., y de esta manera ya no tiene que pedirlos prestados y puedo ahorrarse tiempo en la elaboración de sus comidas.
Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5300 que pagara en 10 catorcenas.
Con este crédito va a poder comprar materia prima para elaborar sus comidas y reemplazar algunos utensilios de cocina que debido al uso ya se encuentran en malas condiciones, todo esto le permitirá darle un mejor servicio a mis clientes.
texts.en:
Juany began a business to help her husband with the household expenses. She had the opportunity to work in a company because she did complete university studies but she didn’t want to ignore her children’s education so she decided to start a business that would enable her to have a more flexible schedule. She began the business in March 2006, thanks to her grandmother who showed her how to make a large variety of dishes and as she didn’t have any utensils to start her business she had to borrow some from her neighbors who supported her by lending her equipment. Her business has gone well for her. Little by little she has been buying kitchen utensils such as pots, steamers, spoons, etc. and in this way she didn’t have to borrow any and she could save time in making her food. She needs a loan for $5300 MXN which will be repaid in 10 bimonthly payments. With this loan she is going to be able to buy raw ingredients to make her dishes and replace some kitchen utensils that, due to use, are in poor condition. All this will enable her to provide better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita S. is a fish vendor. She is 47 years old and has 5 children. Her husband is a fisherman. Whenever her husband catches plenty of fish she sells them to her regular buyers. She also buys fish from other fishermen. She retails all the fish and earns a reasonable profit which she uses to feed and clothe her family. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fishing materials. She will buy fishing nets as well as bait. Some of her loan she will use to start a new business. She dreamed of having a small store someday. In that way, she has another source of income to pay the tuition and book fees of her children.

CEVI provides its clients with credit assistance to manage their businesses. It also supplies training and insurance coverage to make their businesses grow.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a delightful woman, who would like to repair the broken cement floor in her house. She is a mother and grandmother, and operates a used clothing business. After visiting her home, Esperanza's Home Improvement Department concluded that a completely new cement floor is needed to repair her existing one. Maria is approved for this new loan, because of her success with Esperanza's small business loans. Thank you for helping make her dream a reality!

loans.use: New cement floor

loans.name: Mrs. Ant Inn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ant I. has been selected president by the sixteen members of this village bank. She is a rice farmer who owns a plot of land. In this plantation, she faces obstacles because her field is infertile and she does not have enough money to buy rice seed. To deal with these problems, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She will use the rest of the money to buy piglets to start a breeding business. She is a 55-year-old widow with two children: one is a construction worker and the other is a seller.

This village bank is located in Trapeang Lean village in Takeo province. The other members plan to use the loans which they obtain for different purpoS.. Ten members in this group loan have end-of-term loans (the borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.) The rest have monthly payment loans.

End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial for Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed and piglets

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en: Vasif was born in 1983. He lives in the village of Murshud Oba in the Khachmaz region.  He started his farming business two years ago. Now he needs a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Denis Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Denis Alfonso R. Pérez, tiene la edad de 34 años, habita en el barrio Buena Vista Nidirí junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como domestica y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos, los cuales estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace catorce años , se dedica a la rectoría de una iglesia evangélica, la mayor dificultad que se la presentado es en cuanto a lo económico por la enfermedad de su hija , el quiere el financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que el techo de la vivienda está muy deteriorado y en tiempo de invierno , el agua se filtra en casi toda la casa, lo cual espera poder evitar cambiándolo y darle mas seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Denis Alfonso R. P. is 34 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Buena Vista Nidirí with his wife, who works as a maid to support the household expenses. They have two children, who are currently studying. Their plans are to improve the living conditions of their family. He has been working as a director of an evangelical church for the last fourteen years. The biggest challenge that he is facing is his economic situation due to his daughter illness.

He is asking for a loan to finance the purchase of building materials to fix the roof of his house. It is very deteriorated and during winter water seeps into almost everywhere in the house; which he hopes to avoid replacing the roof and keep his family safe.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair the roof of his house

loans.name: Walter Jose

texts.es: Walter es casado, de 28 años de edad, su esposa Yessenia Cerna Miranda de 23 años, no trabaja fuera, pero en la casa realiza todas las labores y cuida a su hijo de 2 años.   El trabaja en la alcaldia de Juigalpa como obrero ayudante de ejecucion y mantenimiento de proyectos desde hace 10 años.  Esta solicitando su 2do credito que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construccion como zinc, perlines, cemento para embaldozar, comprar puertas y ventanas si el dinero ajusta; el levanto paredes con el credito anterior, pero no fue reportado como Kiva, en eta oportunidad fue favorecido por este organismo y se siente muy contento porque de esta manera dara continuidad a su vivienda hasta el sueño de su vida dar una vivienda digna a su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is married: he is 28 years old and his wife Yessenia Cerna Miranda is 23 years old. She doesn't work, but looks after all the household chores and cares for their 2 year old son. He works in the town of Juigalpa assisting with the execution and maintenance of projects for the last 10 years. He is asking for his second credit which he will use to buy construction materials such as zinc, purlins, cement for tiling, and to purchase doors and windows if the money allows. He put up walls with the previous credit, but this wasn't reported on Kiva. This time, he has been favoured by this organization and he is very happy because as a result he will be able to continue improving his home until he realises his life's dream of providing his family with a dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Sisigafua

texts.en: Sisigafua V., 58, is married and has eight children. She has two years of experience in the taro plantation and segetable business. She sells to the village people three days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (about $140 USD). SPBD loans are Sisigafua’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase weed killling spray, chemicals, spades, ax, wheelbarrow and planting instruments

loans.name: Noemi Liliana

texts.es:
Noemí es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.
Noemí es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Noemí junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra y venta de carros, su esposo tiene un taller de planchado y pintura, en donde pintan a los carros que serán comercializados.
Noemí necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pinturas.
Los sueños de Noemí son tener una tienda de pinturas y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Noemí is a member of the Manantial Communal Bank Group.

She is 23 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one son. Together with her husband, they buy and sell cars. Her husband has an auto body shop where he paints the cars for resale.

Noemí is requesting a loan of 900 soles to buy automotive paint. She dreams of opening a paint store and having her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase automotive paint

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: Alona S. is 37 years old and is married to Mr. Jun S.. She has five children and lives in Brgy. Canroma, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She is a dedicated wife who is determined to help her husband improve their life situation. Mrs. S. has been engaged in food production for the past fifteen years. She and her husband, with the help of their older children, sell snack food, corn, vinegar and other food products to the neighboring towns, especially where there is a fiesta going on (and there is always a fiesta going on somewhere in the island of Negros). This is not easy work because they need to wake up early to travel and set up their station, stay up late selling their product, and when the crowds are gone, pack up and go home. However, it earns a good income of about PHP 9,800 per month, so they persevere because it sustains the education of some of their children, and the needs of the family. Hard work, patience and discipline are the key elements to Mrs. S.'s continuing success. Mrs. S. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 and the unsecured loans she has borrowed over the last ten years have enabled her to make her business a sustainable endeavor which is a great help to their family. At present, Mrs. S. needs to purchase a transport vehicle to facilitate the delivery of her products and transport them from town to town as they transfer selling locations. This is why, for her 17th loan, Mrs. S. is borrowing PHP 19,500 so that, with her own transportation, she will be able to reach farther and stay longer in the towns and not be dependent on the availability of public transportation. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to facilitate delivery

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: La señora Graciela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de Guadalupe II”, distrito de Bagua Grande, Provincia Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es separada, tiene 42 años tiene 2 hijos, que están estudiando.  La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu, energía emprendedora que posee ella decide iniciar su negocio con un capital de S/. 50.00 comenzó vendiendo poco, compraba y vendía, hasta conocer mas gente, tener mas clientes hasta finalmente decide emprender con mas fuerza este negocio, ahora también cría en su casa donde tiene una huerta muy amplia. Ella sola es quien decide y maneja su negocio.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, comprará mas aves de corral como gallinas, pavos, patos y cuyes que son animales que tienen acogida sobretodo en los restaurantes donde venden comida de la región, compra de diversos tamaños para variar sus precios y vender mas, así como también mantener a su clientela satisfecha.Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
La señora Graciela belongs to the cooperative bank "Virgen de Guadalupe II," Bagna Grande district, Utcubamba Province, Amazonas Department. She is separated, 42 years old, and has two children who are in school. With her enterprising energy and faced with the necessity to improve her children's standard of living, Graciela decided to start her business with $18 in capital. She began by selling a little, by buying and selling, until she knew more people and had more customers. Finally, she decided to put more effort into this business. Now she also raises birds at home, where she has a large garden. She alone manages her business. With this loan of $350, she will buy more domestic birds such as chickens, turkeys, ducks, and those animals in demand above all in restaurants where food of the region is sold. She buys different-size birds in order to offer a variety of prices and increase sales; in this way, she also satisfies her customers. She is very satisfied with her work, although the work is hard and she has to rise early. She believes that her sacrifice is worthwhile in order to achieve the dreams and goals that she has in her life. For these reasons, she is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the help they have given to her and other women who want to raise their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will purchase more domestic birds

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny R., age 39, and her husband, Mr. Sarun Am, age 32, have been married since 1991 and have two sons. One of them is adopted and he is a policeman. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh about 17 kilometers away.

Vanny has been a farmer for 20 years. She grows rice on her farmland in the village, while her husband has been selling cows for ten years.  Vanny is requesting her first loan of $550 to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her farming business and she will use a part of her loan to buy additional cows and oxen for her husband to sell.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her farming business and buy additional cows and oxen for her husband to sell

loans.name: Dovi Tawiah

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente de friperie dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé ; cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans le foyer pour l’éducation scolaire de leurs 03 enfants. Elle a débuté ce commerce en 2003 et s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé à l’ouverture des bals de friperie. Elle a loué une place dans le marché où elle est bien connue de beaucoup de clients qui lui sont restés fidèles. Elle vend des vêtements pour dames et enfants ; actuellement elle a besoin de disposer d’un nouveau stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 bals de friperie
texts.en:
This woman has a revenue generating business, selling second-hand clothing in the market of Hédzranawoé, in the city of Lomé. This business enables her to pay for her 3 children's school tuition. She started her business in 2003 and supplies herself with goods from the big market in Lomé at the opening of bales of second-hand clothing. She rents a space in the market, where she is well-known by many clients who are faithful to her. She purchases clothing for women and children. She currently needs new stock; it is for this reason that she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance institution WAGES, to purchase 3 bales of second-hand clothing.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 3 bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Volver A Empezar Group

texts.es: Es un grupo de personas alegres y trabajadoras, tienen una amistad desde hace mucho tiempo viven una urbanización que les brindo la una empresa de cerámica donde sus esposos trabajan, las socias para colaborar con sus esposos salen a vender y sus edades varían desde 21 hasta 63 años.  La presidenta tiene 3 hijos pequeños los mismos van a la escuela. La presidenta Ilse Lourdes tiene un restaurante y vende pollo a la broaster. Las socias la eligieron como presidenta por el entusiasmo y responsabilidad que tiene. Las señoras tienen diferentes negocios como: venta de ropa nueva para personas adultas, venta de ropa interior,  venta de abarrotes y venta de comida;  algunos negocios son fijos y otras son ambulantes. Sus competidores de sus negocios están presentes, pero las señoras tienen clientes fieles que les compran constantemente, en caso de dificultades de su negocio, diversifican su actividad comercial para obtener ingresos, algunas de ellas empiezan a trabajar medio tiempo con un sueldo fijo y  el otro medio tiempo atienden su negocio. Las socias quieren aprovechar las ofertas de AVON, EBEL, ÉSIKA y comprar más ropa e insumos (arroz, fideo). La presidenta quisiera ampliar su restaurante y dar más trabajo a las personas que viven por la zona. Este grupo está emprendiendo su primer ciclo. La mayoría de ellas ya se conocen entre ellas y participaron en otros créditos en otras entidades financieras.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of happy and hard-working people who are parts of a longtime friendship. They live in a housing development near a ceramic company where their husbands work. These members contribute to the income with their husbands are saleswomen between the ages of 21 and 63.

The team leader has three young school-age children. The team leader, Ilse Lourdes, has a restaurant and sells fried chicken. The members elected her as their leader because of her enthusiasm and responsibility. The women have different businesses selling different things, including: clothing for men and women, underwear, groceries, and food. Some are fixed stores and others are street vendors. There is competition with other businesses, but the women have loyal customers who buy from them constantly. In the event that they have difficulty with their businesses the women diversify and have other sources of income. Some of them have begun to work part-time with a fixed wage.

The members want to take advantage of AVON, EBEL, ÉSIKA's offer and purchase more clothing and consumables (rice, pasta). The team leader wants to expand her restaurant and give more work to the people that live in the area. This group is requesting their first loan. The majority of the women already know each other and have participated in loans with other financial entities.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabali de l’association Djekadi est composé de femmes mariées de la ville de Tominian, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et  ont en moyenne 31 ans et au moins  4 enfants.
Les femmes du groupe font le petit commerce des produits divers (savon, fonio haricot, poisson) et la restauration à Tominian il y’a environ 15 ans. Le petit commerce et la restauration sont des activités qui marchent bien dans cette zone.
Pour rentabiliser leurs activités, les membres du groupe Sabali de l’association Djekadi ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur premier prêt.
 Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour l’achat d’une importante quantité  de produits divers. 
Les membres du groupe Sabali comptent réaliser chacun un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000 FCFA à 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Sabali group of the Djekadi association is composed of married women from the city of Tominian in the Ségou Region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in traditional families and average 31 years of age and at least 4 children.

The women of the group have been selling various products (soap, fonio, beans, fish) and doing food catering for approximately 15 years in Tominian. These types of businesses work well in this area. To make their businesses profitable, the members of the Sabali group decided to join the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their first loan. The loan will be used to buy a large quantity of various products.

The members of the Sabali group count on turning a monthly profit of XOF 10'000 to 15'000 (ca US$ 24 to 32) each, to be used to repay the loan and to provide for the daily expenses of their families.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell various products

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a trader. She is into the palm oil production business. She buys fresh palm nuts from nearby communities, prepares the oil and supplies retailers in her community. Alice also sells at the local market. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

Alice is a 50-year-old married woman with six children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. She works so as to support her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruit in bulk

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
64-year-old Ramon tills his farm with patience and diligence. He has been married to his wife Rena for 43 years. They are blessed with nine children. The oldest, who is now 39 years old, is already married and does not live with them anymore. Like any other father, he wants the best for his children. He works hard to improve his family’s living condition.

Ramon joined CEVI in January 2009. Now he is requesting a loan of PHP6,000, which will be used for farm inputs. This loan is a big help to Ramon’s farming and in achieving his goal to improve his family’s living condition.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Las Valientes Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Valientes” esta representado por la señora Zoila Rosario y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales tienen sus propios negocios de venta de productos como ropa, zapatos, dulces, atención en fotocopiadoras, Estilista en su propio salón de belleza y al transporte publico de pasajeros. La gran mayoría de las Socias son personas muy trabajadoras que se esfuerzan para sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios de ya que la competencia en el mercado es alta y ellas necesitan su ganancia para manutención de sus hogares ya que la mayoría de ellas representan el sustento de sus familias. El crédito será destinado para compra de mercadería y para la reparación de los vehículos de los socios que se dedican al trasporte Publico, algunas de las socias dedicara el crédito al mejoramiento de sus hogares para brindarles una mejor calidad debida a sus familias. Es la primera vez que trabajan bajo esta modalidad pero también algunas de las socias ya tenia experiencia en créditos individuales por lo que saben como responder a sus obligaciones y sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The “Las Valientes” group is represented by Mrs. Zoila Rosario and composed of 12 members. Each member has his or her own business. These include clothing sales, shoe sales, candy sales, photocopier service, hair salon, and taxi service.

The large majority of the members are very hardworking people trying to achieve success for their small businesses. The competition in the marketplace is high, and they need their earnings to maintain their homes, as most are supporting a family.

This loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise and the repair of vehicles used as public transport. Some members will also use loan money to improve their homes to provide a better quality of life for their families.

This is the first loan for this group, but several members have had individual loans so they know how to fulfill their obligations. They wish to advance their small businesses and offer a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise, vehicle repair, and home improvement

loans.name: María Elvidia

texts.es: María Elvidia C. Vda. D. C. D. 59 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, departamento D. La Libertad, vive junto a un hijo el cual es minusválido, es por esto que él depenD. D. su madre, así mismo vive junto a un nieto. Ella posee una venta D. ropa y zapatos en el mercado D. San Tecla, venta con la cual inició hace 12 años D. manera ambulante, y ahora gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo posee un puesto en el mercado. María solicita un préstamo, ya que desea poder comprar nuevos estilos D. zapatos, así mismo diferentes tallas y colores D. ropa. Ella espera poder mejorar sus ventas sobre todo en este mes en las personas cuentan con la capacidad para comprar o se esfuerzan por comprarle ropa a sus hijos. Es por ello que María desea aprovechar la temporada e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Elvidia C. Vda. D. C., who is 59 years old, lives in Santa Tecla in the department of La Libertad. She lives with one son who is handicapped, and who depends on his mother for this reason. A grandson also lives with her. She owns a clothing and shoe store in the market of Santa Tecla. She began selling 12 years ago as a wandering merchant and now thanks to her hard work she has a permanent stall in the market. María is asking for a loan because she would like to be able to buy new styles of shoes, and also different sizes and colors of clothing. She hopes to improve her sales particularly during this month, when people are able to buy or make an real effort to buy clothes for their children. This is why María wants to take advantage of the season and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of different sizes of shoes and clothing

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 39-year-old married mother of five children. She has worked as a tailor since 1990. She services her town and its surroundings. Today, Hiyam is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a sewing machine and another specialized machine to make designs on textiles.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and an embroidery machine

loans.name: Five Sisters Group

texts.en: Beatrice W. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Five Sisters. She is 42 years old and married with two children, aged 14 and 17. One of her children is in the 3rd grade, but the other child has a problem with his hand and because of that, he is unable to write. Beatrice and her family live around the Red Light community. She works in the Red Light market, the largest market in Liberia, which is located in Paynesville on the outskirts of the capital, Monrovia. Beatrice could not continue her education past the 7th grade due to the Liberian civil war. Beatrice's business is the sale of plantains, bananas, yams, limes, etc. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells retail on a table at the Red Light Market. She has been running this business for 13 years and hopes to get into the general-store business in the near future. Beatrice started selling her general goods with 1,000 Liberian Dollars as working capital from her own savings. She got into it as a beginner. She talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. Beatrice needs this loan to purchase more plantains, bananas and yams for resale. She dreams of being able to give her sick son good medical care so that he can be able to go to school. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Beatrice is the one holding the sign. Ahmed K. is in the inset photo at lower right. Despite the group's name, Five Sisters, there is one male member, Ahmed. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women. Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today!

loans.use: To purchase more plantains, bananas and yams for resale to improve her business

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Chaipé surguió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación . Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser :  fabricación y venta de masas dulces, venta de milanesas, venta de ropas, venta de mercaderías comestibles, despensa , almacén , venta de bebidas   etc.
Cada una realiza una actividad diferente, así como la señora Nidia Cáceres quien elabora alimentos para vender, ella ofrece comidas o minutas preparadas para desayuno o almuerzo, tiene muchos clientes, quienes frecuentan constantemente de salón de la señora Nidia.
texts.en:
This group from the Chaipé suburb came about through one of the members' contact with the foundation . All the women take part in business activities such as: making and selling sweet pastries, selling breaded meat, selling clothes, selling foodstuffs, a provisions store, a grocery store, selling drinks etc. Each one has a different business, such as Nidia Cáceres who makes food to sell. She offers meals and refreshments prepared for breakfast or lunch. Nidia has a lot of customers who constantly frecuent her premises.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make food like: meat, seasonings, pastries

loans.name: Jakeline Katiuska

texts.es:
Las socias del  Banco Comunal Alianza  se reúnen en el sector Pachinche a unos 20 minutos de distancia de la ciudad de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manbí, conversamos con la señora Jakeline ella apenas tiene dos ciclos y esta muy contenta con el trabajo que viene realizando junto a la Fundación.

Jakeline es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos pequeños vive en el sector cuatro esquinas a las afueras de Portoviejo, con 28 años de edad se ha tenido que enfrentar  grandes desafíos como es el cuidado y mantención de sus hijos y para  ayudarse económicamente y no descuidar a sus niños ella tiene la venta de sabanas, cortinas, edredones y toldos de esta manera trabaja desde hace dos años,  recorre el sector visitando puerta a puerta a los clientes y deja a  crédito con facilidades de pagos la mercaderia, frecuentemente  viaja hasta la ciudad de Portoviejo donde adquiere a los mayoristas los pedidos para cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes, también cuenta con la ayuda de una señora que ella le ayuda a vender en otro sector de la región.

Con este nuevo préstamo nuesttra socia invertirá en mercadería sobre todo para la época  playera ha por lo que va a comprar  bermunda y trajes de baño para damas, caballeros y niños, así como otros implementos para la playa.

Su sueño tener su casa propia,  por ahora  vive en un espacio muy reducido  que la mamá le ha dado para que comparta con sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Alianza" meet in the Pachinche neighborhood, 20 minutes from the city of Portoviejo in the Manbí province. There we spoke with Señora Jakeline. She has been through almost 2 loan cycles, and is very pleased with the work that is being done with the Foundation. Jakeline is a single mother of 4 small children who lives in the Cuatro Esquinas neighborhood in the outskirts of Portoviejo. At 28 years of age, she has had to face major challenges, such as caring for and supporting her children, and helping herself economically without neglecting her children. She has a business selling bed sheets, curtains, comforters and awnings. She has been in this line of work for 2 years. She travels through the neighborhood selling door-to-door. She allows her customers to buy her merchandise on credit with easy terms. She often travels to the city of Portoviejo where she acquires from the wholesalers the merchandise ordered by her customers. In addition, she has a woman who works for her and helps her to sell in another area of the region. With this new loan she will invest in merchandise, especially for the beach season. She will buy swim shorts and bathing suits for women, men and children, and other articles for the beach. Her dream is to have her own house, because now she lives in a very small rented space, which her mother has given her to share with her small children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy swim shorts, bathing suits, and other items for the beach season

loans.name: Earn

texts.en:
Mrs. Earn Y., 43 years old and married, has lived for years with other family members in a medium-sized wooden house in the Siem Reap Province. She earns a living selling fresh fish both in the local market and her village, acquiring her products from her husband's fishing or buying them from her wholesale suppler. Earn has six children, two of whom are employed.

In order to earn additional income, Earn is applying for a loan to buy pigs for her stall. She will use any remaining cash from the loan to mend her old motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy pigs for her stall.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz A. started her own backyard piggery and poultry raising operation in order to help with the growing financial needs that raising her four-year-old child has brought. Through the proceeds of these businesses Flordeliz hopes to be able to have enough money to build a house and to send her child to college one day. If she's able to do that, then Flordeliz would then be able to say that her family's life is better than ever before. 

Flordeliz is requesting a loan from Kiva field partner ASHI to buy more piglets and chicks to raise. Her unemployed yet loving and supportive husband would partner her in her business. The two of them work hand in hand to raise and sell their livestock at the market and to the people in their village.

loans.use: To buy piglets and chicks to raise.

loans.name: Intachables Group

texts.es: El gripo “Intachables” esta representado por la Señora Yovana Vanesa y conformado por 11 miembros muy unidos que se conocen desD. hace ya varios años son bien organizados y muy responsables, algunas son madres solteras pero saben como salir adelante para sacar a flote a sus familias. La señora Yovana Vanesa es madre soltera tiene dos niños en edad escolar, vive en la casa D. sus madre quien es viuda y ambas se hacen compañía para salir adelante, la señora Yovana Vanesa se dedica a la venta D. refrescos a orillas del río Pirai el cual es muy concurrido en especial los fines D. semana que es donD. sus ventas se elevan, ella destinar el crédito para poder comprar una caseta cerca D. su actual trabajo para no perder su clientela y poder ampliar su mercadería haciendo emparedados y hamburguesas,  su mayor expectativa es poder agrandar la casa D. sus mama para darles a sus hijos y a su madre mayor comodidad. El resto D. las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades algunas venden comida en le río Pirai, otras son promotoras D. cosméticos, otras venden ropa y frutas. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda pero las socias saben como salir adelante gracias a que ya cuentan con clientes fieles que demandan sus productos. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y la ampliación D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercadería e insumos para mejorar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. La socias ya van cursando su segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando puntualidad y ganas D. salir adelante por el bien estar D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Intachables” group is represented by Yovana Vanesa and maD. up of 11 very close members who have known each other for several years. They are well-organized and very responsible. Some are single mothers, but they know how to succeed in order to proviD. for their families. Yovana Vanesa is a single mother who has two school-age children. She lives in the house of her widow mother, and they proviD. each other with companionship in order to get ahead. Yovana Vanesa sells soft drinks on the banks of the Pirai River, which is very crowded, especially on the weekends when sales are up. She will put the loan toward buying a tent near her place of work in order not to lose clientele and be able to diversify her merchandise by making sandwiches and hamburgers. Her principal goal is to be able to extend her mother's house in order to give her children and mother greater comfort. The rest of the members work at different activities. Some sell food by the Pirai River, others promote cosmetics and still others sell clothing and fruit. As in all commercial business, there is always competition for supply and demand, but the members know how to get ahead thanks to the fact that they already rely on faithful customers who demand their products. This loan will be put toward the diversification of products and the expansion of their businesses with the purchase of merchandise and supplies to improve their sales and income. The members are already in their second cycle with the institution and have demonstrated timeliness and the desire to get ahead for their families' well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en: Suzana M. is a small business owner and a married woman. She runs a café (food vendor) at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells varieties of both cooked and fried food, as well as soft drinks. She purchases her supplies from the shops at Kariakoo and Buguruni food market shopping center. She has been in the business for three years, and the income generated enables her to boost up the business. She needs a loan of TZS 800,000 to expand the business by buying more goods.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en: Cuc T. T. N. was born in 1977. She lives with her husband and three children who go to school. She has a participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. She and her husband sell seafood in the market. They have a monthly income of about $335. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,066,000 VND to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Over the past three years, Alma R. has provided for her family by operating a sari-sari (variety) store. The profit from this business has been the main source of family income. Now she has access to working capital, her income is better than before. Alma is requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for a much larger amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase foodstuffs for her store. This will allow her to grow the business further so that she will be able to support the education of her three children through college. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her income will steadily improve her financial stability and give her family a better life. Alma’s biggest dream is to manage a full-fledged mini-grocery store. She believes this opportunity will give her the confidence to succeed while helping her family rise out of poverty. The financial opportunity of her sari-sari (variety) store is one of the best ways to help provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs of her store.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Petty trading like the sale of groceries is widespread in Ghana because it is easy to start up. It usually begins with table-top selling and then grows to become a kiosk and eventually may become a supermarket. Georgina is an entrepreneur who has been trading in groceries such as washing powder, bottled water, canned foods, rice, cooking oil, toiletries, etc for the past 3 and a half years. 

Georgina, 58 years old, is a widow and the mother of three children from age 26-36. She is hoping that she will be able to expand her business and make more income to help her grown children. She is excited to be taking the loan which she plans to invest in purchasing groceries in bulk to serve her customers. 

Georgina believes in customer care and her broad smile almost always draws customers to her shop, making her one of the most successful traders in groceries. She also sells water to households. She anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San S. is 38 years old and is a resident of Kompong Cham Province where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops which she plants twice a year.

San S. is widowed and is the mother of two children who are no longer in school but who work selling items at the school.

San S. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time when she could be earning money to ensure that her family has an adequate standard of living. She is applying for a loan to use as capital towards purchasing some farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.use: To use towards purchasing some farm supplies

loans.name: Lester René

texts.es:
El Sr. Lester René M. B. vive en el Mauricio del Viejo, Departamento de Chinandega. 

El va a utilizar el credito en la compra de 2 llantas para el camión ya que las que está usando las tiene un poco desgastadas.

El Sr. M. ha tenido un total de 3 créditos con la Institución de los cuales  los 2 anteriores los ha cancelado bien en tiempo y forma, el vive solo con su mama y sus hermanas.
texts.en:
Lester Rene M. B. lives in Mauricio del Viejo, in the department of Chinandega. He plans to use the loan to buy 2 tires for his truck, since those he is using are slightly worn. Mr. M. has taken out a total of 3 loans with the Institution, 2 of which he paid off on time and correctly. He lives alone with his mother and sisters.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires for his truck

loans.name: Amna's Group

texts.en:
Amna, a 55-year-old lady, is married with two children. She resides in a city called Multan, which is famous for its history, in Pakistan. 

She has raised a son and a daughter and made them qualified in their own fields. Her son is involved in making and selling bed sheets. He got full training from one of the bed-sheets production factories and now he uses his skills for his own business. Her daughter has received training in embroidery skills from her. She and Amna now help each other in preparing embroidered dresses to complete orders of the customers. 

Her husband, 58 years of age, is a driver by trade. He drives a rickshaw (a three-wheeled motor vehicle) and works hard to put three meals on the table of his family. 

They all are very hardworking people. They all make effort in improving their financial condition and the living standard of their family as well. 

Amna is in her third loan cycle with Asasah. In the previous two loans, she maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. This time, she has applied for a loan for her embroidery business. With the loan amount, she will buy embroidery materials, such as cloth, beads and colored thread, in bulk and make improvements to her business.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery materials for improving her embroidery business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty A. is currently in the business of selling fruits such as mangoes, oranges, and green vegetables, and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish and tomatoes to sell.  Betty is 20 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock dried fish and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Guadalupe G. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tamalitos de Elotes, su hija le ayuda a vender en la colonia San Francisco y Maria tiene un puesto en el mercado Zonal Belén, donde ya tiene clientes fijos.
Todos los días compra la materia prima que va utilizar y los fines de semana vende Sopa de Mondongo.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar de leña, azúcar, aceite, elotes y un termo para llevar el atol.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe G. works making and selling ‘tamal de elote’ (a dish made with yellow corn, sometimes with a sweet or dry taste). Her daughter helps her sell them in the area of San Francisco and Maria has a stand in the Zonal Belén market where she already has regular customers.

Every day she purchases raw materials to use and on weekends, she sells tripe soup. She will use the loan to purchase firewood, sugar, oil, corn, and a thermos to transport the atol. She needs the earnings to cover the household and family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, sugar, water, firewood

loans.name: Jonaly

texts.en: Jonaly C. is a married woman who lives in Katipunan, Brgy. Sagua Banua, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through fish vending. Her husband Jun C., who is 33 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are from 6 to 14 years old. Jonaly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jonaly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to add to her own capital to buy a new motorized fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Jonaly C. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To buy a motorized fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard has been practicing mixed farming for seven years in Kitale town, western Kenya. His farm produces eggs which he sells at the local market. He also owns a motorbike which he uses for transportation to supplement his income. He says that his biggest challenge has been diseases that have been very costly to treat.

He recently repaid his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000KES and has requested this loan of 75,000KES to expand his poultry project. He says that with the proceeds from this project, his children are assured of a good education and food sustainability in the family. He would like to expand his farm in future to enable him to venture into dairy farming.

He is requesting Juhudi to shorten the loan processing period to enable clients to budget promptly and repay easily.

Bernard is 28 years old. He is married with two children, ages 2 and 6. His elder child is currently attending school.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Maame Tweba Augustina

texts.en: Maame Tweba Augustina A. sells foodstuffs and provisions at Elmina. Maame has been through junior high school.  She is married and has two children. She assists her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her children. Her loan will be used to buy more goods to sell. She hopes to reinvest her additional income back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ramón González tiene 45 años de edad, está casado con la señora Mirta cañete quien tiene 38 años de edad, ambos nacidos de Piribebuy. 
 Viven en su domicilio propio posee una carpintería hace más de 8 años, allí fabrica y vende Cuadros con laminas de paisajes, Botiquines y Espejos, sus clientes en su mayoría son vendedores ambulantes  (Revendedores de todo tipo de artículos) de la zona y particulares.

  El señor Juan Ramón trabaja mucho porque constantemente recibe pedidos de sus productos de los clientes de distintos puntos del país, pero posee algunas necesidades como la compra de madera (que es la materia prima que utiliza para su fabricar sus productos) solicita un crédito a Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva para poder satisfacer la  Demanda en estas fechas festivas de Navidad y desde ya agradece por el apoyo obtenido.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón González is 45 years old.  He is married to Mirta Cañete who is 38 years old.  They were both born in Piribebuy.

Juan Ramón and his wife both live in their own home.  He has owned a carpentry workshop for more than 8 years where he makes and sells picture frames containing landscape prints, bathroom cabinets and mirrors.  His customers are mainly street traders from his district who re-sell all sorts of articles and also members of the public.

Juan Ramón works a lot because he is constantly receiving orders for his products from customers around the country but he has some needs such as the need to buy wood (this is the raw material which he uses to make his products).  He is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva so that he can meet demand during this Christmas period.  He is grateful for the support he is receiving.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 7 children, five of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren).   She lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.  

Rosemary runs a retail shop. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days a week. She also generates additional income through tailoring.  She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt ,boxes of soap, and cooking oil for her shop. The main business challenges for Rosemary are seasonality and defaulters . Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children through to university, and also to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: Lordito

texts.en:
Lordito A. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. He is 37 years old. Lordito is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lordito owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and snack foods. Lordito has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lordito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lordito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods. This loan will be the first loan Lordito has taken out from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods.

loans.name: Matelagi

texts.en:
Matelagi R. is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Tai. She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Matelagi operates a family member's clothing business providing services to local community members. Matelagi has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 450 tala (WST) a month.

In 2008,Matelagi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Matelagi is requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be her third loan from SPBD. Matelagi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es: La señora Verónica H. E. tiene la edad de 32 años, estudia Licenciatura en Pedagogía en la universidad  de la Zona Urbana (UPN) y actualmente se encuentra viviendo en unión libre con el señor Santiago Ruiz con el que tiene un hijo de nombre Juan Diego de 5 años de edad que asiste al preescolar. La señora Verónica y su familia viven en la comunidad de Aserradero que pertenece al municipio de Acatlan de Perez Figueroa en el estado de Oaxaca. Doña Vero como la conocen en su comunidad desde hace algunos años siembra caña la cual vende al ingenio azucarero, cría ganado (vacas) y tiene un carro de carga el cual alquila en tiempo de zafra(cuando los ingenios inician su producción) para acarrear caña. Ella decidió iniciar a trabajar ya que deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y terminar su carrera, Doña vero nos dice que  cuando mejor le va en sus negocios es en tiempo de zafra ya que es cuando le cortan su caña y renta su carro, ella necesita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes, abono, alimento, llantas y aceite. Doña vero desea que su negocio cresca y le deje buenas ganancias ya que desea que su pequeño hijo estudie una carrera y ayudarlo a forjar un patrimonio, también nos dijo que se encuentra agradecida con la fundación por la confianza que le ha brindado al otorgarle este préstamo el cual ayudara a que su negocio prospere.
texts.en: Verónica H. E., 32, is studying to be a teacher at the Zona Urbana University (UPN).  She lives in a common-law marriage with Santiago Ruiz and they have a 5 year old son, Juan Diego, who is in pre-kindergarten.  Verónica and her family live in the community of Aserradero, that is part of the Acatlan de Perez Figueroa municipality in the state of Oaxaca.  Vero, as she has been called for many years, grows sugar cane that she sells to a sugar refinery.  She raises cattle (cows) and she has a truck that she rents out during the sugar harvest season (the time when the refineries begin their production) to transport the cane.  She decided to work now because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses, giving her son a better quality of life, and to finish her studies.  Vero tells us that the times that her business does well are in the harvest season when they cut the cane, and she rents out  the truck.  She needs the loan to buy fertilizer, manure, plant food, tires and oil.  Vero wants to see her business grow so that it will give her profits.  She will use the earnings for her small son so that he can  study a career and to help strengthen his patrimony.   She tells us that she is grateful for the confidence that the foundation has shown her by offering the loan that will help her business proper.

loans.use: Growing sugar cane, cattle, and a pickup truck

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina O. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 53 years old. married and has one adult child. To make a living, Felomina raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Felomina has been engaged in her business for over 6 years, and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Felomina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felomina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be Felomina's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue, generated from the business, to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en: Byambasuren, 49, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her husband is unemployed, her older daughter attends college, and her younger daughter attends a local secondary school.  Byambasuren has a degree in nursing, but she operates a rented stall at a local market and sells stationery and used clothing. She pays 130,000 MNT for the rent each month. Her current working capital is 3,000,000 MNT and her daily average net income is 60,000 MNT. Byambasuren is a hardworking person who says, " I want to increase my working capital and buy land where we could build a house". She is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to purchase more goods for her business and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita E. is from the village of San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 48 years old. Pacita is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Pacita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Pacita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Pacita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital for sale

location.town: Liloy-San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Jesusema

texts.en:
Jesusema is a 57-year-old married woman with 11 children. The oldest child is 38 years old. Her younger children still go to school.

Jesusema is a farmer. She tills land located in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells to the market.

Jesusema needs seed and fertilizers. She requested for a loan that she will use to fund her farm. Jesusema wishes for a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizers

loans.name: Betzabe

texts.es: Betzabe tiene 45 años, vive a lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 7 años se dedica a vender tejidos, prendas que ella elabora en su misma casa, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su madre. La cantidad de estas prendas tejidas lo hace por pedidos cada mes, logrando percibir buenas ganancias.  Ella tiene la característica de trabajar de manera ordenada y siempre procura estar al tanto de la moda y de los novedosos diseños que se presentan. Ante esto sus clientes se muestran satisfechos con los tejidos. En adelante desea aumentar la cantidad  de prendas tejidas y aprender otros puntos de tejidos para tener mayor demanda de su mercadería. Es su crédito número 6 con MFP,  considera que es una gran oportunidad haber tenido acceso para créditos que le han beneficiado enormemente en el crecimiento económico para su familia de la cual se siente muy agradecida. Con el crédito estará destinado en la compra de lana al por mayor.
texts.en:
Betzabe, age 45, lives at her husband’s side with their two children in their own house.  She has been selling woven garments, which she makes in her own house.  Sometimes her mother helps her.  She makes the quantity of garments that are ordered each month.  This is how she manages to get good earnings.  She works in an organized way, and she always strives to be up to date with the fashion and the new designs that are shown. 

Later she wishes to increase her quantity of woven garments and learn other stitches in order to have a greater demand in the market.  This is her 6th loan with MFP.  She feels that this is a great opportunity to have had access to loans.  They have been extremely beneficial to the economic growth of her family, and she is very grateful.  The loan is to buy wool wholesale.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wool

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie B. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 46 years old. Rosemarie is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Rosemarie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, candies, shampoo, soap, and biscuits to the local community. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. 

Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, detergents, and beverages. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Rosemarie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, detergents, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 51-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and five children. She owns a small shop where she sells all types of grains (rice, chickpeas, beans, etc.) and peppers. Her husband works in a locA. school as a student transporter. They cooperate together to better satisfy the family's financiA. needs. 

She has obtained a first Kiva loan and has a very good repayment history. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her shop inventory. In the future, she intends to enlarge her business by selling dairy and other daily necessities.

loans.use: to increase her shop’s inventory.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Hay un lugar conocido como la comunidad de Arin este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En esta comunidad de Arin conocimos la socia tiene 33 años de edad, tiene su pareja y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos, vive con su pareja en su casa propia que cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la provincia de Calca, que pertenece al departamento del Cusco. Esta zona tiene como actividad principal la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

La socia se dedica al cultivo de maíz y hortalizas, ella tiene varias chacras y están cerca de su casa. Posteriormente vende sus productos una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Urubamba y a pobladores que la conocen así incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo cosas que le hacen falta en su casa. 

El crédito que ha solicitado la socia es de 1500 nuevos soles a la Asociación Arariwa, será destinado para la compra de maíz. La socia es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que quiere.
texts.en:
The community of Arin is located in the city of Calca in the department of Cusco. This community is known for its beautiful landscapes, for its food, and for the quality of its people.

This member from the community of Arin is 33 years old. She and her partner have two children, and they live in their own house, which has water and electricity. They live in the province of Calca in the department of Cusco. The primary activities in this area include agriculture, livestock raising, and tourism.

She grows corn and garden vegetables. She has many farms near her house.
