After her products have reached a good size, she sells them in different markets in the city of Urubamba and to people she knows. With this activity, she increases her income and can obtain items that are lacking in her house. 

The loan she is requesting is for 1500 nuevos soles from Asociación Arariwa to buy corn. She is a hard-working and enterprising woman, and has gone forward to improve her life and to have the things that she wants.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Komsort

texts.en:
Komsort is 27 years old. He and his wife, Vanna, 27, have been married since 2006 and have two young children, a son and a daughter. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. 

Komsort and his wife are banana and flower farmers. They also buy additional flowers and bananas from fellow villagers and transport them to sell in the Phnom Penh market. 

The couple wants to supplement their business by selling longan, a fruit related to the lychee. Hence Komsort is applying for his first loan of $400 purchase longan for sale.

loans.use: To purchase longan fruit for sale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 33 years old, married, and has two children who go to school. She has been operating Ebenezer general shop to earn a living for five years, and employs one person in her business. She also owns two motorbikes which earn her extra income.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save her money, thereby enabling her to manage her finances. Caroline is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and sweets.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, cooking fat and sweets for her store.

loans.name: Ephata Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "EPHATA", que significa la más pequeña, buscando una oportunidad de tener más ventas  y crecer. Están ubicadas en el Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo. Vilgahi es integrante del grupo. Ella tiene 48 años, estudió hasta el quinto año de primaria, es ama de casa y tiene 5 hijos, 2 mujeres y 3 hombres. Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de tlacoyos (que consiste en una tortilla gruesa ovalada y larga, preparada con masa de maíz y frijoles o habas cocidos, la cual puede ir rellena de diversos ingredientes como frijoles, habas, carne, requesón)  que inició hace 10 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar la materia prima que es maíz, frijol, chicharon y gas. Sus clientes son personas del área conurbada, prefieren comprar los productos con ella por la calidad y buen servicio que ofrece y la atención amable de la señora. Al momento  de solicitar este préstamo se siente con mucha alegría de tener la oportunidad de invertir y distribuir su producto. Su negocio es importante ya que con ello puede salir adelante con los gastos de su familia y así tener una mejor calidad de vida, ella añora darles una carrera  profesional a su hija que esta estudiando preparatoria  para que tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en: This group is called "Ephata," which means "the smallest one." They are all looking for an opportunity to make more sales and to grow. They are located in the state of Mexico. The group is comprised of 10 members and this is the first time they are requesting a loan. Vilgahi is one member of the group. She is 48 years old, studied until the fifth year of primary school, is a homemaker, and has five children (two girls and three boys). She makes and sells tlacoyos (which consist of a thick, long oval tortilla prepared from a dough of corn and cooked beans, which can then be filled with various ingredients like beans, lima beans, meat, and cottage cheese). She started doing this ten years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients and supplies like corn, beans, pork rinds, and gas. Her customers are people in her area who prefer to buy her products for their quality and the good service and friendly attention she provides. At the moment, Vilgahi feels very happy to have the opportunity to invest and to distribute her product. Her business is important because with it, she can get ahead on her family's expenses and therefore have a better quality of life. She longs to give her daughter, who is currently in high school, the opportunity to pursue a professional career so that she can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and materials like corn, beans, pork rinds, and gas

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en: Criselda is 34 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two grown children. Criselda is a farmer. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for meat purposes. She has been engaged in this business for three years. Every four months, she earns PHP 32,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase feed and additional piglets for fattening. Criselda has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Criselda hopes to raise pigs on a large scale and gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and additional piglets for fattening

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny is a 27-year-old single mother with a six-year-old son. She sells charcoal to residents living near Shelly beach. Winny has been running this business for a couple of months and is determined to make it successful. On the side, Winny is also a florist making decorations for weddings. She intends to use her loan to build a stall for selling charcoal. 

Winny hopes to expand her charcoal business and open a decoration shop. She describes herself as obedient.

loans.use: to build a stall to sell charcoal.

loans.name: Shafiqa

texts.en:
Shafiqa is a 59-year-old woman, married with one son and two daughters. She lives in the Biet Hanoun area in Palestine. Shafiqa's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Shafiqa wants to purchase bedroom furniture as Shafiqa and her husband couldn't buy any when they got married due to his decent salary.  She heard of FATEN loans and she took out a loan to purchase the furniture she needs.

Shafiqa is a religious conservative woman. Her son is photographed instead at FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase bedroom furniture

loans.name: Mahutin Pk10 Group

texts.fr: MAHUTIN PK10 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Eudoxie(qui a la main levée sur la photo),est âgée de 25 ans et est mariée à un carreleur du nom de Jules. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Eudoxie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Eudoxie a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Eudoxie mène comme activité, la vente des ustensiles de cuisine. Parallèlement à cette activité, Eudoxie vend de l'huile de palme et de l'huile d'arachide. Eudoxie s'approvisionne au Bénin et au Nigeria, État voisin du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Eudoxie et les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN PK10 sollicitent l'appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur capacité financière et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Mahutin PK10 is a group of three people, who live together in the same neighborhood and belong to the same "tontine" group ("tontine" is a revolving finance system whereby each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to the different members). The representative of the group, Eudoxie (who has her hand raised on the photo) is 25 years old and married to a tiler by the name of Jules.The couple has two children, both at school and in their care. Eudoxi lives with her husband and children. She went to school very little. In order to provide for her needs and those of her family she has a business selling kitchen utensils. At the same time she sells palm oil and groundnut oil. Eudoxie gets her supplies in Benin and its neighboring state, Nigeria. This is the second time that Eudoxie and the other members of the Mahutin PK10 group have requested financial aid from Alidé, with the aim of strengthening their financial capacity and better responding to customer demand. The first loan they had has been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Experiance Group

texts.fr:
Guerline  est la coordinatrice de son groupe FANM KAPAB

 Elle n’est pas mariée mais Elle a un enfant.

Guerline habite dans la ville de trou du nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Elle a dirigé son business pendant les 7 dernières années.

Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat des lampes a batteries.

Elle espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business.

Des autres membres de FANM KAPAB ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson.

Guerline dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant .

Elle dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Ses rêve est la construction d’une belle maison
texts.en:
For seven years, Guerline has been the leader of her group, called FANM KAPAB. She's not married but has one child. She lives in Trou-du-Nord, a city in Haiti where electricity and water supplies are very constrained.

She would like to use her loan to invest in battery-powered lamps, and she hopes that the loan will help her expand her business. The other members of the group need a loan for buying and selling charcoal, rice and fish.

Guerline says that her main challenge is the lack of regular buyers. Her main goal is to grow her business, and she dreams to be able to build a nice house.

loans.use: to buy battery-powered lamps

loans.name: Wanyinan-Agblangandan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANYINAN-AGBLANGANDAN est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Alaba Josephine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo.  Alaba Josephine est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble dans la même maison. Alaba Josephine et son mari subviennent ensemble aux besoins du ménage. Pour y arriver, Alaba Josephine vend des plastiques, des glaciaires et des mêches. Alaba Josephine s'approvisionne au Nigéria État voisin du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser leur activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur  clientèle, Alaba Josephine et les autres membres du groupe  WANYINAN-AGBLANGANDAN sollicitent pour une troisième fois,l'appui financier de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group WANYINAN-AGBLANGANDAN is comprised of three persons who all live in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, by the name of Alaba Josephine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is married to Jean. They have three children, all in school and in their care. The family lives together in the same house. 

Alaba Josephine and her husband jointly provide for the household. To do so, she sells plastic ware, insulated containers (coolers), and hair extensions. Her supplies come from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. 

With the goal of boosting their business and responding better to the needs of their customers, Alaba Josephine and the other members of the group WANYINAN-AGBLANGANDAN are requesting financial support from ALIDé. This loan will serve to bolster their business in order to respond better to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy plasticware, insulated containers, and hair extensions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to restock his store and invest in a new one.

loans.name: Wolfat

texts.en:
Wolfat is a conservative woman, so her husband, Ashraf, is photographed instead.

Wolfat is a 26-year-old young woman. She is married and her husband is a carpenter and has his own workshop. Wolfat wants to help her husband in purchasing a new carpentry kit to improve the quality of his work, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan amount of 1,500 USD from FATEN. When Wolfat gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to help her husband in purchasing his new carpentry kit. This will improve his work and increase his income and offer to his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new carpentry kit

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 42 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y muy dinámica, siempre esta en constante dinamismo, es madre soltera de dos hijos a quienes con mucha ilusión y trabajo crió y ya son mayores e independientes. Tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de su hija y su yerno. El trabajo al que se dedica es la siembra y cosecha de maíz, pues tiene algunas parcelas que se encuentran a dos horas vía fluvial de la ciudad, y es ahí donde ejerce esta actividad y D. que tiene ya cinco años. Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque le proporciona buenas ganancias, puesto que todo lo que cosecha lo vende a los molineros, así saca mejor provecho a su trabajo. Espera ya terminar con esta actividad ya que le resulta muy agotador, por ello tiene planes de montar un restaurante en su casa, para estar más tranquila y generar ingresos para el día. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, y espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará semillas de maíz y sacos de abono para su siguiente siembra.
texts.en: Betty is 42 years old and a happy, friendly and very dynamic woman. She is always on the move. She is a single mother of 2 whom she raised with great enthusiasm and hardwork to be adults and independent. She has her own house where she lives with her daughter and son-in-law. She works planting and harvesting corn as she has a few plots of land which are within 2 hours of the city waterway. It is there that she has worked for the last 5 years. She likes what she does a lot as it provides her with a solid return since everything she harvests she sells to the mills. In this way she gets the most out of her work. She hopes to finish with this work soon as it is very tiring but she has plans to open a restaurant at home so as to be more at peace and generate a daily income. This will be her 4th loan with MFP and she hopes to receive the support of every one of you. With the amount requested, she will buy corn seed and sacks of manure for her next crop.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He started to work as a taxi driver in 2005. He’s a very friendly person who has gained a number of loyal customers. 

Ahmad is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his car’s engine. He will be able to secure his mode of transportation. In the future, he plans to purchase a van so that he can serve more customers to increase his profits.

loans.use: to repair his car's engine

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 44 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Marco, su esposo desde hace 7 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Celeste, Valeria y Matías, a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura.  Ella tiene que luchar sola, pues su esposo trabaja en una mina. Una vez al mes la visita para dejarle dinero. Sus necesidades son muchas, por eso ella trabaja con la elaboración de tamales (alimento a base de harina), los cuales lleva a la capital del país, done tiene acogida, ya tiene 2 años dedicándose a ello, por eso desea más delante abrir un restaurante donde pueda cocinar. Pero como no puede viajar mucho, ya que su hija menor es aún pequeña. También se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, ya tiene 70 ejemplares, de los que tiene que vender a un precio razonable, con ello gana un promedio de dinero que le sirve para pagar los estudios de sus hijos. “Yo ahorro dinero, sembrando los pastos que comen”, comenta, ya que su siembra dura muchos meses. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo amanecer” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. María de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de alfalfa para su siembra.
texts.en: María, 44, is a cheerful person who lives with her husband of seven years, Marco, and their three children, Celeste, Valeria and Matías.  They have their own home in the town of Ataura.  She has to struggle on her own since her husband is a miner who visits them once a month to leave them money.  She has many needs and therefore works making tamales (flour based food) which she sells in the capital city.  She has been in business for two years and in the future wants to open a restaurant where she can cook meals.  She is unable to travel much because her youngest daughter is still very small.  She also raises guinea pigs and now has 70 which she will sell for a reasonable price (using the income to pay for her children's education).  "I save money by growing the fodder they eat", she says, since her crop lasts many months.  She belongs to the communal bank "Nuevo amanecer" and this is her third loan through MFP, where she counts on support for her plans.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time, as with previous loans.  She enjoys being part of the association because all the members are responsible and very supportive.  María plans to use the loan to buy alfalfa seeds to plant.

loans.use: To buy alfalfa seeds.

loans.name: Gina Group

texts.en:
Gina is 41 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Mis. Occ. She is married with one child. Gina has a general store and earns approximately PHP 1,800 each month. She is asking for a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase canned goods, softdrinks, noodles etc. to sell in her store.

Gina is a new member of PMPC. She is the leader of a four-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

In the future, Gina hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her general store

loans.name: Rocío Karina

texts.es:
Rocío una señora trabajadora y empeñosa tiene 34 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad caracterizada por la exportación de espárragos, alcachofas, entre otros.Roció es casada, y su esposo es obrero, ellos tienen 3 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos tiene  12 años y el mayor 17, ambos se encuentran acudiendo a la escuela.			
Como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo, es así como Rocío encontró una oportunidad de negocio hace ya 4 años e inicio la venta de "Chanfainita" en la esquina de su casa, este negocio le permite ganar S/. 43 Diarios en promedio lo que le ayuda mucho a poder cubrir todos los gastos necesarios para sus niños y para la compra de productos para la venta diaria de la popular “Chanfainita”.

Actualmente desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarla, prestándole S/. 3,000, a mejorar su vivienda ofreciéndoles así a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, ella desea poder pagar en 12 meses el total de su crédito.
Esta mejora podrá ayudarla  y así poco a poco podrá cumplir su gran sueño: "Me gustaría mucho tener mi local propio y terminar de construir por completo mi casa”.
texts.en:
Rocío is a hardworking  and enterprising woman. She is 34 years old and lives in the city of Ica. It is characterized by the export of asparagus and artichokes, among other things. Roció is married and her husband is a laborer. They have 3 children between 12 and 17 who are in school. 
			
As is well known, Peru is characterized as having the most delicious food in the world. That is how Rocío found a business opportunity 4 years ago when she started to sell "Chanfainita" at the corner by her house. This business allows her to earn S/. 43 every day on average. It helps her a lot to cover all the necessary expenses for her children and to buy the products to do the daily selling of the popular “Chanfainita”.

At present, she would like the Kiva lenders to help her by lending her S/. 3,000, to improve her home and offer her children a better quality of life. She wants to pay off the loan in full in 12 months. 

This improvement will help her to make her dream come true little by little: "I would really like to have my own locale and completely finish building my house".

loans.use: to do home improvement

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh, a 50-year-old married woman, has a son. Her husband is a merchant. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. Oanh has had a general store in front of her house for 10 years. She sells many kinds of products such as confectionery, coffee, milk, and soaps.

She plans to take a loan to purchase more snack foods and confectionery to fully stock her general store. She hopes that this will enable her to better meet her customers' needs during the coming holiday season. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to generate additional income to reinvest in her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods and candies to fully stock her general store

loans.name: Los Soñadores Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Los Soñadores” está conformado por 17 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran confección de ropa, venta de cosméticos por catalogo, preparación de productos de amasandería y chocolatería, entre otros negocios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Claudio presidente del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pié en el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, sosteniendo a su hijo de 4 meses de edad.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio vendiendo frutos secos en un puesto que instala en diferentes ferias libres. Tiene su negocio desde hace 10 años. Su horario de trabajo es a partir de las 8ºº de la mañana hasta las 15ºº de la tarde, durante todos los días de la semana.
Usualmente compra aceitunas, picles, cebolla escabeche, almendras y otros productos en el mercado de la ciudad. Durante la temporada de verano agrega a su negocio la venta de frutas de estación como las frutillas.
Con el crédito comprará frutos secos y aceitunas para abastecer su negocio.
Una de sus metas para su negocio es tener un local establecido que cuente con todos los permisos legales para comercializar.
Claudio vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 8, 3 y 4 meses de edad. Uno de sus sueños es prosperar con su negocio para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Su esposa también se dedica a vender frutos secos, sin embargo ella vende desde su casa, para su entorno más cercano.
Claudio está agradecido de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Respecto a la convivencia con el grupo del Banco comunal, ha sido muy grata, por lo que Claudio se siente cómodo en seguir participando de la institución.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called “Los Soñadores”, is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who have various jobs including: making clothing, selling cosmetics through a catalogue, a bakery, and chocolate making. They all live in the city of Valparaíso.
Claudio is the group president and appears in the photo, standing, first on the right, holding his four-month-old son.
He is a merchant and sells nuts and dried fruit in a stall in various markets. He has had this business for ten years, and works from 8:00 am to 3:00 pm every day of the week.
He normally buys pickles, olives, pickled onions, almonds, and other products in the city market. During the summer season he also sells seasonal fruits such as strawberries.
With this loan, he will buy nuts, dried fruit, and olives to stock his business.
One of his goals for his business is to have an established storefront and all of the legal permits to sell in it.
Claudio lives with his wife and three children, ages 3 and 8 years, and four months old. One of his dreams is for his business to prosper in order to provide his family with a better quality of life
His wife also sells nuts and dried fruit, but she sells from home in order to be nearby.
Claudio is grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given him to invest in his business. He has been a very pleasant member of his communal bank, and he feels comfortable continuing to participate in the Institution.
Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers north-east of Santiago. It is the regional capital and the seat of legislative power in the country. It is the gateway of the nation and offers a large variety of beautiful, picturesque locations; for example, the house of Nobel Prize-winning poet Pablo Neruda.

loans.use: to buy nuts, dried fruit and olives to stock his business.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan, a 49-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have run a business for three years. They sell a variety of basic goods to people in the local community .

Lan requests a loan to purchase more products such as soaps, shampoos, soft drink and confectionery to stock her store. That will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as soaps, shampoos, soft drinks and confectionery

loans.name: Georgina O.

texts.en:
Georgina O. is married to a businessman and they have four children. She is a Form Four Leaver. Georgina O. operates a chop bar (where Ghanaian local dishes are sold). Georgina O. is the one pounding the fufu (fufu is made of cooked cassava and plantains pounded into smooth, round balls), served with groundnut soup, palm nut soup, light soup, and fish/meat. She sells to individuals around her locality in Elmina. She has been actively involved in this business for many years. 

As the sole breadwinner of the family, she uses her income to provide for the entire family. Georgina O. will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava, plantains, fish, meat, etc., thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of food that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, plantains, fish, meat, etc., thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Women At Work Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of Women at Work Group, located in Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone. This is a group of hard working traders who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to request for a loan of SLL5,000,000.00. They will use this loan in order to meet their most immediate financial needs – some will use it to buy a plot of land, pieces of furniture, pay school fees for their children, etc. And at the end of each month, the group leader will collect their repayment and repay SMT/Kiva on their behalf.
Aminata is the featured leader of this group. Born in Bo, southern Sierra Leone, she is 21 years old and has 3 children.  All three are in primary school. Aminata has been in business for 12 years now. She has requested for this loan in order to buy Maggie, onions and dried fish to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy Maggie, onions and dried fish to increase her stock.

loans.name: St Cicilia Women Group

texts.en: Christine is 28 years old. She divorced her husband with her child of 4 years. She is their soul provider and works hard towards the betterment of their well-being. She sells fresh foods in a local market. She desires to expand her business, but the fact that she deals deals in perishable goods, she is let down because their easily loose their value. She is requesting for money to buy foods like bananas and millet flour for selling. Christine is a member of St Cicilia women group where members offer guarantorship to one another in order to get a group loan since they are not asked for security. The extra person in the photo has savings with the group and has guaranteed his fellows but has not taken the loan.

loans.use: To buy foods like bananas and millet flour for selling.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
B. George is an active member of Life in Africa. He works in the Invisible Children Bracelet project as a sander and he is finally earning a good income for his family. He is a humble man and is dedicated to creating a new and better life for his family. His family was forced to flee the North where the rebels are waging war and they live in the camp known as the Acholi Quarters. He has a wife and six children he is supporting and he also has a brother who lives with them.

His brother needs work to do and the additional income his brother could earn would greatly improve the life of the entire family. They have a plan to start a groundnut business which the brother can operate from their home. Groundnuts are a great favorite of the Acholi and as such are in great demand especially if they are already ground and packaged in small quantities making it affordable.

This business will be local and small scale but has the potential to grow. To start this business he is seeking a loan in the amount of 800,000 to purchase the equipment necessary. He will be able to repay this loan in 12 months.

Below is his break down:

1, paste miller small size @ 350,000/=

2, Small generator @ 250,000/=

3, Groundnuts 100kg @ 150,000/=

4, Renting one room with power for three months @ 25,000/= = 75,000/=

5, Transport 10,000/=

6, packaging 40,000/=

Total 800,000/=

WE Team to benefit: self sustaining development.

loans.use: Setting up groundnut paste business

loans.name: Khadeja

texts.en:
Khadeja who born in 1984 with household of 4 living in district 7 Kabul Afghanistan.

Khadeja who has a share business with her husband Ghulam Nabi who has a butcher shop near the market.

Khadeja due to family problem she cant work outside then she decide to take loan from AFSG that her husband can buy sheep's and cow's right now she past the 1st and 2nd cycle loan Continuing with 3rd cycle loan by the helps of her husband that he sale the sheep's and cow's meat to the bazaar now they can able to pay the house rent and fee of there children's.

loans.use: To buy sheep's and cow's

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large marking centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madam T. is a resident of Nkurankan and sells rice in tins to her customers. She is also a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is however seeking a Kiva loan of $750.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: Wants to expand business of rice tins.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura sells all kinds of pampers and articles for babies, she also sells juices, sodas, yogurts, etc. She has 2 years in the business. She began with some capital from his husband and she began selling first at her home and then she established the store of pampers. Her business is open from 9am to 9pm every day. She has 10 years of experience in the business.

Laura wants to buy more merchandise for babies. Her business is very well located and has lots of demand. Also she acquires products at lower costs because she buys inventory in cash.

Laura is 29 years old, is married and has 3 kids, 2 of them are already in school. She lives at her mom’s house, which is a 2 floors house made of cement. Also her husband works in a business that imports home appliances and with his salary he helps at home. She wants a loan from Kiva in order to improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for babies

loans.name: Eliete

texts.en:
Eliete came with her husband to the Dominican Republic from Haiti 5 years ago looking for work. Because she does not yet know how to read or write and her Spanish is limited, she largely depends on bilingual members of the Haitian community to help her navigate life in Hato Mayor. The couple has three children, each of whom is in school back in Haiti and living with family. With what they have been earning in Hato Mayor, they have been able to send money back home on a regular basis. Rony, her husband, works in whatever construction jobs he can find, while Eliete spends the day selling merchandise.

Note: Eliete is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his or her respective business and will be accountable to each other for repaying his or her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Buying a good variety of shorts, pants and teeshirts to resell

loans.name: Reina Cristina

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Reyna Cristina, I’m a merchant, and my principle activity is the sale of new clothes. I have a business located in the city center named “Cristy” Varieties. I have a lot of experience in the business. I am a single mother and thanks to the income I receive from the business I have succeeded in helping my family get ahead. Taking into account that the heavy sales season is approaching, I need to supply my business and right now I do not have the capital to make such an investment. Therefore, I am asking for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombres es Reyna Cristina, soy comerciante, mi actividad principal es la venta de ropa nueva, tengo un negocio ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad llamado Variedades "CRISTY", cuento con mucha experiencia en este negocio. soy madre soltera y gracias a los ingresos que persivo de este negocio he logrado sacar adelante a mi familia. Tomando en cuenta que se aproxima la temporada de mayor venta necesito surtir un poco mi negocio y en estos momentos no cuento con el capital para tal inversión por lo que solicito el apoyo de ustedes

loans.use: To purchase pants, tennis shoes, women's sandals, blouses, and skirts.

loans.name: Moshi

texts.en:
Moshi is small entrepreneur dealing with livestock keeping. She is married to M. Maarufu who is a business man. She has five children aged 7, 11, 14, 19 and 22 years. Moshi loves her job dealing with animal keeping after five years experience. Having successfully repaid one loan, she is asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator for milk storage. She is proposing to repay this loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, and they are thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

loans.use: BUYING REFRIGERATOR

loans.name: Ujamaa A Group

texts.en:
Fatuma I., age 37, is married with a girl (age 15) and a boy (age 6). She owns a cafe, which she started in 1996. Her cafe is open from 6am until 5pm daily, and she earns about $88 a month from this business.

Fatuma has taken a previous loan of about $88 from BRAC Tanzania to buy food stock for her cafe. Having paid this back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will be sharing this loan with subgroup member Sophia T., who owns a general store.

loans.use: to buy food stock

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
Ms. Silvina C., lives as a couple and has four children; one is married, one studies at the university and the last two are still in school.

Silvina has a store that operates out of her home that has grown throughout the years and is supported by a large clientele. With time she was able to open another store in the city’s municipal market. Both businesses are doing well as they are in commercial zones.

In addition she also has a booth at the wholesale market located in a very populated and busy area. Miss Silvina wants the loan to buy various items wholesale such as yerba (an herb used in infusions), sugar, beverages, flour, and canned goods amongst other things.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La Srta. Silvina C., vive en pareja y tiene cuatro hijos, una ya esta casada, la otra estudia en la universidad y los últimos dos van aún a la escuela.

Silivina tiene un almacén, la misma funciona en su domicilio que fue ampliando con el correr de los años ya que cuenta con una amplia clientela. Con el tiempo pudo abrir otro almacén en el mercado municipal de la ciudad. Ambos negocios marchan bastante bien, pues se encuentran en zonas comerciales.

y posee otra despensa situada en el Mercado Municipal de Abasto pues la zona en la que se encuentran es muy poblada y muy concurrida. La señora Silvina retira el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de almacén al por mayor como yerba, azúcar, bebidas varias, harina, productos enlatados y otros.

loans.use: To purchase various items wholesale such as yerba (an herb used in infusions),  sugar, beverages, flour, and canned goods amongst other things.

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sorti

texts.id:
One of the Bali natives' activities is praying. They use many kinds of accesories for the prayings, such as Canang with various shapes with many varieties of flower. Ni Nengah Sotri is a mother who see this opportunity to make some money. She provides various kind of religious accesories. She uses some materials such as Janur (coconut leaves) including including young and old leaves. This kind of material is quite easy to find in her neighbourhood. Besides selling daily religious accessories, Ni Nengah Sotri also take some package orders for bigger religious events such Otonan (birthday), Odalan (big religious ceremony), and so on. For these package orders, she needs bigger capital. She also usually needs help from her relatives. By joining DINARI foundation, Ni Nengah Sotri not only receives loan, but also gets some consultancies and advice for making a better business. Everyday Ni Nengah Sotri does her housework such as cooking and taking care of the children. After the housework, she starts working on her business. Her net profit is around Rp 20,000 to Rp 25,000 per day. She uses the profit to cover the family's expenses. Her husband is construction labor with irregular income. Thanks to this business, Ni Nengah Sotri can help support the family.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan masyarakat asli Bali adalah sembahyang. Banyak alat - alat yang dipakai untuk menunjang prasarana sembahyang, antara lain yang disebut Canang dengan beraneka ragam bentuknya, dan aneka macam bunga sebagai pelengkapnya. Ni Nengah Sotri adalah salah seorang ibu yang dapat memanfaatkan kesempatan tersebut sebagai salah satu usaha yang dapat menghasilkan uang. Beraneka macam barang - barang yang dapat menunjang persembahyanggan disediakan. Bahan baku yang dipakai adalah Janur ( daun kelapa ) baik yang masih muda maupun yang sudah tua. Bahan baku ini sangat mudah dicari di daerahnya. Selain menjual bahan-bahan untuk sarana persembahyangan secara harian, Ni Nengah Sotri juga melayani aneka macam sarana sembahyangan secara besar / paket Otonan ( Ulang tahun ) dan Odalan ( Upacara keagamaan yang besar ) dan lain-lain. Untuk pesanan dalam bentuk paket inilah yang biasanya sangat memerlukan modal besar. Dan biasanya juga mempekerjakan beberapa kerabatnya untuk membantu agar cepat selesai.Dengan bergabungnya Ni Nengah Sontri dengan Yayasan Dinari, tidak hanya modal dana saja yang diperolehnya tetapi juga pembinaan-pembinaan yang tentunya diharapkan dapat meningkatkan usahanya. Setiap pagi Ni Nengah Sotri mengerjakan kegiatan sehari-hari sebagai ibu rumah tangga seperti memasak, dan mengurus anak anaknya. Setelah semua terselesaikan barulah Ni Nengah Sontri dengan tekun mulai mengambil kegiatan usahanya. Keuntungan bersih dalam sehari mencapai Rp 20.000 s/d Rp 25.000,- dapat dipakai untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarganya. Suaminya adalah seorang tukang bangunan yang pekerjaannya tidak tetap .Dengan adanya usaha yang dijalankan oleh Ni Nengah Sontri ini sangatlah membantu dalam menambah pendapatan keluarganya.

loans.use: To add more capital

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Mrs. Hun P., 54, is a mother of seven children and works growing a variety of vegetables, earning about two dollars a day. Her husband is a government officer in the commune with a salary of $150 a month. Five of the children are married and live away from home.

Mrs. P. wants to use this loan to purchase fertilizers to put on her farmland and to buy land to build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and to buy land for a new house

loans.name: Maria Marlene

texts.es:
Ms. Maria Marlene P. V. is 52 years old. She lives in the Paijan district, Ascope province, in La Libertad Peru. She has four children and one of them is still dependent on her. She was able to complete a secondary school level. She has liked doing business since she was a young girl. She began selling beauty products and with the earning she was able to set up a stand in her home to sell soda, beer empanadas (turnovers) and candy. Her aunt invited her to join Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” and the previous loan she obtained was very helpful since she was able to increase her income and above all she was able to stock her store with a variety of products.

With the 1200.00 soles loan that she will repay in six moths, she will buy, a sack of rice, sugar, oil, snacks, beer and soda. She will also buy beauty products at a lower price to have on hand. Ms. Maria dreams with adding to her business and set up a restaurant to sell Creole food.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juarez, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Marlene P. V. tiene 52 años de edad, actualmente vive en el Distrito de Paiján, Provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad - Perú; tiene 4 hijos, solo uno depende de ella. La señora María estudió secundaria completa. Desde muy pequeña le gustó el negocio, empezó vendiendo productos de belleza y con las ganancias que obtenía puso en su casa una mesa pequeña para vender gaseosas, cerveza, empanadas, caramelos. Una tía le invitó a integrar el Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” y con su anterior préstamo que obtuvo le fue de mucha ayuda ya que así pudo aumentar mas su capital y sobretodo tener mayor variedad en su bodega. Con el último préstamo de S/.1200.00 el cual pagara en seis meses comprará: un saco de arroz, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, cerveza y gaseosas, además comprará productos de belleza aun precio cómodo para tener en stock. La señora María sueña con implementar más su negocio y también con poner un restaurante para vender comida criolla.

loans.use: To purchase supplies in order to sell them

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en: T. Bashorat is 58 is years old. She is married and has two children. Her eldest son is already married and has children of his own who adore their grandparents. Bashorat’s husband is retired on a pension. That is why her business is the main source of income for her family. Her younger son helps her with the business. Bashorat is a market vendor. She is selling foodstuff such as sunflower-seed oil, sugar, tea, macaroni, and cookies. She has been in this business for ten years. The business is located in the center local market of Gafurov city, allowing Bashorat to serve many clients and to have her clientele. The business is successful at generating a stable income, allowing Bashorat to support her family. Today Bashorat requests $300 dollars for the term of 6 months. She is planning to purchase foodstuffs in order to enlarge the range of goods for selling. Bashorat thanks all for support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: To purchase goods for selling

loans.name: Dum

texts.en:
Dum S., 58, is a married mother who works as farmer. She makes around $1.00 each day. Her husband farms vegetables and everyday he earns approximately  $1.50 by selling those vegetables in the market. They have four children and all of them have their own businesses that help support the family.

Her husband always brings vegetable to sell in the market by motor-taxi so that he can save time. He would like to apply for a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike with a trailer to transfer vegetables to the market. Any remaining money will be used to purchase more farmland to grow more vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike with a trailer and additional land to grow crops.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Mrs. Hai R. is a grocer in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 53 and a widow with three children, two of whom are construction workers while the other attends school.

Mrs. Hai R. is building a new house for herself and her family. The house is nearly completed but Mrs. Hai R. does not have enough money to finish paying the house builders and so has decided to request a loan to pay for the rest of the building expenses.

loans.use: To pay for the building work and renovations made to her house

loans.name: Viviana Marisol

texts.es:
Señora Viviana lives in the area called September 14th in Garita in Lima. She has been dedicated to selling products for the home for 14 years. She lives with her husband, who doesn't have a fixed source of income. They have 3 children who depend directly on Viviana. She also supports 2 grandchildren from her oldest daughter, who is a single mother. She works Monday-Saturday for more than 12 hours each day. The conditions in which she lives aren't very comfortable, but one can tell that there is a lot of love in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La sra. Viviana, vive en la zona de 14 de septiembre, Garita de Lima; se dedica a la venta de productos para el hogar desde hace 14 años; vive con su marido, que no tiene una fuente de ingresos fija, ambos tienen 3 hijos los cuales dependen directamente de ella, asimismo mantiene a 2 nietos de la hija mayor quien es madre soltera. Trabaja de lunes a sabado más de 12 horas diarias. Las condiciones en las que vive no son muy cómodas, pero se puede percibir que en ese hogar existe mucho amor.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Viviana Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Viviana  pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Lupuna” ubicado en el Jr: 23 de Febrero Nº 535 Pj Micaela Bastidas, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años, es madre de 1 hijo menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.200, decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. 

En la actualidad cuenta con un motokar y posee la ayuda de su hermano para  poner a trabajar día a día su herramienta de trabajo, y de esa manera poder pagar puntualmente el préstamo.    

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700 el cual será cancelado en 5 meses, invertirá en el arreglo de la motokar, para ello comprará 3 llantas, 1 par de telescopios, 4 focos, 1 faro y también invertirá en la educación de su pequeño hijo.
   
Viviana está muy contenta y agradecida porque gracias a Manuela Ramos mejoró su estabilidad económica para el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en:
Viviana belongs to “La Lupuna” community bank, located at No.535 Jr. 23 de Febrero PjMicaela Bastidas, district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 30, single and has a young son that still depends on her. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of $65 US (S/.200), she decided to invest in selling food. Currently, she has a motorized cart and with the help of her brother they use it as a tool to work with everyday and repay the loan on time. With this $575 US (S/.1,700) loan, to be repaid in 5 months, she will fix the motorized cart and will buy three tires, a pair of reflectors, four lights, 1 headlight and also in the education expenses of her small son. Viviana is very happy and thankful to Manuela Ramos for improving her financial stability for the well being of her son.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix motorized cart

loans.name: Merima

texts.en: Merima, 23 and married with a two-year-old son, lives in Đurđevik, an agricultural village in Bosnia.  Merima owns a small stand at the local marketplace where she sells clothing and accessories.  Recently, she has started to supplement her income by using a computer to prepare diplomas and announcements for local schools and businesses.  Eager to develop this business so as to be less reliant upon her clothing stand for income,  Merima is requesting a loan to purchase a computer that will allow her to offer higher quality services and products to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase a new computer.

loans.name: Romer Celso

texts.es:
Celso tiene un  taller donde fabrica estructuras de metal para automóviles como ser chasis de movilidades. Tiene dos empleados, vive con sus padres y hermano donde apoya económicamente con la familia, su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Santa Rosa de la ciudad de El Alto. 


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de materia prima  (hierro), es vital que él pueda satisfacer la demanda que tiene en su mercado.


Es su primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Celso has a shop where he makes metal parts for cars, such as chassis. He has two employees, and he lives with his parents and his brother, providing financial support for the family. His home is located in the area of Santa Rosa in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be destined to purchase raw materials (iron). It is vital that he satisty the demand that he sees in his market.

It is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation carried out has enabled the approval of the loan requested.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. R. forma parte de una familia de 5 integrantes ellos ya tiene mas de 8 años de habitar la misma casa, en este tiempo han empezado a surgir los problemas de humedad y por consecuencia se han dañado los acabados, como él nos cuenta; es desagradable y estresante entrar a la vivienda y lo primero que se da a notar son las manchas que va dejando la humedad, requiere impermeabilizar y reparar el cielo de la casa. Al momento de la visita al domicilio del Sr. Juan Antonio no se encontraba, el trabajo se lo impidió, en sustitución de su persona nos atendió su esposa la Sra. María Rafaela quien reafirmó las necesidades expuestas.

Solicita a ustedes su colaboración para cumplir con el objetivo trazado. En el momento que se realice la mejora los enteraremos de los resultados.
texts.en:
Mr R. has a family of 5 and they have been living in the same house for eight years. During this time dampness problems have emerged and damaged the finish. As he tells us it is uncomfortable and stressing to enter the house and the first thing you notice are the damp patches. He needs to fix the ceiling and make it waterproof. He was not home for the visit but his wife, Mrs. María Rafaela confirmed the stated necessity.

He requests your collaboration to reach the objective and we will be informed about the results as soon as they have been accomplished.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix a ceiling and make it waterproof.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 40 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos. Para mantener su hogar tuvo que dedicarse a múltiples actividades, entre todas ellas, encontró en la venta de ropa la oportunidad de suplir las necesidades en su hogar, ya hace10 años que este negocio le es muy rentable ya que compra gran cantidad de mercadería en la ciudad capital y las lleva a su propia ciudad, donde puede duplicar el precio de cada prenda, pero para obtener mayores ganancias  tienes que invertir para grandes cantidades de prendas y trasportarlas hasta su localidad, siendo un costo adicional en su presupuesto. Nancy está en su tercer préstamo con MFP, y siempre ha sido una de las más cumplidas dentro de su grupo de clientas. Con el dinero que solicita aprovechará la gran demanda que hay por fiestas y viajará a la capital para comprar mayores cantidades de prendas para venderlas en las ferias de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old, and a single mother living with her two children. To support her household, she had to dedicate herself to multiple activities. Among these, she found in clothing sales the chance to provide for the family’s needs. She has been in this business for 10 years now, which is very profitable given that she buys a great deal of her merchandise in the capital city to take to her own town where she can double the price of each item. However, to improve her earnings, she has to invest in a large amount of each clothing item and transport them to her area, which is an additional cost. Nancy is in her third loan with MFP, and she has always been one of the most responsible people in her group. With the funds she is requesting, she will take advantage of the great demand over the holiday season due to all the festivities. She will also travel to the capital to purchase a greater quantity of clothes to sell in the markets of her city.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of clothing that she sells.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a proud mother of two: Heidi Rose – 23 years old, a graduate of Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and Jomar – 25 years old, Commerce graduate and already working.  Her husband is Lucinano who works as a company driver for 24 years.  Rose, as she is fondly called is very proud that through their income they were able to send their children to school and finish their studies.  Their family has been living in the village for 27 years.  

Rose is presently engaged in the hog raising business.  She would like to avail a loan of PHP 14,000.00 which she will use to pursue her plan of renovating her pig pen and to purchase feeds supply for her hogs.  She wanted to maintain this type of business because she believes that hog raising is a good business if managed well.  She wanted to improve it for it will help her family and children when they decided to get married.  She is also encouraging her relatives and neighbors to start raising at least one piglet that they can sell after 3-4 months.

loans.use: Purchase of feeds for her hogs and renovation of pig pen

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda O. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high. Linda sells footwear and underwear at Abura, which she has done for the last ten years. Her husband is a trader. Linda uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses and other financial needs of the family. Linda will use the loan to purchase additional stock of underwear and footwear to meet the increase in demand by her customers. Linda plans to reinvest her additional profits back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of footwear and underwear

loans.name: Sidth

texts.en: Mrs. Sidth T. is a villager in Chi Chrab village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Koem Ra, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a motor taxi driver. Even though they have different businesses, they want to breed pigs to increase their income. Thus, Mrs. Sidth T. decided to request a loan to buy four piglets and pig food for breeding to earn more income to support her family. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. She and her husband are presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy four piglets for breeding and pig food

loans.name: Dossa

texts.fr: Monsieur  A. Dossa a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de cartes de recharges, il y a beaucoup de société de téléphonie à Lomé ce qui fait que ce commerce est très rentable à Lomé. Son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de faire face convenablement à la demande ; pour cela il sollicite de WAGES son  premier crédit pour acheter des cartons de cartes de recharges
texts.en:
Mr. Dossa A. earns a living selling rechargeable phone cards. In Lomé there are a lot of telephone companies which makes the business of selling phone cards very profitable. His current supply does not enable him to properly meet the demand; for this reason he is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy boxes of rechargeable phone cards.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
"I started my business tilling the more than 2-hectare land of my parents," says Viola E., a mother of five children from Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. "Now that it is officially mine, I gain a lot of meaningful experience how to farm to ensure food for the family."

Viola E. is married to a farmer. They are together for many years already. She is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy diesel fuel to run the tractor for the farm and to buy seeds for the next planting season. The loan will help benefit Viola's family by growing their farm and attaining better yield.

CEVI is reaching out to more farmers to grow and sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides all their clients with credit, training and insurance coverage to help their small businesses to grow.

loans.use: Purchase of diesel fuel and certified rice seed

loans.name: Hurshedjon

texts.ru:
Хуршеджон Махмудов вот уже 7 лет работает маляром. Он один из членов группы по ремонту жилья.Ежедневно,кроме выходных, с 7 утра и до 8 вечера, Хуршеджон трудится на работе, занимаясь покраской стен и полов квартир и домов.
 Он женат, имеет 2 детей.Хочет получить займ в размере 200 сомони, для приобретения необходимых основных средств для ремонта.  
 Кроме ремонта домов и квартир, он подрабатывает таксистом. Развозит клиентов по месту требования, и делает это в нерабочие дни.
texts.en:
Hurshedjon M. works as a painter for seven years now. He is one of the group members for home repairs. Hurshedjon works hard painting the walls and floors in houses and apartments every day from 7am to 8pm except weekends.

He is married and has two children. He wants to take out a loan in the amount of 200 somoni (US$75) to buy the necessary materials for the remodeling. Besides doing home renovations he also works as a taxi driver part time. He transports customers to their destinations and does that on his days off.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is engaged in a vending business in her village. She sells snack refreshments such as “halo-halo” and “balot” at night as an additional source of income.  She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to be used in purchasing more of her vending products to sell daily in her village. Margie started this business just a month ago, and she wants to be more productive by having her business grow. This business is very important to her because it is her sole source of income. 

Her daily income is quite enough to provide their daily needs.  But Margie aims to become more successful in the business and she hopes through that, they can uplift their life from poverty.  Margie is 29 years old, and is married to Dominic B., a farm laborer. The couple is blessed with two children and they are happily living in the mountainous village of Batong Labang (Bintacan) Ilagan, Isabela.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania tiene 41 años, está casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en un cuarto alquilado, ya que sus recursos económicos no le permiten adquirir un terreno en la ciudad y espera que con el  esfuerzo de cada miembro de la familia puedan realizar el sueño de la casa propia. Desde que era soltera trabajaba para ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar, ahora casada trabajar para mantener su propio hogar. Hace 8 años viene vendiendo ropa en la puerta del mercado de su distrito, donde la encontramos todas las mañanas desde las 8 hasta el medio día,  hora que retorna a su casa para realizar sus actividades domésticas. Adicionalmente, cada mes, se traslada a otras provincias llevando pedidos de ropa, las cuales entrega a crédito y así obtiene mejores ganancias puesto que los precios son mayores debido a la distancia que tiene que recorrer para llevar lo solicitado. Para un futuro, Tania ansia tener un puesto de ventas estable para vender cómodamente y conseguir la sostenibilidad de su negocio. Este es su 4to préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y como miembro de su banco comunal trabaja con esmero y entusiasmo para realizar los objetivos que comparte con todas sus compañeras. Con los 1000 soles que solicita incrementará su mercadería, pues requiere de variedad de prendas para llevarlas a provincias este fin de mes.
texts.en:
Tania is 41, married, and has two children. She lives in a rented room. Her economic resources do not allow her to acquire land in the city. She hopes that with the effort of each member of her family, they will be able to fulfill the dream of having their own house. When she was single she worked to help her mother with the household expenses. Now that she is married, she works to support her own household. For eight years she has been selling clothes in the entrance to the market in her district. She is there every morning from eight until midday. Then she returns home to perform her domestic chores. Also, every month she travels to other provinces delivering orders of clothing. She sells them on credit, and that way her earnings are better. The prices are higher due to the distance she has to cover to deliver the order. In the future, Tania is anxious to have a stable place to sell comfortably and be able to sustain her business. This is her fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. As a member of her community bank, she works carefully and enthusiastically to meet the objectives that she shares with her colleagues. She will use the 1,000 PEN to increase her merchandise. She needs a variety of articles to take to the provinces at the end of this month.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en: Chinyere is 37 years old and married with five children. She sells kerosene in retail to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Carla Lorena

texts.es: La Sra Carla Lorena  reside en la localidad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra tiene 18 años de edad va a tener un bebe vive junto con su esposo el Sr.:Erick Ayala y su padre Saul Enrrique Ledesma , la Sra se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos y su esposo trabaja de control de microbuses hace mucho tiempo, la Sra junto con su esposo  solo sacan credito de nuestra institucion (Emprender) ella esta necesitando un financiamiento de 500 Sus para la compra de cosmeticos al contado y una pequeña vitrina para usarla como mostrador en un puesto de venta. y aumentar sus Ingresos.
texts.en:
Carla Lorena lives in the town of Santa Cruz de la Sierra with her husband Erick Ayala and her father Saul Enrrique Ledesma. She is 18 years old and is going to have a baby.
She sells cosmetics and her husband has worked as a minibus monitor for a long time. She and her husband only take out credit with our institution (Emprender).
She needs a $500 loan to have the cash to purchase cosmetics and a small glass cabinet to use as a display case at her stall, and to increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en: Modesta lives in Lagos and runs a restaurant business. Modesta has three girls that assist her in her food business and she pays them on a monthly basis. She has been in the business for the past two years. Modesta is 31 years old and married with three children. She is asking for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more food to cook and sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more food

loans.name: Olena

texts.en: Olena is married. She sells cosmetics from a small space that she rents in a department store. She has been in this business for three years. The business has been a stable source of income for Olena and her family. Olena's business goal is to open a second location and increase sales. Olena has been using micro-loans and finds them very helpful for her business development. Olena would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Kitale

texts.en:
Kitale C. is 30 years old and married to a businessman. She has six children who all go to school. Kitale has a business selling green vegetables and oranges at the nearby market. She is requesting a loan to purchase Irish potatoes and tomatoes to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children and provide food for her family.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase Irish potatoes and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Her loan will be used to purchase more shoes and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario es una mujer muy trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 50 años y es madre D. tres hijos D. los cuales dos son mayores D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catálogos y  prendas D. vestir. Cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se desempeña como empleado público. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” desD. hace ocho años. El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles que invirtió en golosinas, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito D. 1200 soles que invertirá  en prendas D. vestir, carteras y accesorios. La meta D. Rosario es tener una boutique y seguir trabajando.

loans.use: Invertirá  en prendas de vestir, carteras y accesorios.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Y. Gulnora is married and has three children. She runs a business selling men’s socks at the market of Tursunzade, Tajikistan. Her business exhibits good economic characteristics and fundamentals.

Gulnora has a unique talent for identifying new opportunities and determining appropriate growth policies for her business. She has been in this trade for 14 years.

Gulnora would like to get a loan of 5000 Somoni ($1150 USD) to increase her working capital so that she can continue working to improve her business. We believe her natural ability to please her customers by perceiving their needs and offering speedy, courteous service will help Gulnora achieve her goals, sustain her success,and win out as an entrepreneur.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing working capital with the purpose of development of business

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer muy simpática y amable de 47 años, vive con sus dos hijos: Jenny de 26 y Jimmy de 29 años, además la acompañan su nuera y su pequeña nieta a quien cuida como su propia hija.

Ella se dedica a la venta de diversos productos en su pequeña tienda, al principio solo vendía comestibles y gaseosas, pero como percibió la necesidad de los pobladores de la zona donde vive, empezó a vender costales (grandes bolsas donde los agricultores guardan los vegetales, tubérculos), además de pabilos y diferentes plásticos. 
De esta manera obtiene más ganancias económicas porque le compran al por mayor, además al culminar la tarde empieza la venta de salchipollo-platillo compuesto de papas y pollo frito- que es muy buscado entre los habitantes de la zona por su exquisitez y sabor.
Así son los días de Olga, quien a pesar de no tener hijos pequeños trabaja porque quiere salir adelante, para poder descansar tranquila en un futuro sin que nada le falte, además labora  porque lo aprendió desde muy pequeña y así lo ha hecho durante toda su vida. 
Como ella es muy luchadora quiere en el futuro ampliar su negocio y vender otros implementos y herramientas que necesitan los agricultores, ya que no hay mucha competencia en la zona. 

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser cumplida, como en cada acción de su vida, pues así se lo enseñaron, es por eso que hoy tiene un próspero negocio. Olga tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en mayor cantidad de mercadería e implementos agrícolas, ya que con la venta de esto obtiene muy buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Olga is a kind and likeable woman who is 47 years old. She lives with her two children, Jenny (age 26) and Jimmy (age 29). Included in her family is a daughter-in-law and young granddaughter who she cares for like her own child.

She sells a variety of products from her small shop. At first she only sold snacks and sodas, but after assessing the needs of the area residents, she started selling gunny sacks (large burlap bags used by farmers for keeping vegetables and tubers), candlewicks, and different plastics. She was able to generate more revenue by acquiring products in bulk. Olga later began selling “salchipollo” (a dish consisting of potatoes and fried chicken), which is highly sought after by the locals for its exquisite taste.

Despite not having young children, she must still work in order to stay ahead. Olga hopes to retire peacefully in the future, but still not lack anything. She learned how to work at a very young age and has continued to do throughout her life. Olga continues to fight for what she wants, so she is looking to expand her business in the future and sell other equipment and tools requested by farmers. In addition, she wants to take advantage of the lack of competition in the area.

This is her second loan with MFP. As with every action she has taken in her life, Olga promises to complete her obligations. She has demonstrated her responsibility, which shows why her business is thriving. Olga plans to invest the money in a greater quantity of merchandise and farming implements, which should increase her sales and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory & purchase farming implements to sell

loans.name: Yarv

texts.en:
Yarv C. is 24 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She makes and sells food at the local resort in front of the riverside. On average, she is able to make about US $3 per day. Her husband is a fisherman and makes US $2 each day. This couple has three young children.

Yarv C. is asking for a loan of US $600 to build a stand along the riverside so that she can welcome guests to sit and buy her food.

loans.use: Build a stand.

loans.name: Petronilo

texts.es:
el sr. Petronilo C. tiene 65 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 14 hijos de los cuales solo 4 dependen de el,  ya que los otros estan adultos y ya formaron su hogar.
Petronilo  se dedica a la venta de abarroteria como: frijoles, azucar, maiz, arroz, café, manteca, aceite, papel higienico, jabon de baño, pastas etc desde hace varios años y su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Langue.
en estos ultimos meses a tenido pocas ventas ya que no tiene muy surtida su tienda, por tal razon esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mas ventas y mas ganancias, esta es la unica fuente de trabajo del sr. Petronilo.
el es una persona luchadora, pero dice sentirse cansado.
su meta es poder acodicionar mejor su negocio y hacerlo mas grande para poder estar tranquilo durante varios años.
texts.en:
Mr. Petronilo is 65 years old, lives in a common law union, and has 14 children. Just 4 still depend on him, since the others are adults and have already established their own homes.

Petronilo has for many years sold grocery items such as beans, sugar, corn, rice, coffee, lard, cooking oil, toilet paper, bath soap, pasta, etc. His business is located in the municipal market in the city of Langue.

For the last few months he has had little sales because his store lacks variety of inventory. For that reason, he is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise and thus, increase sales and earnings. This is Petronilo's only source of income. He is a determined person but he says he feels tired.

His goal is to be able to improve his business and make it larger in order to be secure in the coming years.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SOFT DRINKS, BEANS, SUGAR, CORN, RICE, COFFEE, LARD, OIL, TOILET PAPER, BATH SOAP, AND DETERGENT

loans.name: Geronima Esperanza

texts.es: Geronima ha realizado varios financiamientos con Fundación León 2000, por lo que agradece la oportunidad que le brindaron en confiar en ella. Tiene la actividad económica de venta de tortillas cabe señalar que la señora trabaja muy fuertemente todos los días. Este negocio empezó hace 41 años con muy poco capital de trabajo, como una búsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos, después fue que empezó a invertir con el tiempo, por lo que ahora tiene su propia fama con sus tortillas.  El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima, ya que se acerca la época navideña y la señora desea invertir y materia prima. Su deseo es proporcionarle las mejoras necesarias a su negocio.
texts.en:
Geronima has fulfilled several loan cycles with Fundación León 2000, so she is grateful for the opportunity they gave her by trusting her. Her economic activity is selling tortillas. It should be noted that she works heavily every day. This business began 41 years ago with very little working capital, as a search for alternative income sources; later, she invested more into the business and now she and her tortillas are renowned. The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials, since the Christmas season is coming near, and she wants to make an investment and buy raw materials. Her wish is to give her business the improvements it needs.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional goods in bulk for her shop.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married and has two children. He works at the local market selling slippers and seeds. Alexander has been in this business for six years. He considers himself to be a successful entrepreneur. First of all, his kiosk is located at a good place in the market. Second, but not least, his products are good quality and he gives good customer service. Many people come back to Alexander and become repeat clients.
Alexander would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to purchase more seeds in view of the upcoming spring season. He hopes to receive additional income and spend it on his family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Paula Carmela

texts.es:
Paula tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su hijo de seis años de edad en el sector Macabi del distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope en la región La Libertad, ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene instalada en su vivienda una librería en la ofrece servicio de fotocopias, tipeos y búsqueda de trabajos en internet. Ella nos comenta que empezó vendiendo papel bond animada por algunas madres de familia del lugar, ya que su casa queda cerca al colegio de la zona. Poco a poco fue ampliando el negocio y ahora este goza de mucha acogida, sobretodo durante la temporada escolar, que va desde el mes de Marzo hasta Diciembre.

Paula desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de útiles escolares, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una madre luchadora, trabajadora y emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es otorgarle a su menor hijo una educación de calidad que le garantice un próspero futuro. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Paula is 41 years old and is a single mother who lives with her 6 year-old son in the Macabi area of Paiján district, in the Ascope province of the La Libertad region, located 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo. In her house she has set up an office supply store where she offers photocopying, typing, and internet search services.
