She tells us that she started out selling printer paper, encouraged by some mothers in the area, since her house is located close to a school in the neighborhood. Gradually she expanded her business, and now her business is widely accepted by the community, especially during the school season, which goes from March until December. Paula wishes to increase her business by purchasing school supplies, but she does not have sufficient capital to do this. For this reason she has seen the necessity of requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 Peruvian soles. She is a mother who is a fighter, and is enterprising and hardworking. Her main wish is to furnish her young son with a quality education that will guarantee him a prosperous future. She has worked previously with our institution, and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy school supplies to increase her business during the school season

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon G. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years-old. Corazon is separated from her spouse and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a business selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Corazon joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Corazon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Yanjmaa

texts.en: Yanjmaa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Uvs province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger. They have been living in their current home for five years. Yanjmaa's four children attend a local secondary school.  She operates a clothing trading business with her husband. Yanjmaa has been purchasing clothing from China, and reselling them to Russian border cities for a profit since 1997 and has steadily grown her business. Yanjmaa gained valuable experience in previous years, and her business stabilized. Furthermore, her sales revenue is quite good. She has been planning to rent a counter at a local market in Ulaangom soon.  Yanjmaa is an honest person who has a great business mind.  The most important thing to her is being able to provide for her children's education. Yanjmaa says, “My oldest daughter will enroll in a university next year. Therefore, I have to save money for my children's education.”  She is requesting a 2,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase a variety of clothing from China to resell them to Russians for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Caroline Cheruto

texts.en:
Caroline Cheruto L. is twenty-eight years old and a single mother to one beautiful girl. She lives in Sergoit in Eldoret and she is a farmer who plants maize and passion fruits to sell. She has been in the farming business for four years now and most of her customers are her neighbors as well as one of Kenya’s biggest maize suppliers, the National Cereals Produce Board. She also has a secondary business which is a retail shop where she sells fast-moving foods. 

She came to know about KADET through another KADET client who is her neighbor. This will be her first loan from KADET. With the entire loan, Caroline is going to buy farm supplies like maize seedlings and passion fruit seedlings. 

Her future dream is to be able to get more income so that she can buy some land of her own where she can expand her farming business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies like maize seedlings.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Antonia tiene 49 años, vive en pareja y tiene 3 hijas, dos de ellas ya son mayores de edad, una de ellas ya culminó sus estudios universitarios mientras la otra sigue estudiando y la menor esta en el colegio.
Ellos viven en la compañía de Las Piedras en su propio domicilio. Su pareja trabaja en la ANDE como Electricista de Distribución hace mas de 26 años.
Antonia trabajaba anteriormente en un supermercado y como se había dado cuenta del buen ingreso que dejaba el negocio, se empeñó hasta formar su propia despensa que hasta hoy día es el que sustenta los gastos familiares, más el ingreso de su marido.
También tiene alquileres de sillas, mesas y cubiertos, dicha actividad comenzó después de haber festejado la fiesta de 15 años de su hija, ya que en ese entonces había comprado las sillas, mesas y cubiertos y como ya no las usaría más, decidió alquilarlas para cualquier otro tipo de eventos de la zona.
Ella tiene un proyecto, que es el de construir una casilla, ya que posee una panadería inactiva y mediante esta construcción podrá exhibir sus productos, para lo cual solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
Antonia is 49 years old. She lives with her spouse and 3 daughters. Two of them are adults- one of them them graduated from college and the other is still at school. The youngest is in high school. They live in Las Piedras in their own home. Her spouse has worked for ANDE as a distribution electricist for more than 26 years. Antonia previously worked in a supermarket. Realizing that the business provided a good income, she worked to establish her own convenience store. Today it continues to be the family's support, more than her husband's income. She also rents out chairs, tables and flatware. She began this activity after having a party for her daughter when she turned 15. She purchased chairs, tables and flatware, and since she wasn't going to use them again, she decided to rent them out for any type of event in the area. She has a project, which is constructing a little building. She has an inactive bread bakery and with the contruction she can show her product. That is why she is asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Bénédiction Group

texts.fr:
Mapendo Nazirambula  est présidente du groupe de crédit Bénédiction, elle lève la main sur la photo devant la porte, cliente au 4e  cycle de crédit, âgée de 33 ans, mariée. Elle est mère de  7 enfants  parmi lesquels   5  vont à l’école et 2 autres sont encore gosses. Son mari est chômeur (sans emploi). 
Mapendo Nazirambula vend des braises. Elle a commencé son business avec son fond propre reçu de son mari, quand celui-ci travaillait dans une quincaillerie d’un particulier. Son capital initial était de 50$. Elle vend les braises  dans un marché public du secteur Alanine se trouvant dans la commune urbaine de Goma à 8 km du centre ville. Il ya 5 ans que Mapendo Nazirambula exerce cette activité de vente de braises. Elle s’approvisionne dans le village de Kichanga, territoire de Masisi, fief du général Nkunda,ex leader du mouvement rebelle CNDP,à l’Est de la RDCongo.
Avec  le crédit de l’IMF Hekima, Mapendo Nazirambula souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 15 sacs de braises.  Le grand defi de Mapendo Nazirambula, elle  n’est pas encore à mesure de débarquer elle seule un camion pour ses marchandises, sur ce, elle est  obligée de s’associer avec une autre personne (commerçante) pour se partager les couts transactionnels et charge de  location de véhicule transporteur.  
Dans l’avenir, elle ambitionne accroitre son business et atteindre un capital de 1500$ enfin de réaliser ses rêves notamment ouvrir un grand dépôt de braises, ouvrir une quincaillerie. En outre, le souci de Mapendo Nazirambula est de voir son mari trouver du travail.  
Mapendo Nazirambula remercie  l’IMF Hekima, pour les crédits réguliers qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle, car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux multiples besoins de sa famille, surtout durant cette période où son mari n’a pas du travail.
Le groupe Bénédiction  est composé de 13 membres, toutes femmes.
texts.en:
Mapendo Nazirambula is president of the Bénédiction loan group, and it is her raising her hand in front of the door on the photo. A customer on her fourth loan, she is 33 years old and married. She is mother to seven children, of whom five go to school, the other two being still small children. Her husband is unemployed. Mapendo sells charcoal. She began this business with her own capital, given to her by her husband when he was working in a private individual's hardware store. Her initial capital was $50. She sells the charcoal at a public market in the Alanine area of the urban municipality of Goma, eight kilometers from the centre of town. Mapendo has been carrying out this charcoal business for five years. She gets her supplies in the village of Kichanga, in the Masisi territory, which is the domain of General Nkunda, the ex-leader of the rebel movement CNDP, in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo. The problem for Mapendo is that she does not yet have the means to fill a full lorry by herself, so she is obliged to get together with another businesswoman in order to share the transactional costs and the expense of renting a vehicle to transport the goods. For the future her ambition is to grow her business, reach a capital of $1,500, and finally realise her dreams, notably of opening a large warehouse for charcoal and a hardware store. Furthermore, the main concern for Mapendo is for her husband to find work. Mapendo is grateful to IMF Hekima for the regular loans she receives without having to provide any material guarantee. Thanks to these loans she is able to provide for the multiple needs of her family, above all during this period when her husband is out of work. The Bénédiction group is made up of 13 members, all of whom are women.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 15 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Evangeline Banez Group

texts.en:
Evangeline B., from the village of Tupan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, is the 41-year-old leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Evangeline Banez Group.

Evangeline, who is married and has two school-aged children, owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 900 PHP a month.

In 2007, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC that was used to to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Evangeline's sixth loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: United Traders Group

texts.en:
Marie B. (pictured second from right) is the leader of this group. Marie was born in Magburaka. She is 38 years of age, married to a teacher, and they have four children who are attending primary school. Marie sells market food such as groundnut (peanuts), rice and palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil). She has been running this business for five years now. With the help of this loan, she will buy rice, groundnut and palm oil wholesale in order to expand the size and quality of her business.

In the picture are members of the "United Traders" Group and loan officer, Mohamed L. Tarawalie, on the right, handing over the loan. They are small scale businesswomen in the northern town of Magburaka. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living conditions will improve – they can at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their school fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills in case any of them falls sick.

loans.use: To buy rice, groundnut and palm oil wholesale

loans.name: Jorge Miguel

texts.en:
Jorge Miguel is a good man, living with his 18-year-old daughter and his wife, a teacher who runs a preschool out of the first floor of their home. Indeed, the high-pitched voices of the more than 30 tiny students swell up through the house during the day and seem to be music to the ears of this happy, smiling couple. 

Jorge sells natural medicines and takes pride in his work managing the health of his neighbors. He was born in Arenal, in the neighboring state of Bolivar, but has lived in Barranquilla since he was 14. He came here looking for a future and he found it, first going to the university until financial problems forced him to drop out of his Economics program and take a job at a local bank. He worked there for 5 years, and after losing his job began selling natural products. 

His tubercular father had done this before him, and Jorge took advantage of that to take on his father's former clients to kickstart his business. This also permitted him to branch out of his neighborhood along with several of his friends, and they all  began selling their goods throughout various municipalities in Barranquilla and then in the neighboring states of Cesar and Guajira, then on in to Venezuela. 

Thanks to this business (and the hard work his wife has done), Jorge has been able to take care of his home and family. This loan will be his first credit from Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he plans to use it to buy natural medicines such as antihistamines, vitamins, minerals, anti-aging products and even honey (to sweeten the taste of some of the more bitter medications), all to sell in his business. Jorge dreams of buying a place where he can independently showcase and sell his products. His greatest challenge so far has been the dearth of low-cost funding options available to small businesses, but through FMSD and Kiva he hopes to grow and continue helping those around him through his work.

[EN ESPANOL]       

Jorge Miguel Jiménez M. es un buen hombre que vive en carrizal con su hija de 18 años y su esposa, una pedagoga que tiene un reconocido centro educativo infantil en este barrio. Jorge Miguel  se dedica a la venta de medicamentos naturales, que asegura mejoran el estado de salud de las personas. Él nació en Arenal, departamento de Bolívar y desde sus 14 años esta radicado en Barranquilla, donde llegó buscando un mejor porvenir; terminó su bachillerato e ingresó a la universidad y por problemas económicos no pudo finalizar, así que hizo 8 semestres de Economía y se empleó en un banco, donde trabajó por 5 años y cuando perdió este empleo, se dedicó a vender productos naturales, negocio que a través de su padre, hombre mayorista de tubérculos en el mercado publico de Barranquilla, logró fortalecer aprovechando su clientela de entonces. Fue así como junto a varios amigos, comenzaron la distribución en diferentes municipios de Barranquilla, en los departamentos de la Guajira y el Cesar y también en Venezuela; con este negocio y el gran empuje de su esposa,  Jorge Miguel ha logrado sostener su hogar conformado  darle bienestar a su familia. En la actualidad solicita su primer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar medicinas naturales como antiinflamatorios, vitaminas, minerales, preventivos del envejecimiento y hasta miel pura de abejas, para venderlas en su negocio.
Sueña con comprar un local para  tener de manera independiente su tienda de productos naturistas y manifiestos como un gran  desafío,  las pocas oportunidades de créditos a bajo costo para   negocios pequeños, siente que a través de la medicina natural logra ayudar al que miles de personas se mantengan o recuperen su salud.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines such as antihistamines, vitamins, minerals, anti-aging products, and even honey

loans.name: Sumaira's Group

texts.en:
Sumaira lives with her family in a city called Chichawatni, in Pakistan.  She is twenty-seven years old and doesn’t have any children. She lives in a communal family system. She stays at home and takes care of her family by cooking their food and doing household chores.

She is applying for a second time for a loan from Asasah to help her husband pay the remaining installments on his auto rickshaw. 
 
She is very hopeful that she can change her family's standard of living by making positive decisions about her family business. Her application for a loan is part of that. She is hopeful that it will prove to be a good decision.

loans.use: Pay off the remaining installments on a rickshaw

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza A. is from the village of Maguikay, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 39 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Flordeliza owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.  Flordeliza has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Flordeliza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions. 

-----------------------------------------
About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida D. is from the village of Calamagui 1st, Ilagan. She is 52 years old. Leonida is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns and operates a beauty salon providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide services. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide additional services. This will be Leonida's fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide services

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase firewood and baking tools.

loans.name: Freddy Daniel

texts.es: Freddy tiene 52 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de taller de soldadura. Hace más de 30 años Freddy. El dio inicio este negocio por que no tenía un trabajo, y su esposa y su hijo necesitaban el sustento diario, por lo que no es la primera vez que tiene experiencia con financiamientos pues ha sido de buena ayuda. El financiamiento es para comprar materia prima como hierro liso, corrugado entre otros productos. A pesar de los difíciles problemas que enfrenta como las cuentas por cobrar.
texts.en:
Freddy is 52. He offers a welding shop service. Over 30 years ago Freddy started this business because he did not have a job, and his wife and child needed their daily sustenance. This is not his first experience with loans, and they have been a great help to him. This loan is for the purchase of basic materials such as flat and corrugated iron, among other products, despite the difficulties he has had such as charge accounts.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Phylis Mwende

texts.en:
Phylis is married to Japheth and they have three children, namely Mercy, Wayua and Munene who are aged 15, 12 and 5 respectively. She is in the clothes business and has been in this business for 10 years. Phylis's business is located in a busy marketplace and thus has a number of customers.

Phylis joined KADET when a credit officer explained what we do to her. Phylis is servicing a second loan in KADET and has had no other loans with other microfinance institutions (MFIs). The current loan will be used to open another boutique and also to save for future restocking with the extra profits that Phylis will save.

Phylis hopes to be a big textile seller/wholesaler and she describes herself as ambitious and focused.

loans.use: To open another boutique

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan J., 36 and married to Grace Cheche, is the father of three children aged 10, 7, and 5 years old.  For the past two years, Allan has owned and operated a mobile phone accessories business in Kakamega town.  Introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a client of the organization, Alan is now applying for his first loan to buy phone accessories such as batteries, chargers, etc. His dream is to open up an electronics shop in the future as his business expands.

loans.use: To buy phone chargers and batteries to add to his stock

loans.name: Remedios

texts.es:
Remedios solicito 1000 $us; se dedica a la comercialización de discos compactos, cassetes, al por menor, en su puesto de venta ubicado en plena vía publica.
El crédito le servirá para aumento de capital y así poder adquirir mercadería al por mayor. Es el segundo  crédito en impro y el segundo vía Kiva.
Remedios vive en Villa tunari, zona ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto; está casada y tiene 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Remedios asked for  US $1000. She sells compact disks, and cassettes retail at her locale right on a public street.  

The loan will be used to increase capital and thus be able to acquire merchandise wholesale. This is the second loan from Impro and the second one via Kiva.  

Remedios lives in Villa Tunari, an area located in the city of El Alto. She is married and has 4 children.

loans.use: To buy CDs and cassettes wholesale for her retail business.

loans.name: Joyce Adjoa

texts.en: Joyce Adjoa N. is married and has three children. She has received a senior high education. Joyce operates a bar where she sells soft drinks at Abura. She has been in this trade for five years. Her husband is a driver. Joyce uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She is going to use the loan to purchase more soft drinks to meet the requests of her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Joyce plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to meet the requests of her customers.

loans.name: Omuhereza

texts.en: Omuhereza is a 60-year-old, ambitious woman, married with six children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her old-age wish is to build a permanent house, since all her life she has lived in a semi-permanent one. Her business is trading produce, such as maize, rice and groundnuts. She has been in the business for four years and has a vision of having storefronts. Omuhereza intends to use the loan to buy rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase rice for sell

loans.name: Edwin Rene

texts.es: El señor Edwin Rene C. C.:  esta solicitando un refinanciamiento de crédito para poder seguir compramdo y fabricando muebles para una mueblería que tiene ubicada en su casa ya tiene  ubicado en un buen punto de venta  porque esta en la orilla de la carretera donde muchas personas lo visitan  para ver que tipo de  muebles  tiene, quiere emplear el capital que le otorguen  para poder colocar variedad de muebles    ya que en estos meses son mas constantes la venta  por fin de año y asi mismo poder sacar unos pedidos de muebles que le han hecho sus clientes. Sus sueños es poder tener otra venta propia de muebles en otro lugar y tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Edwin Rene C. C. is requesting a loan renewal in order to continue buying and making furniture for a furniture business that he has at his house.   He has a good sales location because he is on the edge of the road where a lot of people go to see what type of furniture he has.

He wants to use the loan to be able to invest in a variety of furniture.  Sales are steadier during these months that are at the end of the year.  He will also be able to fill some furniture orders that his customers have made.

His dreams are to be able to have another location of his own for selling furniture and to have more income.

loans.use: To buy and make furniture

loans.name: Maria Yaquelin

texts.es:
la señora Maria Yaquelin P. tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y es madre de 4 hijos.
recibe ayuda monetaria del papa de sus hijos que se encuentra en los estados unidos.
Maria se dedica a vender golosinas, antes las vendia ambulantemente pero ahora ya tiene un local en donde atiende a sus clientes, su negocio esta ubicado en la aldea corinto por la salinera, ahí vende a los trabajadores de dicha salinera.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de refrescos, verduras, carnes, maiz, leña.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Yaquelin P. is 28 years old.  She is single and has four children.  She receives financial help from the children's father who is in the United States.

Maria sells snacks.  She used to sell these as an itinerant street vendor but she now has premises where she serves her customers.  Her business is in the village of Corinto, at the local saltworks.  She sells to the workers at the saltworks.

Maria will use her loan to buy soft drinks, vegetables, meat, corn and firewood.  She needs the profits from her business to get ahead with her children.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, tomatoes, onion, chilis, lemons, salt, beef, pork, chicken, firewood and soft drinks

loans.name: Agustín De La Trinidad

texts.es:
Agustín tiene 61 años de edad, es conviviente y reside junto a su familia en el sector El Cuadrado, una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Motupe, provincia de Lambayeque. La zona se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde que era joven. Actualmente cuenta con una parcela en donde suele sembrar maracuyá. Esta fruta es uno de los cultivos más comunes de la zona y para trabajar de mejor modo y obtener un mejor mercado, los agricultores de la zona se han venido asociando. Agustín depende de esta actividad para sacar adelante a su familia por lo que siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.

Agustín desea aplicar fertilizantes y riegos a su cultivo para asegurarse una buena producción y de ese modo asegurarle el sustento a su familia, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Agustín is 61 years old, has a live-in parnter, and lives with his family in El Cuadrado, a rural zone located in the Motupe district of the Lambayeque province. The area is more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

He has worked in farming since he was young and he currently has a piece of land where he usually grows passion fruit. This fruit is one of the most common crops in the area and the farmers have been collaborating together in order to work better and have a better market. Agustín depends on this job to get his family ahead, which is why he always tries to maintain his crop in the best possible way.

Agustín wants to apply fertilizers and watering to his crop in order to ensure good production and thus, the support for his family. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa that will help him to achieve his goal.

loans.use: To apply fertilizers and watering to his passion fruit crop

loans.name: Marcy

texts.en: Marcy B., age 35, is widowed and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marcy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in her community. She also buys and sells firewood. They are from the village of Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro City. Marcy has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Marcy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marcy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Marcy is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods. This will be her seventh loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods

location.town: Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Charmie

texts.en:
Charmie M. is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 27 years old. Charmie is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Charmie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialised retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling gasoline in the local community. Charmie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Charmie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charmie is requesting a loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Charmie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Flordesita

texts.en:
Flordesita P. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old. Flordesita is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Flordesita owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling vegetables like eggplants, stringbeans, "ampalaya", "petchay", cabbage, spices & food seasoning in the local community. Flordesita has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Flordesita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordesita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional vegetables and as working capital. Flordesita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like cabbages and eggplants. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Flordesita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like cabbages and eggplants

loans.name: Davron

texts.ru: Хушанов Даврон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 21 год. Он женат, детей не имеет. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Даврон занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 3 года. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Davron K. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. He is 21 years old, married but does not have children. His wife is a homemaker. Davron does animal husbandry. He breeds cattle at home. He mainly feeds and sells cattle. He has been in this business for three years. He is taking out the loan to buy large cattle.

loans.use: to buy large cattle

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa R. is from the village of Comonal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 61 years old. Felisa is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Felisa owns & operates a specialized retail store selling products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste.  Felisa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Felisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Felisa is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Felisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco Javier R.:de 32 años de edad casado tiene 2 hijos los dos estudian,el es una persona muy trabajador ya que desde muy pequeño su papa le enseño el trabajo del comercio y hace 2 años inicio con su negocio propio el tiene un local de ropa nueva en el cual vende pantalones para dama y caballero blusas,chumpas,etc, el prestamo que el nececita es para comprar ropa nueva por mayor y surtir mejor su local para darles un mejor servicio un mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias su sueño es expandir su negocio y darles la la mejor educacion a sus hijos.
texts.en: Francisco Javier R. is 32 years old with 2 children who are both school-aged.  He is a very hard working person whose father taught him how to be a salesman from his youth.  Two years ago, he started his own business selling new clothing; he sells men's and women's pants, blouses, sweaters, etc.  He will use the loan to buy new clothes at wholesale to better supply his shop and give better service to his customers.  This will help him to improve his earnings.  His dream is to expand his business to provide a better education for his children.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Mrs. Him Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of fifteen people. Mrs. Him is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Each member’s portion of the loan will be used for different purpoS. in order to improve their family’s standard of living. 

Mrs. Him is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice for her own family and to sell. She is also a chicken breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So, Mrs. Him is seeking a loan to buy more chickens. She will use the rest of the loan  to buy some piglets for breeding in order to start a new business. 

She was born in 1971. She is a widow with two children: one is a construction worker and the other is studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: James Mwangi

texts.en: James Mwangi M. is 30 years old and single. He has been running his motorcycle transport business for two years with an income of 6,000 KES a month.  This is James' first loan cycle with KADET after being introduced by a staff member.  He is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy a piece of land with a group. He hopes to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es: Elizabet de 36 años, es una mujer muy honesta y trabajadora, está casada con Ivan de 30 años, y en compañía de sus dos hijas, Camila de 4 y Yamila de 2 años, vive en casa  de su tío, ubicado en la localidad de Palcamayo. Ella vende todos lo viernes hortalizas en la feria de sus localidad, gracias a sus seis terrenos de cultivo, dos de ellos arrendados, que le producen en cantidad éste producto. Hace 6 años que se dedica a la agricultura, tiempo suficiente para lograr abastecer la demanda que genera las verduras en la capital y está muy contenta del éxito obtenido, afirma que se dedica al 100 % en su siembra y asegura que todo cultivo  es rentable,”solo tienen que aprovechar al máximo las temporadas de siembra”, menciona. En estos meses ya cosechará una gran cantidad de espinaca de buena calidad gracias al cuidado y dedicación que les brinda. Próximamente sembrará lechuga y zanahoria; con el tiempo espera completar sus ahorros y poder comprar más terrenos de cultivo. Por otro lado, incursionó hace algunos meses, como promotora de educación; enseñando a niños menores de 5 años, actividad del que gana un dinero extra, y confiesa que le gusta mucho pues se dedica a trabajar durante las mañanas por lo que le da tiempo para dedicarse a sus cultivos en las tardes. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón San Cristóbal”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde esperar aprender mucho de las capacitaciones que ofrecen en su asociación. Elizabet, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de semilla de arveja, espinaca, zanahoria y flor de gladiolo, en este último comprará además semilla munición (primera etapa de maduración), y también bulbillos (segunda etapa de maduración), para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Elizabet is 36 years old; she is a very honest and hardworking woman. She is married and lives with Ivan who is 30 years old and with their two daughters Camila who is 4 and Yamila who is 2 years of age in her uncle’s home located in Palcamayo. Elizabet sells vegetables every Friday in the local market thanks to her six plots of land of which two are rented and the rest generate a great deal of vegetables. Elizabet has worked in agriculture for some 6 years, enough time to be able to meet the demand that her vegetables get in the capital and is very happy with her success and says that she dedicates 100% to her crops and assures that every harvest is profitable, “you only have to make good use of the harvest season” she says. In the upcoming months Elizabet, will harvest a great quantity and quality of spinach thanks to the care and dedication that she gives them. Later she will grow lettuce and carrots. With time, Elizabet hopes to save enough to be able to buy more plots of land. Some months back Elizabet worked as a teacher for children under 5, work that gave her extra income and she says that she enjoyed it a great deal and continues to work in the mornings which give her time to work her crops in the afternoons. She belongs to the “Patrón San Cristóbal” Communal Bank; this is her second loan with MFP and hopes to learn a lot from the services that her association offers. Elizabet will use the loan to buy seeds: peas, spinach, carrots, and gladiolus flowers as well as ammunition seeds (the first stage of development) and bulbs (the second stage of development) for her second harvest.

loans.use: buy spinach seeds, peas and carrots as well as two types of seeds of gladiolus.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef, age 27, works in transporting and selling bread, a business he has been engaged in since 2005. He is a hard worker and he is expanding his business into more and more regions. Youssef buys a certain quantity of bread from the bakery, then journeys to severA. grocery stores in nearby villages to sell his wares. 

Youssef believes that this work is a challenge that will allow him to improve the sociA. and financiA. situation of himself and his family. He works hard to fulfill his family's desires and to secure their future needs.

Youssef is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy a new and bigger van to increase his product sales during his daily journeys. He is confident that his business will continue to succeed.

loans.use: to buy a new van to allow for improved and expanded delivery of his wares to local villages

loans.name: Abdulatif

texts.en:
Abdulatif has been selling foods for eight years. He sells sugar, sweets, oil, tomatoes etc. His mother helps him in this business. He purchases the goods from the market of "Farovon" in Dushanbe city. His store is located in a crowded place in the market of "Ganj." 

Abdulatif wants to expand his business and increase the assortments of his goods. He would like to get a loan of 5,000 Tajikistan somonis (TJS) to purchase new goods in order to expand his business and increase the assortment of his goods. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International 

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History 

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy food for his store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC  AYLLU”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; la socia tiene 66 años D. edad, la socia es viuda, La socia tiene 4 hijos independientes todos; La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia se dedica a la venta D. comida casera, la socia desea invertir en la compra D. insumos para la elaboración D. comidas típicas y caseras, la socia comprar al por mayor, arroz, azúcar. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. insumos.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Introducing Juana, a member of “SUMAC AYLLU”, a Communal Bank located in the Huanchac district, in the Cusco province and department.

Juana is 66 years old, she is a widow and she has 4 children, all economically independent- She is a retailer and she sells homemaD. food. She wants to invest in the purchase of ingredients to prepare typical and homemaD. meals. She will buy rice and sugar at wholesale price, and she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients.

She is thankful for the support she will receive, and she commits to complying with fully repaying her dues.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Sonia has a retail shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional dried fish to sell. Sonia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sonia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Gardie

texts.en:
Gardie is 34 years old and married with two children. Gardie is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 35,000 each cropping season every May and October.
 
Gardie is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to ensure more crop production. Gardie grows rice and has been doing it for six years. 

In the future, Gardie hopes to generate more income to support the needs of his family and move his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng is 28 years old and lives in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 1988, she has worked as a farmer and she also weaves mats to earn additional income. Leng earns 2 USD daily from her work. She is married to Van, who sells metal, and so far the couple has three dependent children. 

Leng is requesting a Kiva loan to buy rice seed and plow her field as it is planting season and she lacks money. In the future, she hopes to renovate her house and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and cultivate her field

loans.name: Santos Valerio

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su esposa, él es empleado de una joyería, por las tardes su esposa se dedica a la venta de pupusas, las cuales vende en su vivienda, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, con la intención de tener más ingresos para su hogar.
Él solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en chicharrón, quesillo, aceite, y más mercadería que es necesaria para la producción de las pupusas.
Juntos se dedican cada día a dar lo mejor en el trabajo y negocio, pues de las ventas se ven beneficiados los dos.
texts.en:
Santos lives with his wife. He is employed at a jewelry store, but his wife sells “pupusas” from their home in the afternoons. She started this business on her own with the intention of generating more income for their household.

Santos is requesting a loan to invest in pork, cheese, oil, and other necessary supplies for making pupusas. He and his wife devote each day to doing the best in their work. The sales from her business have been beneficial to both of them.

loans.use: to buy pork, cheese, oil, and other necessary supplies for his wife's business.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Pimentel que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, pesca y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla José es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra camote, productos que se comercializan diariamente, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Chiclayo y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida.  José es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante y se supere.
texts.en:
José is 45 years old and lives with his wife and children in his own home which doesn't have basic services.  His home is located in the rural part of Pimentel district, in Chiclayo province.  This area is noted for its farming, fishing and tourism.

José works in agriculture.  He owns his own farmland where he grows sweet potatoes that he sells daily.  Once he harvests his produce, he sells it in the different markets in Chiclayo which enables him to make income with which to cover his family's daily expenses.

José has requested a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizers so that he can improve his land and his crops.  Once his crops have grown, he sells them in the different markets in his area with the goal of earning the best price he can for them so that he can make more income and improve his quality of life.  José is a hard-working and very responsible person.  The only thing he wants is for his family to get ahead in life and do well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his land and his crops

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is married and has six children, four boys and two girls. Four of her children attend school while the other two have already graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past six years, she has made a living by selling green groceries to her neighbors and passersby. Her main challenge is the high cost of transportation, but she dreams of expanding her business and improving her family's living standards. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 10,000 to buy potatoes, tomatoes and green vegetables to sell to her customers. She decided to join Yehu to secure loans that will allow her to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola is 22 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are old enough to attend school. She earns a living by selling beans and rice on a busy street near where she lives in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years and also earns money on the side by selling cooking oil and soap. She is applying for a loan from BRAC South Sudan so that she can expand her business and earn enough money to build a house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rodiena

texts.en: Rodiena is a 35-year-old woman who is married with two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns a decent salary. Rodiena wants to complete some finishing parts of her house, mainly one room and a bathroom. However, she doesn't have enough money to pay for them, so she needs to take out a loan of $3,000 from Kiva's partner, FATEN. When Rodiena gets the loan, which will be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to complete her house and live in better and healthier conditions with her family. Rodiena is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN office.

loans.use: To pay for finishing parts of her house.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La señora Francisca de 69 años es separa y tiene cuatro años viviendo en la casa de su ex marido vive de su hija concepción de 37 años y sus dos hijos esta casa se la dejo su esposo como para no darle apoyo de manutención de los niños, Francisca se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo de una empresa reconocida en México los productos que ella vende son labiales, perfumes, maquillajes, cremas para el cuidado de la piel, artículos para el hogar y mas, mientras que su hija concepción quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar trabaja 10 horas diarias en una maquiladora de lunes a viernes, La casa que ella habita es una casa de interés social y estas fueron vendidas con media barda en la parte de atrás y francisca quiere levantar la barda de su domicilio por ella seguridad de ella de su hija ya que la altura que actualmente tiene esta barda cualquiera puede brincarla y hacer vandalismo en su vivienda. Para realizar su proyecto necesita comprar cemento, arena, y pagar albañil, de esta manera brindara a su familia mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Francisca, 69, is separated and has been living in her ex-husband's house for four years.  She lives with her daughter Concepción, 37, and her two children.  Her husband left her this house so he didn't have to give her child support.

Francisca works selling cosmetics from a catalog for a well-known business in Mexico.  The products she sells are lipstick, perfume, make-up, skin cream, articles for the home, and more.  Her daughter Concepción, who helps her with the household expenses, works ten hours a day from Monday through Friday in a "maquiladora" [assembly plant set up by a foreign firm near the U. S. border].

The house she lives in is a government-subsidized home, and these were sold with a half wall in the back.  Francisca wants to raise the wall of her home for her security and that of her daughter, since anybody could jump over the wall and vandalize her home at the current height.

To do her project she needs to buy cement and sand, and pay a builder.  In this way she will offer her family greater security.

loans.use: to buy construction material to raise her wall.

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Mariposas” esta integrado por seis mujeres cada una D. ellas tiene una actividad es por eso que han pedido el credito ejemplo doña Josefina comprar reces, Maria Esther, Elena, Maria Guadalupe compraran borregos, Ofelia comprara tambien borregos y pollos y Rocio comprara pollos y guajolotes. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron ellas mismas solo que no estaban muy seguras D. ponerle así ya que le querían poner voladoras sin embargo optaron por ponerle “mariposas” ya que les gusto porque es un animal que siempre va hacia delante.
Doña Cristina tiene 48 años D. edad esta casada desD. hace 32 años con el señor Bruno trabaja como albañil juntos han procreado un hijo el cual tiene 11 años se encuentra en sexto año D. primaria su nombre es L., el y sus padres están muy contentos porque esta a punto D. terminar su educación primaria.
Doña Cristina se dedica a la crianza D. los animales con esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar 2 borregos y dos puerquitos chicos ella los compra pequeños los crece y luego los venD. hace poco vendió y es por eso que en casa solo tiene tres borregos, comenta que si le sobra comprara zacate y maíz el  precio del maíz le preocupa un poca ya que su precio es muy alto porque el clima afecto el cultivo D. maíz.
El dicha actividad tiene 30 años en todo este tiempo no ha tenido ningún problema ya que siempre ha tratado D. cuidarlos bien y cuando los ve tristes D. inmediato los lleva al veterinario para que los revisen y no se agrave mas.
La meta que tiene la señora Cristina es que su hijo L. termine D. estudiar no solo la primaria sino que pueda llegar ase1r un gran profesionista porque muchas veces ellos se quedan sin dinero y cuando no tiene ellos ya venden uno o más para poder salir del apuro económico.
Las integrantes del grupo están muy agradecidas, porque llevan ya mucho tiempo trabajando con FRAC están muy agradecidas porque su apoyo ha servido D. mucho sobre todo para salir adelante y mejora su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The “Mariposas” (Butterflies) group is composed of six women who each has her own activity and this is why they’ve asked for the loan.  For example, Josefina wants to buy cattle, María Esther, Elena, and María Guadalupe will buy sheep, Ofelia will buy sheep too but also chickens and Rocío will buy chickens and turkeys.  They chose the group name themselves but they weren’t too sure about naming it thus because they wanted to call it “Voladoras” but opted for naming it “Mariposas” since they liked it because it’s an animal always headed forward.

Cristina, 48, has been married to Bruno for 32 years.  He works as a bricklayer and together they have a son who is 11 years old and in sixth graD. in elementary school.  His name is L. and he and his parents are very happy because he’s about to finish his elementary education.

Cristina raises animals and this time has requested the loan to buy two lambs and two piglets.  She buys them when they are small and raises them to sell later.  She sold a short while ago so she only has three sheep left at home.  She comments that if she has any money left over she’ll buy pasturage and corn.  
She’s a little concerned about the price of corn because it’s very expensive because the weather affected the corn crops.

She’s been in this business for 30 years and has had no problem in all this time because she’s always striven to care for them well and when she sees them sad she immediately takes them to the veterinarian to be checked over and so that they won’t worsen.

Cristina’s goal is that her son L. finishes his schooling, not only elementary school but that he succeed in becoming a great professional because they run out of money on many occasions and when she runs out is when she sells one or more of them to get out of their economic tough spot.

The members of the group are very grateful because they’ve been working with FRAC for a long time and they are grateful because its help has been very useful for them especially to get ahead and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and two baby lambs.

loans.name: Lucia Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia   se dedica a la venta de ropa  desde hace varios años, en la populosa calles de la ciudad de Quillacollo - Cochabamba, es clienta antigua nuestra siempre demostrando responsabilidad en sus pagos,  su  esposo no participa porque trabaja en el departamento de Oruro, como minero en minas chicas, trabajando a destajo, el  crédito le servirá para surtirse de mas mercadería  de ropa por estas épocas de fin de año,  su garante que es su madre también esta dedicada a la venta de ropa pero ella lo hace en la zona de la cancha, cuenta con vivienda propia, en la zona Norte, también la Sra. Lucia siempre paga con puntualidad.
texts.en: Sra. Lucia has been selling clothes for several years in the crowded streets of the city of Quillacollo - Cochabamba. She is a long-standing member and has always shown herself to be responsible with regards repayments. Her husband does not participate because he works in the department of Oruro as a miner in small mines by the job with no fixed contract. The loan will be used to stock up with more clothing merchandise for the year-end season. Her guarantor, her mother, also sells clothing but she does so near the sports fields. She owns her own house in the northern area of the city. Sra. Lucia is always punctual with her repayments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (sweaters and pants).

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 
Noel has a party shop that sells different kinds of party supplies and also does catering and arranges parties. He has had this business for 10 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy supplies for arranging any kind of party.
Noel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Noel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for arranging any kind of party.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María Dolores tiene 32 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con la madre en  Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC PANGUA, se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad Pangua  Chaupiyacu, Parroquia Guanujo Cantón Guaranda, La comunidad está a 15 minutos de la Oficina Los miembros de la Ventanilla Pangua se dedican la mayoría a la Agricultura y ganadería y también a otras actividades donde obtienen mayores ingresos económicos como: el comercio y la construcción.

María se dedica a la ganadería y la agricultura.

Las compras y las ventas los realiza en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para comprar animales (ganado y ovejas). Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar la estabilidad económica.
El sueño es poder comprase una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la sequedad en los cultivos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar a veces  pasea por la ciudad.
texts.en:
María Dolores is 32 years old, single, and has no children. She lives with her mother in Guaranda, which is in Bolívar Province.

María Dolores is a member of the Communal Bank “Pangua” which is located in the community of Pangua Chaupiyacu and part of Guanujo parish in the canton of Guaranda. This community is 15 minutes away from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The members of the Pangua Communal Bank work mostly in agriculture and livestock breeding, but they also engage in other business activities, such as retail and construction, in order to earn most of their income.

María engages in livestock breeding and farming. Her purchases and sales are conducted in Guaranda. She is requesting a loan in order to buy animals, such as cattle and sheep. With the help of this loan, María will be able to improve her financial stability. Her dream is to buy a house. The challenges she faces include preventing her crops from drying out.

In her free time, María Dolores likes to rest. Occasionally she will spend time in the city.

loans.use: to buy cattle and sheep.

loans.name: Penh

texts.en:
Mrs. Penh, 41, is a resident of the Prey Chhor district, Kompong Cham province. She lives with her common-law husband and has 5 children. Mrs. Penh has been cultivating rice crops for her livelihood for ages. This business provides her with approximately $1.50 per day, which is barely enough to cover her daily expenses.

Mrs. Penh doesn’t own a motorcycle for family use and it is difficult for her to go anywhere. She is therefore taking out this loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle to provide good transportation to meet the needs of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas, tiene 39 años, es madre de 6 hijos, es casada, y es socia de Finca Peru desde hace 13 años.
Hilda es dueña de una Fábrica de ladrillos, recuerda que ella empezó con $ 10.00 dólares y desde la fecha se esforzó mucho para poder tener un buen capital y ahorrar. las capacitaciones le ayudaron mucho para poder progresar y en su vida personal, le enseñaron a hacer un buen presupuesto, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ladrillos para quemar.
texts.en:
Hilda’s a member of the “Orcasitas” communal bank.  She’s 39 years old and the mother of six children.  She’s married and has been a member of Finca Perú for 13 years.

Hilda owns a brick factory.  She recalls that she started out with 10 dollars and since then has striven very much to have good capital and to save.  Training helped her very much to make progress and in her personal life.  It taught her how to make a good budget and will use the loan now to buy bricks to fire.

loans.use: to buy bricks to fire.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Como todo padre nicaragüense, el señor Pedro Antonio es muy responsable con sus hijos por lo que está en el deber de apoyarles en sus estudios para que estos se desarrollen y sean grandes profesionales. Es originario del municipio de El Sauce, donde ha vivido toda su vida, se dedica a laborar como docente de primaria en una de las comunidades donde tiene muchos  años y por ende experiencia en la enseñanza a los niños y jóvenes.

Es un padre de familia responsable que tiene a su cargo dos hijos, los cuales está educando de la mejor manera posible y para ello cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que en conjunto luchan para preparar a sus hijos como personas de bien al igual que ellos.

Una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un préstamo para la compra de útiles escolares y uniformes para sus dos hijos debido a que se acerca el año escolar y debe velar para que sus pequeños se preparen y así continuar contribuyendo a su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Like every Nicaraguan father, Pedro Antonio is very responsible when it comes to his children. He sees it as his duty to support them in their education, so that they develop, and grow up to be professionals. 

He is from the municipality of El Sauce, where he has lived all his life. He is a primary teacher in one of the communities, where he has been teaching for many years, and therefore has experience teaching children and youth. 

He is a responsible parent with two children in his care, whom he is bringing up in the best way possible. He has his wife's support in this, and together they strive to raise their children to be good people, just as they are.

At this time, one of his needs is to take out a loan to buy school supplies and uniforms for his two children. This is because the school year is approaching, and he must see to it that his young ones are prepared. In this way, he continues to contribute to their progress in life.

loans.use: To buy school supplies and uniforms.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Ayawa  vit à Baguida. Agée de 27 ans, Ayawa est une revendeuse des caleçons, soutien-gorge et de chaussures qui s’approvisionnent deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Ayawa désire ce crédit pour commander des des douzaines de slips, de soutien-gorge et des chaussures. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne revente, Ayawa va pouvoir aider son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille et bien s’occuper de leurs enfants.

loans.use: Acheter 08 douzaines de slips, 08  douzaines de soutien-gorge et 02 douzaines de chaussures.

loans.name: Freshiah

texts.en:
Freshiah is 34 years, married with 2 children. One of her children goes to primary school. Her husband assists her on the farm which has ensured that they get regular income from their activities.

She keeps dairy cows and also rears sheep for sale. She started vegetable farming 2 years ago when she joined Githunguri Abigael Mothers group where she was able to access 3 loans of USD 45, USD 75, USD 120 which she successfully repaid back. Currently she is making a profit of USD 50 from sale of vegetables. With ready market for her vegetables, she intends to grow more since she has the land and intends to buy a water pump to irrigate her vegetable farm from a river that flows near her farm. This will ensure that she has vegetables all year round to meet her client’s orders.

loans.use: Freshiah wants to buy a small water pump.This will assist her in irrigating her vegetables as well as providing water for the cows.

loans.name: Nobert

texts.en:
Nobert is 37 years old. He is married, and has four children. He also takes care of two of his brother’s children after their parents died of HIV.

He does carpentry work, making all kinds of furniture. Nobert has been doing carpentry work since he was 13 years old. He lost his father when he was only two years old, and his mother is blind, so it was very difficult for her to educate him and his siblings. He therefore only attended primary school up to grade 3.

At 13, while living with his brother in Nakuru, he identified a workshop dealing with furniture, and decided wanted to go in and help out, instead of idling around in the village. This is where he learnt his skills in carpentry work.

Norbert started a small carpentry business in Kibera, and since 1993, he has been receiving small contracts from the police in Lang’ata. Since he proved to be faithful, they have continued to give him contracts to either repair or make furniture – especially beds.

Since 2005, Nobert has been receiving support and training in small business management, and through facilitation by ANK, has received loans of $57 and $85 from his group, which he has successfully repaid.

Nobert has recently been awarded a contract to make 50 beds for new police recruits. However, because the contract is of such a big magnitude, he doesn’t have all the funds required to buy all the materials he needs.

Given a loan of $150, he will be in a position to make the first batch of beds, and after the delivery those, he will be able to repay the loan and proceed to make the next batch for delivery. The loan repayment period will be between 4 – 8 months.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make beds for new police recuruits

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en: Muborak K. works in the local market in Kanibadam. She has over 11 years of experience in trade. She started in an open-air market without a lot of foot traffic, but over time she expanded her business and eventually got the chance to rent a shop. Her first loan from  MicroInvest was $80. Slowly, she expanded her line of goods and currently offers a variety of women's clothes and shoes. She plans to use her next loan to enlarge her shop and expand her inventory to include men's clothes and shoes.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina, born in Yamasá, started selling natural medicine products 2 years ago, but reached a slump when she ran out of money to buy more product. This circumstance maD. her stop her selling activity. With the requested loan, she wants to initiate restocking of natural herbs and thereby renew her sales activity over time. She intends to buy the medicine in the capital, Santo Domingo, an hour’s travel time from her community in Yamasá. Thus, to minimize costs, she intends to buy more products on each trip.

She also works at the nearby Yamasá hospital. When she got separated from her husband, in order to feed her 5 children, she needed this stable job. It wasn’t enough. That is why, at the same time she needs to continue her former business.

loans.use: To buy natural medicine products for resale

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
A couple of years ago I took out a loan to start my garment business. With help from my three sons, I now run a small boutique where I sell outfits that I design myself. With the profit from my business, I am able to help my husband with the household expenses. We would now like to expand this business. With a larger variety of clothes, I will be able to attract a larger clientele and hence increase our profit. I therefore seek a loan of $350 to expand my business.

Shamim A., Pakistan

loans.use: To expand my garment business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian A. is an Acholi by tribe and was born in 1955. She is a married lady with four children. When the 20-year-war in the north became unavoidable, life was difficult and many lost their lives or were displaced. Lilian, for fear of her life, had to take refugee in Kampala in August 2000. On her arrival in Kampala the only place to settle in was Acholi Quarters which is on one of the hills that the King of Buganda offered to the refugees.

It was Lilian's first time to be in the city and the way of life became difficult. No way to grow your own food, no barter or trade, and no free things. To survive here you needed money and she had none. The option for Lilian was to involve herself in stone quarry activities that helped her generate a little capital. Then she found the Life in Africa Foundation and was able to earn some money participating in the craft programs.

Lilian now wants to supplement her income by starting a petty business as a fish monger. Fish is a big part of the diet and is always in demand so she is confident that she will be able to be successful. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 250,000/= (US$ 150) and she feels sure she will be able to repay this loan in 6 months.

Below is her budget:

Putting up a basic roof for shade………………………………………..30,000/=
Buying a container for keeping fish…………………10,000/=

Transport …………………………………………….10, 000/=

Buying fish ……………………………………….200, 000/=

Total………………………………………………250,000/=

loans.use: Buying fish for re-sale

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee is a brave woman who works hard for the good of her six children; she does so alone, playing the role of both father and mother to them after her spouse left them. After this painful incident, she decided to take up her work in land cultivation again and with greater intensity so that she could bring security and education to her large family. The strict discipline she uses with her children allows her to count on her household’s advice and support in working the fields. Aydee’s children’s grateful attitude continues to encourage her, and they have gathered many lessons during this time that they can use when they form their own households. With their agricultural activities, she can economically sustain her family and meet their basic needs. Nevertheless, the brutal cold that lashed last year’s harvest hurt them considerably and did not allow them to earn what they had expected, despite Aydee’s diligent work during the harvest and her hope that it would be better. She needs to buy fertilizer and seeds. Your support for this loan is very important in allowing Aydee to continue educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Aydee es una mujer valiente que trabaja arduamente por el bien de sus seis hijos; trabaja sola y tiene que cumplir el rol de padre y madre para ellos, tras el abandono de su pareja. Tras este penoso incidente decidió retomar con mayor intensidad su trabajo en sus tierras de cultivo para brindarles bienestar y educación a su numerosa familia; la formación llena de disciplina que Aydee imparte en sus hijos le permite contar con el consejo y apoyo de los miembros de su hogar en las labores del campo. Toda esta actitud llena de gratitud de los hijos de Aydee la siguen motivando y han recogido durante este tiempo numerosas enseñanzas con el afán de practicarlas y difundirlas también cuando formarán su hogar.Con las actividades agrícolas que realiza puede sostener económicamente a su familia y satisfacer plenamente sus necesidades, sin embargo el implacable frío que azotó sus cosechas el año pasado la perjudicaron notablemente y no le permitió obtener las ganancias que esperaba, pese a ello seguirá trabajando con la esperanza de que durante está cosecha las cosas resulten mucho mejor.Desea comprar abono y más semillas. Tu aporte para el préstamo es muy importante para que Aydee siga educando a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds to ensure a successful harvest.

loans.name: Lapmari

texts.en: Lapmari is a 45-year-old woman who has a small shop where she sells snacks, food, and drinks, and also household products. She can earn about US$ 20 per week. Her husband, M., has no fixed income so he works with her. She's requesting a loan to expand  her and her husband's business. Lapmari hopes that she can increase her income to provide tuition for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her little "corner grocery store"

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Mrs Beatriz belongs to the Community Bank “Solidarity” and she lives in Federico Basadre- Km 8, Urb. San Borja Mz. G, Lot number 10 in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 32 years old, has 5 children under 18, is married and her husband is a motorcycle rickshaws driver.

She already received a first loan of 300 soles (100 USD) from the association Manuela Ramos which she invested in the maintenance of her motorcycle rickshaw.
