Currently, she owns a stand where she sells chicken, a motorcycle rickshaw and a car which she uses for public transportation. She wakes up every morning at 4am to go to the market, where she has her stand and in the evenings she takes care of her children and the household.

With the loan of 1500 soles (525 USD), which she will pay in 5 months, she will buy wholesale chicken and she will give maintenance to her motorcycle rickshaw.

Beatriz is a very hard working woman and even though she is busy with her different businesses she still finds the time to spend happy moments with her family. She feels very happy about the support that the association Manuela Ramos is providing her.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Description La señora Beatriz pertenece al Banco Comunal Solidaridad, vive en Carret Federico Basadre- Km, 8 Urb. San Borja Mz. G Lt. 10, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali.

Tiene 32 años y es madre de cinco hijos menores de edad, su esposo es motocarrista.

Beatriz, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decidió invertir en el mantenimiento de su motokar.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un puesto de venta de pollos (aves de consumo), un motokar y un auto con los que realizan servicios de transporte público, se levanta a las 4 a.m. para ir al mercado donde tiene un puesto de venta de pollos y por las tardes se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y los quehaceres domésticos de su hogar. Con éste préstamo de S/. 1,500 soles, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará pollos al por mayor y también dará mantenimiento a su motokar. Beatriz es una mujer muy trabajadora, a pesar que tiene varios negocios, no es ningún inconveniente para poder disfrutar momentos agradables con su familia, se siente feliz por el apoyo que le esta brindando Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To buy chicken and give maintenance to her motorcycle rickshaw

loans.name: Lucia's Group

texts.en:
Lucía is in her early fifties, and she and her husband have six lovely children (four boys, two girls), all of whom go to school. Lucía owns and operates a small business that sells basic food products (e.g., rice, beans, vegetable oil, milk, etc.). After four laborious years operating this business, Lucía now has a loyal following of customers who visit her stall every day to buy her goods. The entrepreneur wants to improve upon her business by adding new merchandise so as to attract new customers and, ultimately, to increase her income so that her family can lead a comfortable lifestyle.

Lucía would like to receive this loan with four other entrepreneurs who live in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal: (1) María P., a 22-year-old mother of two sons, who would use her portion of the loan to purchase pants and men’s underwear to re-sell to members of the community; (2) Santa S., who would use her portion of the loan to purchase raw materials and ingredients to continue to produce her delicious empanadas; and (3) Cecilia S. T. and (4) Veronica S., who would use their loan portions to purchase clothing in bulk to replenish their respective businesses.

The members of this group guarantee the other members' loans. Accordingly, if one woman fails to repay her portion of the loan, the other members will assume that woman's obligations.

loans.use: To purchase of a wide variety of products (e.g., rice, beans, jewelry, and clothing) for the group members' businesses.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a 26-year-old owner of a beauty salon. She has operated this salon for over 4 years. This is her second loan with Sinapi. With the first loan she was able to rebuild her shop into a more permanent concrete structure. Previously, her shop was a wooden structure.

With this loan, Abena wants to purchase 4 additional dryers. She now only owns 1. Abena has 11 apprentices working for her.

While we visited Abena for a photo, she was away to the central market buying supplies. Pictured washing a client's hair is Beatrice, an assistant who has been working with Abena for 3 months.

Abena is a member of the trust group Nyame Beye (God Will Do It). The trust group works on the principle that the peer pressure of the group creates a type of social collateral, where each member ensures that the other member repays her share of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional dryers for her beauty salon

loans.name: Elishadai Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Esther A. is an average Kenyan woman aged 40 and married with 4 children. She also lives with 2 orphan children of her late brother.

Esther started operating her second-hand clothes business, commonly referred to as “Mutumba,” nine years ago because the income of her husband, who is a cobbler, was too little to support all their family's needs.

Esther is now able to purchase at least 5 bails of second-hand clothes every week to sell to her regular customers. With the little profits that she gets from the small-scale business, Esther is able to feed, clothe and educate her children. With the help of her loan, Esther hopes to purchase more bails of second-hand clothes to increase her sales.

In the future, Esther would like to open up a boutique in her home town of Luanda, in the Western part of Kenya.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Purchase bails of second-hand clothes in bulk

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil has been in the dairy business for five years. He was born in 1976. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Armenian-occupied Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and is settled in the Fuzuli region, Zargar village. He is married and has two children. Now he would like a loan of $975 to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mrs. Heang I. is a subsistence farmer in Kngoak Pong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. At 40 years old, she is a mother of six: one who is employed in a garmet factory; three are enrolled in school; and two remain too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeurn Chhorn, is a taxi driver whose car requires repair work. Mrs. Heang I. would like to ask for a loan in order to fix her husband's car and maintain his business.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to fix the car in order to run her husband business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk for a small business.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
Magda belongs to the “Esmeralda” (emerald) community bank. She lives in the region and province of San Martin, district of Tarapoto. She works selling clothing for women, man and children, shoes, fragrances, powders, earrings, lotions, etc. Her house is located on #112 Recreo Jr., Bda Shilcayo. She looks for clients who work in different public and private organizations.

Magda started this business because she likes it, since she was a little girl she learned how to do it, her parents were in retail and she helped them sell. That’s why it wasn’t hard for her to decide to do this activity when she saw the need to generate income to support her family. She is happy with what she has achieved thanks to the business.

The loan of $875 USD (S/.2500) which will be repaid in 6 months, will be invested in the purchase of beauty products by taking advantage of the sale opportunities, in addition, she will buy women’s clothing such as blouses, polo shirts, and items requested from her clients.

Magda is 56 years old, from Tarapoto, has four children all adults and independent. She is nice, service oriented, calm and very confident in what she does. In the future she would like to start another business selling regional liqueurs and party supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Magda, es socia del Banco Comunal “Esmeralda” vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, zapatos, perfumes, talcos, aretes, cremas, etc. Su casa esta ubicada en el Jr: Recreo Nº 112 – Bda Shilcayo, de allí ella sale en busca de sus clientes que son personas que trabajan en diferentes entidades públicas y privadas.

Se inicio en el negocio por que le gusta, desde muy niña aprendió el manejo, sus padres eran comerciantes y desde niña les ayudaba vendiendo, por eso no fue difícil decidir por esta actividad ante la necesidad de generar sus ingresos para sostener a su familia, esta contenta con lo que ha logrado gracias a este negocio.

El préstamo de S/. 2500.00 que será pagado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza, aprovechar las ofertas que se presentan para luego venderlas, además comprará ropas para damas como polos, blusas, y pedidos que le hacen sus clientes.

Ella tiene 56 años de edad, es natural de Tarapoto, tiene 4 hijos todos ya mayores e independientes. Se caracteriza por ser gentil, atenta con sus clientes, tranquila y con plena confianza en lo que hace, mas adelante piensa poner otro negocio de venta de licores regionales y confitería para atender cualquier evento.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and beauty products for sale

loans.name: Wilder Antonio

texts.es: Wilder habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Anexo a Jonathan González, tiene 39 años de edad,  su esposa es ama de casa y le tiene dos hijos de 14 y 16 años de edad que están estudiando la secundaria. Don Wilder tiene una pulpería desde hace cinco años y también tiene una sala de video juegos, lo cual logro formar  con fondos propios, pues comenzó solo vendiendo golosinas. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en la pulpería en comprar granos básicos, productos lácteos, verduras y así ofrecer a sus clientes variedad, así como también captar otros clientes. Su mayor anhelo es convertir a sus hijos en profesionales y por eso seguirá trabajando fuertemente.
texts.en:
Wilder lives in the Anexo a Jonathan Gonzalez neighborhood of the capital of Managua. He is 39 years old and his wife is a homemaker. They have two children; a 14 year old and 16 year old who are in high school. Wilder has a grocery store and an arcade which he established with his own funds by initially selling candies. This loan will be used to invest in the grocery store by purchasing basic grains, dairy products and vegetables in order to offer their clients greater variety and to bring in other clients. His greatest wish is that their children will become professionals which is why he will continue working hard.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, dairy products and vegetables.

loans.name: Zorica

texts.en:
Zorica was born in 1977 and lives in Bijeljina, a rapidly-expanding town in northeast Bosnia. She is married and has one child with a husband works in a telecommunications company. She owns and works in a hair salon. Zorica requests a 600KM loan from Women for Women International to invest in her salon business. She will use the loan to purchase supplies for her salon so that she can offer more services to her clients.

This is her first microfinance loan.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for a salon.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es:
Marciana es socia del Banco Comunal Claveles.
Marciana es viuda, tiene 60 años y 4 hijos,  Marciana tiene una tienda en su casa que se ubica en la Asoc. La Victoria, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas. Además Marciana tiene un molino en donde brinda servicios de molienda que esta en administración de su hijo, en algunas oportunidades Marciana viaja a las ferias en donde compra cereales que luego los procesa en su molino.
Marciana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideo.
Los sueños de Marciana son construir el segundo piso de su casa, surtir con mas productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Marciana is a member of the communal bank Claveles. She is a 60-year-old widow with 4 kids and she has a store out of her home located in the Association La Victoria, where she sells sundries, fruits, and vegetables. She also has a mill so she sells milling services which her son administers. Sometimes Marciana travels to markets to buy cereals which she processes in her mill. Marciana needs a loan of 1000 soles which she'll invest in buying rice, oil, and pastas. Marciana's dreams are to build a second floor on her home and expand her stock of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase stock merchandise (rice, oil, and pastas)

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: El Sr. Gilberto vive con su esposa al sur de la ciudad, en un fraccionamiento prácticamente recién formado, sus ingresos provienen de la venta de tacos por las mañanas y del empleo que tiene en un centro comercial de la ciudad, mas sin embargo él desea que lo apoyen para la compra de un vehiculo para poder trasladarse mas rápido a las zonas de venta, actualmente tienen un carrito pero ya se encuentra en muy malas condiciones y realizarle las reparaciones saldría mas costoso. La venta de tacos es un gran ingreso que necesitan conservar para mantenerse. Se les agradecerá infinitamente el apoyo que les den y por supuesto les llevaremos el seguimiento de esta familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Gilberto lives with his wife in the south side of the city, in a fairly new subdivision; his income originates from the sale of tacos in the mornings and a job in a shopping mall downtown; however, he would like help to purchase a vehicle that he can use to travel quicker to the centers of commerce. Presently they have a small car that is very bad shape, and which would be very expensive to repair. The sale of tacos is a good source of income that they absolutely must maintain to live on. They would be ever so grateful for any help they receive; we will maintain everyone updated on the progress of this family.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To obtain a vehicle for the sale of tacos.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Mara Vasquez P. is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras or “Women Entrepreneurs” communal bank.  She has been with this group for three years and likes working with Manuela Ramos.  She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Peru.  A busy and rapidly growing city in the northern jungle region of Peru’s Amazon river basin.

Ana Maria is requesting S/1,700 to support her clothing business.  She uses her Kiva loan to purchase pants, blouses, lingerie, t-shirts, earrings, bracelets and ankle bracelets to sell in her store. 

Ana Maria’s business helps support her and her husband, who constructs boats for a living.  Ana Maria is twenty two years old and as yet does not have any children.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, lingerie, t-shirts, earrings, bracelets and ankle bracelets for resale

loans.name: Savri

texts.ru: Курбонова Саври жительница Гиссарского района.Незамужем  , работает в парфюмерном магазине. Занимается бизнесом уже около 5 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Savri K. lives in Gissar. She is single and she's been working at a perfume store for the past five years. Savri is applying for a loan because she would like to increase cash flow. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Graciela Concepción

texts.es:
La señora Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, en Porvenir - Miraflores, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera con 04 hijos a su cargo y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (primer grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 05 años; ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para surtir su tienda.   Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas y pollos.
Ella desea mejorar su negocio; con este préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, monto que pagará en 5 cuotas mensuales; con dicho monto piensa adquirir mercadería al por mayor, tales como: arroz, azúcar, leche. Aceite, etc. y de esta manera surtir aun mas su negocio.
Su anhelo es construir su casa en la ciudad de Ilave, puesto que cuenta con terreno disponible, por ello viene ahorrando sus dinero; con ello garantizará el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Communal Bank “3 de Mayo” (Third of May) in Porvenir – Miraflores, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department, Peru. She is 54 years old, a single mother of 4 children and she did not finish school (first year of secondary school). She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. She has a grocery store. Her first loan for S/ 300.00 soles enabled her to stock her store with merchandise. At the same time she raises small animals such as hens and chickens. She wishes to improve her business. With this loan for S/ 3000.00 soles, which will be repaid in 5 monthly payments, she will acquire merchandise at wholesale such as: rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc. and in this way better stock her business. Her goal is to construct a house in Ilave city, as she has land available, for which she is saving her money; with this she will guarantee her children’s future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc. (groceries)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has owned a small food vendor store and has been a chicken seller in the Kihesa neighborhood of Dodoma for 6 years. She belongs to Dodoma Road "A" east group loan (Group code 2018).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 65. Every day she works for 12 hours at her business.

 
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items and chickens for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Mary is 37 years old, married, and has five children: ages 16, 14, 7 and 2. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more food items and chickens for her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
CARMEN P. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” su domicilio está ubicado en el AA. HH. “Los Jardines” Mz. E, Lt. 22 Distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 53 años, 1 hijo, su esposo es mecánico de motos.

	El primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en un pequeño restaurant, pero no le resulto como esperaba, por lo tanto cambio de actividad. Aprovecho que su esposo reparaba moto taxis, y se dedico a comprar y alquilar moto taxis.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, dará mantenimiento a dos moto taxis. En la actualidad se encuentra administrando un total de 8 moto taxis. 

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, los 4 años que viene trabajando le ha permitido implementar su negocio,  es una ayuda interesante que me ha permitido seguir adelante remarcó. Y hoy se siente capaz de administrar mas unidades.
texts.en:
CARMEN P. V. belongs to the “Manos Unidas” (“Hands United”) cooperative bank. She lives in the Yarinacocha District, is 53 years old, and has one child; her husband is a mechanic. The first loan she received from Manuela Ramos was 300.00 soles, which she invested into a small restaurant. Unfortunately, she didn’t have the results she’d hoped for so she changed activities. She took advantage of the fact that her husband fixed moto-taxis, and decided to dedicate herself to buying and renting these out. She will use this loan of 1,500.00 soles to fix two moto-taxis. Currently, she is managing a total of 8 moto-taxis. She thanks Manuela Ramos, as the 4 years she has worked with them have allowed her to start her business. It has been interesting help that has helped me to get ahead, she remarked. Today, she feels capable of managing more units.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For maintenance of 2 moto taxis.

loans.name: Ibrohimjon

texts.ru: Иброхимчон Солиев - мужчина 31 лет. Женат и имеет 2-х детей. Иброхимчон занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Иброхимчон кредитуется уже 2 года. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было очень малое количество скота. Сейчас у Иброхимчона большое количество мелко рогатого скота. Сейчас у его жены только одна дойная корова. Иброхимчон планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Ibrohimjon S. is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. Ibrohimjon works fattening and selling cattle, and his wife is works processing and selling milk. Ibrohimjon has taken out loans for two years. The first time he applied for a loan, he had very few cattle. Now, Ibrohimjon has a large quantity of livestock. Currently, his wife has only one milk cow. Ibrohimjon plans to buy another milk cow and calf for his wife, and he is grateful to our lenders for helping him carry out his plans.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fattening and selling cattle

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La Sra Catalina O. de Santacruz tiene 52 años de edad esta casada con el señor Arnaldo Santacruz de 53 años de edad. 

Cuenta que vive en su casa con su esposo y sus tres hijos todos solteros que siguen estudiando distintas carreras Universitarias.  La señora es profesora jubilada, cuando dejo de asistir a la escuela sintió la necesidad de emprender algún negocio ya que ella se siente con muchas fuerzas de seguir trabajando.

Es asi que empezo con una despensa en su domicilio con la ayuda de su esposo que tenia experiencias en ventas ya que se dedicaba a la venta de frutas y hortalizas.

Hoy en dia el negocio es un Autoservis con mucha clientela donde trabaja tambien sus hijos que reciben una remuneración para poder costear sus estudios.

En esta oportunidad solicita un crédito para la compra de harina,azucar,quesos, lacteos, almidón para de esa forma aumentar su stok de estos productos en estas fechas Santas que tendrán mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Catalina O. de Santacruz is 52 and married to Arnaldo Santacruz, 53. She lives in her house with her husband and their three children, who are single and still studying for their college degrees. Catalina is a retired teacher. When she stopped teaching, she felt like she needed to start a business since she had a strong desire to keep working. She opened a mini-market in her house with the help of her husband, who had experience with sales since he had earned his living selling fruits and vegetables. Nowadays the store is self-service with lots of customers, and her children work there, too, to earn money to pay for their studies. Catalina is seeking a loan at this time to buy flour, sugar, cheeses, dairy products, and starch to increase her stock for the holidays, when demand will be high.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, corn, sugar, cheeses, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
N. Aisha is a 50-year-old hard-working lady with a business of selling produce since 1980. She is a married lady with 5 children aged 22 – 11 years as well as caring for 2 dependants. She works so hard to ensure that all her children’s school fees are paid on time and mostly for the two eldest that are in the candidate classes.

Just like any other business, Aisha’s business is faced with seasonal changes, price fluctuations and the high transportation costs that affect her business but all in all she manages to succeed. This is Aisha’s ninth loan and the previous ones have always helped her in buying more produce for sale, as well as paying school fees. She is able to generate weekly profits of 50,000 shillings and she has a dream of educating all her children until she can spend the last penny since her future depends on them. This loan is so timely as the school term is soon beginning and she has a strong belief that it will be of great help. Aisha is the leader of Kibalinga Kyosimba Onanya group in Mubende.

loans.use: Buying produce and paying school fees for her children and dependants.

loans.name: Rosa Katy

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Katy, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas”, vive en el Jr. Augusto B. Leguía  Nº 918 –, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 37 años y es madre de 02  hijos, que aun están a cargo de ella. 

La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza la motivó a crear su propio negocio de venta de mercería, se inicio con un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 y día a día fue ganando clientela dado el buen trato que les brinda y los precio bajos que oferta. Actualmente continúa con este negocio pero ya ampliando con otros productos considerando la demanda que tiene entre sus clientes que generalmente son sus amigos y vecinos del barrio donde vive. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 400.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como cuadros, portafotos, flores artificiales, artículos para regalos, accesorios como pulseras, anillos y collares. 

Ella manifiesta que trabaja con mucho optimismo, agradeciendo la oportunidad de contar con préstamos que le ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Rosa Katy belongs to the Las Nazarenas Community Bank. She lives at Jr. Augusto B. Leguía Nº 918 –,Bellavista district, San Martín department. She is 37, in a common law marriage, and has 2 dependent children. Her characteristic strength and perseverance motivated her to start her own notions business. She started with her first loan for 300 PEN. Day by day she was winning customers due to the good treatment and low prices she offers them. She continues with the same business, but she is expanding with other products based on customer demand. Her customers are mostly her friends and neighbors. With this loan for 400 PEN, she will buy stock such as pictures, photo holders, artificial flowers, gift items, and accessories like bracelets, rings and necklaces. She works with much optimism, and she appreciates the opportunity to have loans. The loans help her to develop as a woman and as small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy diverse products for her store (pictures, flowers, picture holders, bracelets, rings, necklaces)

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en: Hamzeh is a 23-year-old young man living with his parents. In 2007, he opened his own bakery to help his brothers with the house expenses. Today, Hamzeh is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a machine for the bakery to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a machine for his bakery

loans.name: Nelly Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Azangarinas Valientes”  que esta ubicado en el del distrito de Azangaro, provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil Conviviente, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios secundaria completa,  vive en el Barrio Revolución Jr. Alfonso Ugarte.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual uso para la compra de productos de la región (papa, oca, etc.) 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de papa, chuño, quinua, ocas, cebada, etc.

Su deseo es surtir mejor se su negocio y formar un buen capital.

A ella le gusta la facilidad de pago en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Ms. Mercedes belongs to the Community Bank “Azangarinas Valientes” (“Brave Women from Azangarinas”) that is located in the Azangaro district, Azangaro Province, Department of Puno. She is 27 years old, has a live-in partner, and has two children. She has finished high school and lives in the Revolución Jr. Alfonso Ugarte neighborhood.

Mercedes has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for one year. Her first loan was 500 soles, which she used to purchase regional products (potatoes, “oca” – a type of root vegetable.) Right now she needs a loan of 500 soles to purchase potatoes, “chuño” (a type of potato), quinoa, “oca”, barley, etc.

Her dream is to stock her business better and increase her working capital.

She likes the ease of payment on her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, root vegetables, quinoa, barley, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 61 años, vive en una casa alquilada con una de sus hijas. Hace un año y medio decidió dedicarse a la venta de diversos tipos de productos, según la temporada. Actualmente vende frazadas, para ello, sale todas las mañanas, de casa en casa, ofreciendo su mercadería. Para Juana, esta actividad es muy relajante y aunque camine cuadras  innumerables consigue las ventas que se propone. Con sus ganancias y ahorros, hace algunos meses atrás, pudo incursionar en la venta de comida los fines de semana. Y debido al constante crecimiento en sus negocios Juana ha decidió continuar trabajando de esta forma e implementar sus negocios. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella está contenta porque este préstamo es una oportunidad de progreso, además que se siente comprometida con el banco comunal al que pertenece. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de frazadas para la venta y tazones nuevos para su negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Juan is 61 years old. She lives in a rented house with one of her daughters. A year and a half ago she decided to begin selling various products, depending on the season. Currently she sells blankets, going out every morning from house to house, offering her merchandise. For Juana, this is very relaxing activity although she walks innumerable blocks to make sales. With her earnings and savings, she was able to start a business selling food on the weekends a few months ago. Due to the constant growth in her businesses, Juana has decided to continue working in this manner. This is the first time she has requested a loan through MFP. She is happy because this loan is an opportunity to make progress, and she feels committed to the communal bank she has joined. The money that she is requesting will be used to purchase blankets for sale and new bowls for her business selling food.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Dashnamjil

texts.en:
Dashnamjil O. is 26 years old. He is married and has an 8-year-old son. He currently resides with his mother, wife, brother and his son in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His son has just started high school this year. Dashnamjil sells various women's and men's clothing at the local market. He bought a stall located inside the market and started selling clothes for locals. He usually purchases various women's and men's clothes from Ereen, China, a border town, from which many of Chinese cheap products are imported. Since the start of his business in 2004, he has been quite successful and has managed to expand his business by adding more varieties of clothes. In the near future, he would like add an even wider variety of clothes as locals' tastes and styles change with time. He says that he would like to expand his business aggressively and investigate different lucrative business opportunities in the town. 

He requests a loan to purchase more inventory of clothing for his retail business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of clothing for resale

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun is 36 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her youngest two daughters currently attend secondary school and one of her sons is a university student. Oyun currently operates a mobile grocery business in her town with the help of her husband, who also is a taxi driver. The couple own their own car and use it to operate the business. 

Oyun started her mobile grocery business in 1995 and has grown it into a successful operation. In 2002, the profits from the business enabled her to open her own grocery store, and her working capital now exceeds 1,200,000 tugrugs (about $830). Oyun says, “The success of my business improves my quality of life, and enables me to provide my children with a good education.”

She hopes to one day open a larger grocery store in a better location in her town. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more supplies for her store.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her store

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en:
H. Ravshan is 19 years old. He is a young craftsman. He has a small shop for repairing electronic devices like TVs, radios, CD recorders, tape recorders and others. He was taught this technical skill by his father. Being a good repairman, Ravshan is also able to suggest equipment of a better quality and more attractive price to his clients. His business is very stable and brings significant support for his family. Today Ravshan requests 3000 Somoni in order to purchase spare parts and a diagnostic device for repairing electronics. Ravshan thanks all lenders for their support and wants to ensure them that he will repay the loan with accuracy and on time.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spare parts and a diagnostic device for repairing electronics

loans.name: Irma Raquel

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Capuli.
Irma es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Irma junto a su esposo venden artefactos como televisores, dvd, sus ventas los realizan en las diferentes ferias de la región, además Irma vende miel de abeja, producto que compra de los productores.
Irma necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de licuadora, termos, extractora.
Los sueños de Irma son tener una tienda y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Capuli Communal Bank. She is 34, has a life partner, and has two children. Irma and her husband sell devices like televisions and DVD players. They sell at the different regional fairs. Also, Irma sells honey, which she buys from the producers. Irma needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy a blender, thermos, and extractor. Irma’s dreams are to have a store and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a blender, thermos, and extractor

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth G. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 34 years old and married. To make a living, Maribeth owns and operates a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month. In 2006, Maribeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP that she used to purchase additional products to sell. Maribeth is requesting her 8th loan for 14900 PHP that she will use to purchase additional inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Mayamin

texts.es:
Mayamin tiene 43 años, está casada y tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 viven en su casa.
Se inició sembrando café y plátanos, y de a pocos fueron incrementando sus chacras, sobre todo  de café. La cantidad era tanta que Mayamin y su esposo no pudieron cosechar solos, debido a la abundante producción del café, entonces buscaron operarios y cosecharon prontamente; finalmente vendieron a buen precio su producto.
En ese entonces, con las ganancias compraron un carro, que es manejado por su esposo. Ahora  brindan el servicio de transporte de carga, por el cual les pagan dependiendo la distancia que recorren, pero ellos no dejan de dedicarse a sus cultivos de café, que en determinadas épocas le son muy rentables, por ello, Mayamin está muy complacida con su chacra de café.

Desde su primer ciclo de crédito y éste, el segundo, se desempeña como secretaria de su banco comunal, al cual estima muchísimo, y por ello está muy comprometida con la puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la elaboración de un vivero de café.
texts.en:
Mayamin is 43 years old, married and has 4 children, 3 of whom live in her house. She started planting coffee and bananas, and slowly increased her fields, particularly her coffee plantings. The quantity was such that Mayamin and her husband could not harvest them alone, as there was an abundant yield of coffee. So they looked for workers and they harvested quickly, finally selling their product at a good price. At that time they bought a car with the earnings, which is driven by her husband. Now they provide goods transport services; they are paid depending on the distance that is traveled. But they have not left their activity of cultivating coffee, which at times is very profitable for them. Mayamin is very pleased with her coffee farm. From their first credit cycle to this, their second, she served as secretary of their communal bank, where she is held in high esteem. For this reason she is very committed to making her payments on time. The money that she is now requesting will be used to make a coffee nursery.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make a coffee nursery

loans.name: Lorlina

texts.en:
Lorlina is a 46 year-old widow with five children, four of whom are already working and helping out with the household expenses, while the youngest still attends school. Lorlina has a live-in partner named Marcial who also helps her in her business. They live in Brgy. Libacao, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.

Lorlina and Marcial have a simple dream – for her youngest child to finish college, have electricity connected to their house, buy their own incubator for their balut business (balut is fertilized duck egg with a nearly developed embryo that is boiled and eaten in the shell), and be able to buy a tricycle (a motorcycle with side car) to deliver their products. If she accomplishes these goals, she knows that their living conditions will surely improve.

Even before she started her business, she thought of what to do to help improve and make life easy for her family. She decided that selling street food like boiled peanut and balut. They developed a daily routine of buying raw balut and peanuts in the morning and cooking fresh batches daily and going around the town streets to sell their products. It was hard work but it earned a living for their family, so Lorlina persevered.

In 2004, Lorlina saw the opportunity to expand her business and joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to access the capital necessary to increase her sales volume. This turned out to be a good decision and she was finally able to set up a permanent place to display her products.  Now instead of operating a roving business, she can let her customers come to her in the same place every day. 

Lorlina earns a net profit of about 10,000 Philippine pesos (about $213 US) or sometimes more per month. At present, she is setting aside a portion for her “motorcycle fund” and for the education of her youngest child.  Her previous loan of 15,000 pesos was used as revolving capital for her balut and peanut business. 

Now she is borrowing, for her 11th loan cycle, the amount of 18,000 pesos.  This loan will be used both as revolving working capital for her balut and peanut business and to buy piglets to raise and sell for a profit when they are fully grown. Some part of the income from this will be added to her motorcycle fund until she could buy her dream motorcycle for her deliveries, and the rest will be for the education and support of their family. 

When she has bought her motorcycle, Lorlina intends to start saving up for her incubator so that she can make the balut herself and increase her profit margin.

About NWTF

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her food stall business and new pig fattening business

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Pablo M. le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior y empezar la elaboración de un cuarto.
Solicita el préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder terminar su casa y empezar la construcción de un cuarto más será para uno de sus hijos que ya están creciendo y quieren su propio espacio en la casa.
Don Pablo tiene un carro de taxi el cual trabaja con el todo el día y con el cual una parte de las ganancias será para pagar el crédito.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Santa Isabel Pérez esposa el señor Pablo, ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Señor Pablo M.'s house needs the outside finished off and another room added. He is asking for a loan as he does not currently have enough money to finish off his house and start building a room for one of his children who are growing up and want their own space in the house. Don Pablo works all day long with his taxi cab and he will use some of that income to pay off the loan. The woman in the photo is Señora Santa Isabel Pérez, Señor Pablo's wife, as he was out at work on the day of the visit.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish the outside of the house and start building another room

loans.name: Loisi

texts.en:
Loisi C. is 32 and married with 4 children (ages 2 - 11).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Loisi has many years of experience in this business.  Loisi needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 tala or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Loisi joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Loisi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

"The following social metrics for Loisi C. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.6 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Adamah

texts.en: Ms. F. works selling fabrics in the Grand Marché of Lomé, Togo. This high-traffic area keeps her busy with her work. She has been in this business since 1988 and is now asking for her first loan from WAGES. She plans on using this loan to resupply her stock of fabrics used for women’s clothing. Ms. F. was born in Aneho, a town east of Lomé, close to the Benin border. She is single and has no children.

loans.use: Fabric for clothing

loans.name: Bertha Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. Berta E. tiene una mini-pulperia en su casa de habitación  vende arroz, frijoles, azúcar, huevo, gaseosa, pan y tomate la tiene en su casa por que asi tiene tiempo para cuidar de sus hijos ya que tiene 3 niñas mujeres menor de edad, las tres en edad escolar, es casada su esposo trabaja para una institución financiera de vigilante, y si los crédito que ha tenido con nosotros le han ayudado mucho ya que se ha ayudado en terminar de hacer su casa y mantener su ventesita, el dinero los solicita para compra de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha E. has a mini-market in her house where she sells rice, beans, sugar, eggs, sodas, bread, and tomatoes. This allows her to stay at home so that she can take care of her three daughters who are in school and financially dependent on her. Her husband works as a security guard at a financial institution.

Her previous loans have been a great help to Bertha in finishing her house and maintaining her small store. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase grain.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain

loans.name: Elsita

texts.en:
Elsita R. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Elsita is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Elsita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products such as banana cue and ready-to-eat food like chips and more in the local community. Elsita has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elsita is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Elsita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ayobami

texts.en:
Ayobami is a successful and hardworking woman. She is 45 years old with 3 children. Her husband is a businessman and works hard too to provide for his family's well being. She sells underwear and tailoring materials. She supports her husband in taking care of the home with her proceeds from the business. She has been in the business for over 15 years and she manages it with the support of her children. Her children are aged 4, 7, and 12 years old. 

Ayobami is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more underwear and tailoring materials to sell. She hopes to repay back her loan at the due date. She has been a member in LAPO microfinance for years. She thanks Kiva and LAPO for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear and tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Aurea's Group

texts.en:
Aurea R. is from the village of Tawagan, Labangan ZDS. She is 45 years old. Aurea is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Aurea is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Aurea raises ducks for sale. Aurea has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately $150 a month from this activity.

Aurea joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurea is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ducklings to raise and sell in the future. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ducklings to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Saldivar Poty Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Saldivar Poty, se conformo en fecha 22 de marzo del 2.007, gracias a las ganas de cada una de ellas. 
Una vez contactada con la asesora acerca del Programa se reunieron 18 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 11º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El grupo en el transcurso de los ciclos, pasó por algunos inconvenientes, ya que la Directora General estuvo con problemas de salud, pero respondiendo sin ningún problema al compromiso aceptado, de esta manera el grupo gracias a su trabajo solidario logró salir adelante y siguen trabajando con el programa hasta estos días.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
Una de las integrantes es la señora quien se dedica a la venta de artículos de limpieza, todos los productos son elaborados por la señora.
Una vez elaborados los productos ella sale a ofrecer por varios lugares.
Solicita el préstamos para la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en:
The Saldivar Poty Communal Bank was formed on March 22nd in 2007, thanks to the aspirations of each one of then. Once they contacted the counselor about the program, 18 women joined. They are working happily together in their 11th cycle in a supportive way within the program. Through the cycles the group has had some inconveniences. The General Director had health problems. But, she is responding without problems to the commitment she accepted. The group, thanks to its supportive work, was able to get ahead and still keep working in the program. All of them have different activities to make money. They help each other to reach the common objectives that they all have in the group and with the Fundación Paraguaya. They actively participate in the weekly meetings, and their work is impeccably supportive. One of the members is a woman who sells cleaning supplies. She makes all of the products. Once she has made the products, she goes out to sell them in various places. She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients to make these products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sodium hydroxide solution, soap, bicarbonate, and glycerin

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 38 years old, married with 5 children.  Evariste is a hard-working businessman who is well-known in the business of selling foodstuffs, mainly beans.  He has been in this business for about 9 years and the hours of his business are from 6 am to 8 pm every day.

Evariste has an idea of expanding his business through adding other types of goods such as rice, sugar, and sorghum. He needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase those goods, which will increase his sales as well as his profits.  With these profits, Evariste will keep reinvesting for a better future for his business as well as for his family.

loans.use: The purchase of some other types of goods such as rice, sugar, sorghum, etc.

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en: Kasifa is widowed with six children and only two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.  Kasifa sells yellow bananas in Nakawa market, one of the markets in Kampala City. She uses public transport to and from home. Kasifa buys from her place of work from delivery vans, which bring the bananas from the villages.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches and clusters of yellow bananas. Kasifa has been in this business for over 20 years and with MCDT for nine years. She pays daily market dues of 1,000/=. She works seven days a week.  Her major business challenge is that of the rainy season because she works from an open place.  She aspires to acquire a permanent business structure and to start going directly to farmers for her bananas. She decided to join MCDT because it was helping poor women. She resides in and owns a four-room house where she stays with six members. The family has no access to electricity or water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bananas

loans.name: Cipriano Javier

texts.es: Cipriano Javier tiene 35 años es padre de familia, tiene 3 hijas, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en un poblado, la actividad económica del señor es la elaboración de artesanías en su domicilio, realiza la actividad de manera manual. Hace 12 años tiene este negocio porque tenía que proporcionarle a su familia una estabilidad económica y a sus hijos una educación. El señor Cipriano empezó trabajando como ayudante y luego aprendió a fabricar piezas de barro, que se venden en el municipio y a nivel nacional e internacional. El financiamiento es para compra de materia prima y elaboración de artículos de barro para llevarlos a la  feria que se realizara en Miami en Noviembre. Para cumplir  sus deseos de tener dinero suficiente para trabajar con capital propio y dar una estabilidad emocional y económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Cipriano Javier is 35 years old, a father of 3 daughters. His home is located in a village. For a living he makes handmade crafts at home. He has had this business for 12 years as he needed to provide his family with economic stability and his children with schooling. Mr. Cipriano began to work as an assistant and then learned to make clay objects which are sold in the municipality as well as nationally and internationally. The loan will be invested in buying raw material and making objects to be taken to the market in Miami in the month of November. It is his dream to obtain enough money to be able to work with his own capital and give emotional and economic stability to his family

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Lilian Janira

texts.es: Lilian es de 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos un varón y dos mujeres, se dedica a prestar sus servicios como maestra de educación hace aproximadamente 10 años, solicita su sexto crédito para compra una computadora que le servirá para su trabajo y uso personal de su familia, sus créditos anteriores los pago sin problema de atraso.
texts.en:
Lilian is 38 years old, married, and has three children (a son and two daughters). She has worked as a teacher for approximately ten years.

Lilian is requesting her sixth loan to buy a computer for her job and for personal use by her family. Her previous loans were repaid without problems or delays.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer for work and for personal use

loans.name: Nyakondo

texts.en:
Nyakondo is a married woman with five children who all passed their O-levels (high school exams). Her husband is a teacher and he contributes to his family’s basic needs. Nyakondo owns a house with no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Previously, Nyakondo used to sell coconuts to her neighboring community from home. With the Kshs 60,000 loan, she wants to purchase a motorcycle to be used for transportation services, her other sources of income being from selling coconuts and the sale of timber.

Nyakondo faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to purchase a maize-milling machine and start a milling business someday. She decided to work with Yehu because of its sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to be used for transportation services

loans.name: Rosalino

texts.en: Rosalino A. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 41 years old. Rosalino is widowed and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalino operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing mechanical services as a planer to local community members. Rosalino has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Rosalino joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalino is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosalino from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Arciejean

texts.en:
Arciejean F. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 25 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Arciejean owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste from a direct selling company in the local community. Arciejean has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Arciejean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arciejean is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Arciejean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing constructive materials

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina G. is from Barangay 4, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she provides motorcycle transport to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $105 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Agustina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Maura Rosa

texts.es: Maura Rosa Perez M. de 53 años se dedica desde hace más de 8 años a la venta de ropa y accesorios de uso personal como prensadores, medias, pirañas, alfileres, entre muchos otros conocidos popularmente como trucha. Ella anteriormente vendía ambulante y ahora posee su tramo propio donde la venta de truchas se logra con mayor facilidad al igual que la ropa. En su negocio recibe la ayuda de su hija mayor de 26 años quien será posiblemente la hija que quede con el negocio como herencia.
texts.en:
Maura Rosa Perez M. is 53 years old and she has worked for over 8 years selling clothing and accessories for personal use such as pressers, socks, pins, "pirañas" and many other items popularly known as "trucha". She previously sold by street and now has her own section where she sells these items more easily than the clothing. She receives help with her business from her eldest daughter who is 26, who will possibly be the one to inherit the business.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for undergarments and other merchandise

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia C. is from the village of Estrada. She is 54 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Eufemia owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Eufemia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Eufemia joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Virgen De Rosario Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO  esta compuesta por tres integrantes  2 mujeres  y un varón El  representante del grupo es el Sr. Teófilo, se dedican a la venta D. carbón le entregan por mayor y el venD. al por mayor o menor, el dinero del crédito será para la compra D. carbón por carga ya que pronto le entregaran una buena cantidad,  las Sras. Viven en Colomi  a unos 45 minutos D. sacaba sus puestos D. venta son céntricos cerca D. la plaza principal, es un grupo D. amigos se conocen  D.  hace muchos años ,son muy conocidos en la zona   por ser personas muy responsables y trabajadoras, el préstamo lo destinaran para su mercadería y aumentar capital.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Virgen del Rosario" [Virgin of the Rosary] is maD. up of three members, two women and one man. The group's representative is Teófilo who sells charcoal. It is delivered to him wholesale and he sells it wholesale or retail. The money from the loan will be for the purchase of a load of charcoal since he will have a large quantity delivered to him soon. 

The women live in Colomi about 45 minutes from Sacaba. Their points of sale are centrally located near the main plaza. They are a group of friends who have known each other for many years. They are well-known in the area for being responsible and hard-working people. The loan will be used for their merchandise and to increase capital.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Adelia

texts.es:
Adelia F. finalmente esta mas tranquila con su seguridad porque con su credikiva anterior compró una reja y adicionalmente como invirtió en publicidad ahora sus ventas se ha aumentado ligeramente y esto la entuisiasma;  está renovando su credikiva para comprar tela y madera, pues cada dia estos insumos aumentan sus precios y ella quiere aprovechar oportunidades en el mercado, para continuar respondiendole a sus clientes como ellos lo solicitan. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Adelia siga el siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/202261
texts.en:
Adelia F. is finally more at ease regarding her safety because she used her previous Kiva loan to buy a metal grate.  She also invested in publicity and now her sales have increased slightly which excites her.

She is renewing her Kiva loan to buy fabric and wood because these supplies are becoming more expensive every day and she wants to take advantage of market opportunities in order to continue responding to customers in the manner they expect.

If you’d like to know Adelia’s story, please visit the following link:

http://kiva.org/lend/202261

loans.use: To buy fabric and wood.

loans.name: Gédéon Plus Group

texts.en:
Nzeki, aged 43, is the manager of the community bank named Gédéon Plus. It is composed of 13 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Nzeki has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2007. She runs a restaurant. Her business is the eastern part of Kinshasa. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI (microfinance institution) HOPE RDC, having six times obtained and correctly repaid loans. 

With her next loan, she is planning to increase the restaurant’s stock by buying three boxes of salted fish, chickens, two 50kg sacks of corn and manioc flour and vegetable oil with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $100 per week. 

Nzeki’s ambition is to enlarge her restaurant and open a general store. She is divorced and the mother of three children whose ages range between 20 and 22 years old. Two of them attend school. She is also taking care of her mother.

loans.use: To increase the restaurant’s stock by buying three boxes of salted fish, chickens, two 50kg sacks of corn and manioc flour

loans.name: Abiyunze (Alexie) Group

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 26 years old and is married. He is the president of a group called “Abiyunze” and is the last person on the right in the picture above. This group is commonly known to be in the business of selling clothes.  Jean Claude has been in this business for about four years and he currently employs one person.  His business is open from 8am until 8pm every day of the week.

Jean Claude has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to upgrade his business and help his family.  Jean Claude plans to use any profits to reinvest in his business and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Rosa, tiene 58 años de edad, está separada, pero de  una relación que tuvo tiene 6 hijos todos mayores de edad, una hija vive en su casa con el esposo y dos hijos pequeños que son la alegría de nuestra socia.  Está en el Banco Comunal hace tres años y le gusta porque  le han brindado mucha ayuda con los créditos.
 
Tiene un negocio de venta de billetes de lotería el cual lo realiza por las calles de la ciudad de Manta. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 18h00. Lleva en esta actividad más de 30 años y dice que le gusta lo que hace ya que con esto pudo sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar al contado sus billetes de lotería ya que así le salen a mejor precio y le quedan mejores ganancias. Sus sueños son llegar a tener un local en el cual poder vender sus billetes de lotería.
texts.en:
The July 22nd Community Bank meets every two weeks in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. It is an area well known for its commerce, for its traditional festivals of St. Pedro and St. Pablo, and for its happy people.

58-year old Señora Rosa lives here. She is separated from her husband but has six children by him. All of them are adults. One daughter lives in her house with her husband and two children who bring Rosa a great deal of joy. She has been with the community bank for three years, and she really likes the bank as it has provided much help with loans.

Rosa runs a business selling lottery tickets in the streets of the town of Manta. She works every day from 9am to 6pm and has been doing this for more than thirty years. She likes the work as it has allowed her to to help her children get ahead. 

Rosa needs this loan to buy lottery tickets with cash and thus get the best price. This in turn generates the most profit. Her dream is to have a permanent location from which to sell tickets

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que produce principalmente  frutas como mango, limón y maracuyá. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar como agricultor en un pequeño terreno de cultivo de su propiedad. Usualmente siembra frutas como el limón. Adicionalmente trabaja como transportista en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado para transportar carga y pasajeros que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina). Con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades el se hace cargo de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Segundo desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de limón aplicándole algunos fertilizantes y riegos, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Segundo is 28 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and two children in the Tambogrande agricultural district, which has a semitropical climate and mainly produces fruits, such as mangoes, lemons, and passion fruit.  It is part of the Piura area and is located more than four hours from Chiclayo city, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region.
 
He works as farmer on a small plot of land that he owns.  He usually grows fruits such as lemons.  He also drives a motorcycle taxi.  With the money that these activities bring him, he is trying to improve his household income.

Segundo would like to maintain his lemon cultivation by applying fertilizer and irrigating his plot, and he has asked microfinance partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles ($375) for this purpose.

loans.use: To support his cultivation of lemons with fertilizer and irrigation.

loans.name: Badamragchaa

texts.en:
Badamragchaa is 28 years old and lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. Her husband is an overseer for a local company and her son attends kindergarten. Badamragchaa supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia.

In 2005, when she first began her business, she rented a stall at Narantuul from another person who had a rental contract with Narantuul. This was an unstable business situation for her because the middleman could dismiss her at any time. Usually, it is very difficult to obtain a rental contract with Narantuul because the stalls are in such high demand. 

However, in 2007, Badamragchaa had the opportunity to sign a rental contract directly with Narantuul to make her business more stable. Also, she bought land with 2.5 million MNT of her business earnings in 2008. 

Now, her working capital is 2 million MNT and she sells a lot of seasonal kids' clothing. She is requesting a 1 million MNT to purchase kids' clothes for spring from Ereen City, China. She wants to use this loan to help support her in this very busy shopping season of the year.

Her current home changes temperatures very quickly, according to the outside conditions. So her family wants to build a new house with her business earnings in 2011.

loans.use: To purchase kids' clothes for spring

loans.name: Chuob

texts.en: Chuob K. has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. She is now married and has five kids, three of whom are employed in different jobs. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. Presently, she and her husband always use their old motorbike to go anywhere. Unfortunately, this existing motorbike has often broken down during use. Because of this, Chuob K. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva, which she will use to change the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To change the broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Kwt Tiing Gading Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu E. Y. is the chairman of this group that is re-applying for its fifth loan from MUK. Eight people stopped their membership because of various reasons. 

Ni Putu E. Y. plans to use the loan to buy five pigs, while the feed is purchased in advance with her own capital from the sale of previous pigs. Every day Ni Putu E. Y. spends Rp 15,000 for the kitchen, and Rp. 150.000 for payment for electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy five pigs

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret, 29 years old, is married to a policeman and the mother of six children, all of whom attend school. Currently in the business of selling bread,  Margret is requesting a loan to stock more bread to sell. With the additional profits accruing from the loan, she hopes to expand her business and build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: Stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina M. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling daily use products such as canned goods, snack foods, candies, biscuits and instant noodles in her community. She is 55 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. Josefina has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.
