Josefina is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, detergents and snack foods. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, detergents and snack foods.

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN D. YUNCAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en la comunidad D. Yuncaypata, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Biviana; la socia tiene 56 años D. edad casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura ella siembra lo que son papa y ,trigo, entre otros para luego venderlos en las ferias que se realizan los días sábados en el mercado D. huancaro por el centro D. la ciudad, a la vez la socia se dedica al cuidado D. sus hijos y D. su hogar ya que sus hijos aun son pequeños y están en colegio ella se encarga D. prepararles su almuerzo alistarles sus cosas para su colegio siendo así que la socia saca a sus hijos adelante ya que son lo más importante que tiene.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. fertilizantes, abono, semillas entre otros para seguir se sembrando sus productos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "VIRGEN DEL CARMEN D. YUNCAYPATA", which is located in the Yuncaypata Community in the province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Biviana is 56 years old, married and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with growing crops such as potatoes and wheat, among others.  She sells her produce at the Saturday market in Huancaro in the city center.  She also is a homemaker and takes care of her children who are still young and in school.  She prepares lunch for them every day and gets them ready for school, doing all she can for them since they are what matters most to her.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to continue grow crops.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to continue growing crops

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice M. is 40 years old.  She is married to a businessman, and the couple have seven children, all of whom are in school. She is currently in the business of selling food.  Her future goal is to buy a big house and then rent it.

loans.use: to stock more food at her market

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es:
Zacarías tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, tienen casa propia con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del caserío de Caracucho a unos 10 minutos del distrito de Morrope y a 30 minutos al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a l actividad agrícola, ganadería y tiene festividades religiosas muy bonitas.
Zacarías es comerciante desde hace 4 años de aves de corral y de cerdos, su corral se encuentra a unos 10 minutos de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos de su hogar.
Ha solicitado Zacarías un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más aves de corral y sus respectivos alimentos, con la finalidad de engordarlas para luego venderlas y tener un mejor precio y así mejoraría la calidad de vida de su familia.
Zacarías es un esposo y padre muy responsable que se preocupa por el futuro de sus hijos por eso trata que su negocio sea cada vez mejor.
texts.en:
Zacarías is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children. They receive services, such as water and electricity, and own a home in the rural section of the village of Caracucho. This community is ten minutes away from the District of Morrope and thirty minutes away from the Department of Lambayeque. Zacarías is a merchant who has been selling poultry and pigs for four years. His animal pens are located approximately ten minutes away from his house.

He provides his animals with balanced feed so that they will grow to the optimal size before being sold to different markets in the area. Zacarías is able to generate very good earnings so that he can cover his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that he can buy more poultry and the appropriate feed. He plans to fatten the animals so that he can sell them later at a good price. This will help him improve the quality of life for his family.

Zacarías is a responsible husband and father who is concerned about the future of his children. He strives each day to make his business better.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and the appropriate animal feed.

loans.name: El Cambio Va Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Cambio Va está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Carmen del Socorro de 52 años quien se dedica a la venta de sandalia, ropa usada etc. desde hace 4 años.
Ella tiene cinco hijos mayores de los cuales sus dos hijas le ayudan una económicamente y la otra en el negocio. La señora Carmen invertirá en sandalia y ropa interior.
Las otras integrantes son la señora Cristina de 57 años quien vende nacatamales, leña, frijoles cocidos y horna etc. y la señora María Nieves de 63 años vende verduras, chiverías y leña.
texts.en:
The loan group "El Cambio Va" is comprised of three hardworking, enterprising women. The coordinator of the is group is 52 year old Carmen, who sells sandals, used clothes, etc, and has been doing this for 4 years.
She has 5 grown-up children and her 2 daughters help her out - one of them economically and the other by helping with the business. Carmen will use the loan to purchase sandals and underwear. 
The other members of the group are 57 year old Cristina, who sells steamed corn cakes, firewood, cooked beans, etc; and 63 year old María Nieves, who sells vegetables, dairy products, and firewood.

loans.use: to purchase sandals and underwear

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres  de BENKADI  1 sont des femmes toutes mariées,  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 34  ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. EIles vivent  dans des familles  traditionnelles élargies à MEMISSALA, un situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur cinquième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire leurs besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo. 
YAMA, compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter,  3 sacs d’urée 2 sac de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 à 55 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
Il ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. 
NB : Lors de la prise de photo la nommée LALA  était au C.S.COM. (CENTRE DE SANTÉ COMMUNAUTAIRE) pour des raisons de santé.
texts.en:
The 10 members of Benkadi 1 are all married women who average 34 years of age and have on average 5 children each. They live in traditional extended families in Memissala, located roughly 30km from the town of Niena in the Sikasso region, 3rd administrative district of Mali.

These women are in their fifth agricultural loan cycle with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet their needs in terms of production and agricultural inputs. The previous loans were satisfactorily repaid.

This group of women grows corn, rice, groundnuts and okra.

Yama plans to use her loan to buy 3 sacks of urea (fertilizer), 2 sacs of complex fertilizer and the rest for plowing and hoeing costs. She expects to make an average profit of 50,000 to 55,000 CFA francs, which will be used for the daily expenses of her family.

She plans to increase her turnover in order to better satisfy her customers.

N.B.: When this photo was taken, the group member named Lala was at the Community Health Center for health reasons.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for plowing expenses

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the high cost of transportation.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She hopes to expand and establish a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Angela Daysi

texts.es: Ángela Daysi tiene 61 años. Por lo que no es la primera experiencia que ha tenido con los financiamientos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de textil y vestuario. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella desde muy joven ha trabajado, ella confecciona todo tipo de prendas de vestir y también por encargo la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan diferentes pedidos  y algunas empresas que acuden por sus servicios. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de telas, gorras, zipper, bolsos, botones, hilos entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Ángela Daysi is 61 years old. This is not the first experience she has had with financing. The economic activity she makes a living at is the sale of textiles and apparel. 

It has been more than 30 years since she began making a living at this business. She has worked worked since she was quite young. She makes all kinds of garments and the majority of her customers make a variety of custom requests and some businesses turn to her for her services. 

She is requesting this loan for working capital to purchase textiles, caps, zippers, bags, buttons and thread among other products.

loans.use: to buy textiles, caps, zippers, bags, buttons and thread among other products.

loans.name: Maysaramo

texts.ru: Майсарамо жительница района Хамадони. Ей 56 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Она имеет среднее образование. При доме Майсарамо имеет небольшой земельный участок, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и топлива.
texts.en: Maysaramo is a resident of Hamadoni region. She is 56 years old and married. She has six children. She has secondary education. Maysaramo has a small plot of land by her house where she grows vegetables for sale. She has been in this business for twenty years. She is taking out the loan to buy seeds and fuel.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fuel

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
This is Isabel, 27, a resident of Tanza, a part of Cavite City in the Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, her partner in business and is also the mother of two children. Together with her husband, they manage their own household while operating their businesses. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Isabel operates a variety store adjacent to her house. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five PHP’s worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Isabel profits by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. She also runs a tricycle unit (motorcycle with sidecar) and sells ready-to-wear clothes to the community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and those in the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

Isabel is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy groceries, various products and ready-to-wear clothes to expand her product inventory. A portion of the loan will also be used for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Isabel hopes to be able to grow her businesses soon, just as she hopes to hand them over to the next generation. She faithfully attends meetings with her co-fellowship* members every week where she shares stories of her work and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, RTW clothes and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Badenyaton 3 Group

texts.fr:
BADENYATON 3 est un regroupement de cinq femmes toutes mariée dans de grandes familles traditionnelles et ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Farabougou dans la commune rurale de Tesserela relevant de la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de parenté. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies de culture, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe cultiveront l’arachide, le mil, le niébé et le sésame.
Madame Fatoumata (Assise en tenue verte raillée de blanc) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, un sac de complexe céréales, un sac d’urée, recruter la main d’œuvre pour se faire aider dans les activités de labour, de sarclage et de récolte. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Ségou et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes du village. Elle compte récolter sur une superficie de 2 hectares : 5 sacs de mil, 10 sacs d’arachide et 2 sacs de sésame. Une partie de la production est auto-consommée tandis que le reste est vendu pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Badenyaton 3 is a group of five women, all married in large traditional families, who are, on average, 32 years old with three children.  They live in the village of Farabougou in the rural commune of Tesserela, which is in Ségou, Mali’s fourth administrative region.  They know each other through marriage and family ties.  They turned to Soro Yiriwaso hoping to increase the land area they farm, and are currently on their second farming loan.  The group’s members farm peanuts, millet, nyebe beans (cowpeas) and sesame.

Fatoumata (seated in a green outfit with white stripes) plans on using her loan to purchase a bag of complex fertilizer and a bag of urea, and to hire workers to help with her business’ plowing, hoeing and harvesting.  She gets her fresh farm inputs at the Ségou market and she recruits workers from the village’s youth association.  She plans on harvesting from 2 hectares (5 acres) of land: 5 bags of millet, 10 bags of peanuts and 2 bags of sesame.  A portion of the yield is for her family’s consumption, while the rest will be sold to meet the family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and make use of workers

loans.name: Joaquin Alonso

texts.es:
Joaquín, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos, su familia es de agricultores, dedicándose al cultivo de maíz, maicillo y frijol, Joaquín tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse al cultivo, realizándolo de 6:00am a 2:00pm, lo aprendió de su padre.
Actualmente invertirá en la compra de abono y pago de jornaleros, que con el préstamo espera cubrir el gasto, ayudándole a solventar la necesidad y que esto contribuya para tener un buen cultivo y al final una buena cosecha. Los sueños de Joaquín es ayudar a completar los estudios de sus hermanos, dándoles la oportunidad de superarse, y con sus padres pues con la cosecha les ayuda a tener ingresos y alimentación.
texts.en: Joaquiín is single and lives with his parents and siblings. His family is farmers. They grow corn, millet and beans. Joaquín has been a farmer for the past ten years. He works from 6:00am until 2:00pm. He learned how to farm from his father. He would like to buy fertilizer and pay his farm workers. With this loan he hopes to cover his expenses, provide for his necessities and thereby have a good crop and, ultimately, a good harvest. His dreams are to help his siblings finish their education. A good education will help them to succeed. With this harvest, he can help his parents have an income and food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay his farmworkers.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Raynaldo le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material (cemento, arena, pintura especial para el exterior, y pagarle a la persona) que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Desea que su familia tenga un lugar seguro y en buenas condiciones para vivir y así también poder evitar enfermedades. 
Don Reynaldo planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad de una compañía, ya que su esposa la señora Damaris se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como empleada de una agencia.
texts.en:
Reynaldo's home needs some finishing work done to the outside.  He is requesting a loan to buy materials (cement, sand, special outdoor paint) and to pay the person who will carry out the work.

Reynaldo would like his family to have a safe place, in good condition, in which to live so that they can avoid illnesses.

Reynaldo plans to repay his loan with the salary that he earns from his job as a security guard for a company.  His wife, Damaris, will take care of the family expenses with the income that she earns from her job as an office employee.

loans.use: to do some finishing work to the outside of his home

loans.name: Kasi Mpya Group

texts.en:
Daudi, who is his mid 20s, is married with a small child.  He has been selling second-hand clothes for one year now.  He works from 10 a.m to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a piece of land and started to build a small two-roomed house. He also increased the clothes sales and has paid back both his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to increase his stock in second-hand clothes and to finish building his small house. His dream is to one day be able to take his child to good standard schools.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kasi Mpya" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase  his stock in second-hand clothes and to finish building his small house.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 35 years old and is single. She owns a sewing business. Beatha has been in this business for about five years and her business is open from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day. 

Beatha has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her business by purchasing new sewing machines. With any profits, Beatha will be able to reinvest in her business and save for her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase new machines for her sewing.

loans.name: Tianshi Group

texts.en: Kennedy is 21 years old and is still single. He lives in Runyararo, West Masvingo and has no dependants. He is into buying and selling of health products. He has been in business for the past two years. He is going to buy supplements of health products with the loan. In the next five years, Kennedy wishes to open his own company, which specializes in health products.

loans.use: to buy health product supplements

loans.name: Lissy

texts.es: Lissy tiene 27 años, es una mujer muy joven y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ella convive con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 8 y 4 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. EL trabajo de Lissy consiste en la venta de ropa, siendo su forma de pago a crédito. Al cabo de 15 días visita a sus clientes para realizar la cobranza. Es la la primera vez que realiza este trabajo, y tiene puesta todas las ganas posibles, además de tener muchas expectativas, pues le ayudará a tener un ingreso adicional en su casa. Espera poder ganar bien, ya que  analizó el mercado por lo que espera que le irá bien en el negocio. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, la primera vez le fue muy bien y mostró ser muy puntual en los pagos. Asimisma se siente agradecida con la oportunidad y la confianza que le dieron para poder realizar nuevos retos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería en la ciudad de Lima, y traerá modelos de vanguardia en ropa femenina.
texts.en:
Lissy, 27, is a very young woman with a strong drive to get ahead.  She lives with her partner and they have two children who are 8 and 4 years old.  They live together in their own house.  Lissy works selling clothes on credit.  After two weeks pass by she visits her customers to collect payment.  This is the first time she’s done this work and she’s putting all her efforts into it because she has high expectations for it in that it will help her have an additional source of income for her household. She hopes to make good profits since she analyzed the marked and expects she’ll do well in the business.

This will be the second MFP loan.  She did well the first time and she was very punctual with her payments.  She feels very grateful for the opportunity and for the trust given her to reach her new goals.  She will use the amount requested to buy merchandise in the city of Lima and bring cutting edge women’s wear.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Mireille

texts.fr:
Cliente de 33 ans,mariée et mère de 3 enfants qui vont tous a l'école. Tres active , elle se reveille de bonne heure s'occupe de son foyer et de son business.Elle est une cliente qui a beneficie de plusieurs prets de Hope, ces credits ont un impact positif sur sa vie sociale et economique et financiere.
Elle a rembourse le prêt avec succès , a fait des épargnes considérables et a  investi favorablement dans l'amélioration des conditions de travail de son salon de coiffure.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle va acheter des produits de cosmétiques, tel que defrisants, démêlants, de produits de manucures et pédicures et capillaires des tissages et des perruques.Elle a ajouter en plus du nouveau matériel comme un casque a bain a bain d'huile pour traitement de cheveux.

Pour l'avenir, elle compte ouvrir un autre salon de coiffure dans un autre quartier ,et avec ses benefices elle est entrain d'acheter des équipements pour ouvrir  aussi un institut de beauté. Elle s'occupe valablement de ses enfants et de leur scolarire
texts.en:
This client is a 33-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. A very active woman, she wakes up early every morning to take care of her household and her business. She has benefited from several loans from Hope, and these loans have had a positive impact on her social, economic, and financial life. She has repaid her loans successfully, built up considerable savings, and invested productively in the improvement of her hair salon's working conditions.

With this new loan, she is going to buy cosmetics such as hair straighteners, disentanglers, manicure and pedicure products, hair extensions, and weaves. She also wants to add new equipment such as an oil hair dryer to treat hair.

For the future, she intends to open another hair salon in a different area, and with her profits she is also in the process of buying equipment to open a beauty parlour. She takes care of a significant portion of her children's scholastic and other needs.

loans.use: To purchase hair and beauty products

loans.name: José Adrian

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 42 años de edad, es casado con tres hijos.

José desde muy pequeño se dedica a la agricultura, a sembrar maíz, fríjol a la crianza de pollos de engorde y a la ganadería a pequeña escala. De estas actividades recibe los ingresos para sostener a su familia, ya que sus padres desde pequeño le inculcaron el trabajo y como ganarse la vida.

Los pollos se los llegan a dejar a su casa una vez al mes, para siempre tener disponible para la venta. El concentrado y las vitaminas, entre otras cosas las va a comprar a la ciudad y se tarda una hora en llegar ahí, él va una o dos veces por semana a realizar estas compras.

José solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar concentrado, vitaminas y minerales para sus pollos de engorde. Debido a que recientemente José ha incrementado a 700 pollos en su granja, ya que en navidad aumenta la venta y el negocio es rentable.

De esta manera sacara los pollos a tiempo, para la temporada navideña y posicionarse en el mercado y tener buena demanda.

Don José es un hombre muy visionario, su meta es ahorrar de los ingresos que le genera la venta de sus pollos, para establecer un pequeño agroservicio, ya que el lugar donde vive, esta bastante retirado de la ciudad.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old, married, and has three children.

José has been working in agriculture since he was very young, growing corn and beans, fattening chickens, and raising livestock on a small scale.  Through these business activities he makes the income he needs to support his family as his parents instilled in him the need to work and how to earn a living from a young age.

The chickens are dropped off at José's home once a month so that he always has some available to sell.  He buys the concentrate and vitamins, among other things, in the city (a trip which takes an hour).  He goes there once or twice a week to make these purchases.

José is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy concentrate, vitamins and minerals for the chickens that he fattens because he recently increased the number of birds on his farm to 700 as sales increase around Christmas time and the business is profitable.

In this way, José will raise his birds in time for the Christmas season, position himself in the market, and experience good demand.

José is a very visionary man.  His goal is to save the income that he makes through his chicken sales so that he can set up a small agricultural supplies store because the place in which he lives is quite a long way from the city.

loans.use: to buy concentrate, vitamins and minerals for the chickens that he fattens

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Rom, 35,  and her husband sell vegetables. Rom is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike to transport the vegetables to resell.  By doing so, her family will be able to decrease their public transportation expenses. In the future, Rom would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport vegetables to resell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in Uganda. He is married and has three children, of whom two are currently in school. For the past six years, Peter has been working hard to manage his workshop, where he manufactures sign posts, doors, and chairs. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more wood, metal, and other materials, and it will help Peter to generate greater profits and improve his family's well-being. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to own a large company.

Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but whose businesses have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more wood, metal, and other materials.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Khom, 50, is married and resides with his wife and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He carries sugar and fish to sell around his village. His wife is a rice vendor at the market. His daughter is a garment worker and his son works in a company.

Khom is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase a new motorbike to carry sugar and fish to sell. In the future, he would like to expand his business and build a fence around his house.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to carry sugar and fish to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 36 years old, married and has 4 children. She is from Calabayan, Ozamis City. 

Susan plants, harvests and sells bananas to earn a living. Susan has been in this business for 10 years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Susan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr:
Cliente de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont tous son sur le banc de l'école.Ayant considérée sa charge , elle ouvre  en 2006 une boutique d'alimentation, ou elle vend les produits d'alimentation, des conserves, des cartons de lait, des cartons de savons des cartons d'eau minérale.
Cliente très ponctuelle, de bonne heure sa boutique est deja ouvert pour être au rendez vous avec ses clients.
Elle a deja beneficiee de 3 cycle de prêts, elle a remboursée avec succès et a des épargnes consistantes .
A L'octroi de son nouveau prêt, elle va renforcer le stock de ses denrées et surtout les produits que l'on achètent beaucoup comme  des conserves, de l'eau minérale, ses recettes journalières varient entre 25.000 frs a 75.000 frs par jour.
Tres entreprenante, elle veut aller loin, elle compte faire des grands efforts pour elargir son activité et prendre plusieurs fois le crédit pour atteindre ses objectifs
texts.en: The borrower is 47 years old, married, and the mother of five children who all attend school.  In 2006, after thoughtful consideration, she made the decision to open a shop where she sells grocery products, canned goods, cartons of milk, boxes of soap and mineral water.  The borrower is a very punctual woman who opens her store early in the morning to greet her customers.  She has already benefited from three loan cycles which have been successfully repaid.  She also has a large amount of savings. With this new loan she plans to increase her stock of merchandise, and will especially purchase items that are in high demand, such as canned goods and mineral water.  Her daily revenues range between 25,000 and 75,000 francs.  She is very motivated and wants to go far.  She is planning to work hard to expand her business, and to take several loans to reach her goals.

loans.use: To buy bottles of mineral water, cartons of milk, canned food, boxes of soap.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавджуда любящая мать четверых детей. Муж работает плотником. Они трудятся , чтобы содержать семью, дать хорошее воспитание и образование детям. У Мавджуды свой уголок по торговле подарочными товарами. Товары востребованы и разбираются быстро. У нее свои постоянные клиенты. Чтобы подготовиться к предстоящим праздникам она хочет получить займ в размере 2800 сомони для пополнения ассортимента товаров новыми изделиями и подарочными наборами. Она уверенна, что вы поддержите ее и она получить займ для реализации своих желаний. Спасибо.
texts.en: Mavjuda is a loving mother of four children.  Her husband works as a carpenter.  They work hard to support their family and provide good upbringing and education for their children.  Mavjuda has her own retail corner, where she sells gifts.  The merchandise is in demand and is sold quickly.  She has regular customers.  In order to prepare for the upcoming holidays, Mavjuda wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 2800 somoni to refill her merchandise selection with new goods and gift sets.  She is certain that you will support her, and that she will obtain this loan in order to realize her wishes.  Thank you.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise

loans.name: Takku Liggey Paffa Group

texts.fr: "Takku Liggey paffa" est un groupe de 5 femmes,membres d'un grand groupe de solidarité qui se réunit chaque semaine (Sur la photo,les cinq premières femmes à partir de la droite ; les deux autres femmes sont membres du  groupe de solidarité mais ne sont pas membres du groupe qui sollicite le crédit). Elles pratiquent l'agriculture  durant l'hivernage et cultivent de l'arachide et des haricots avec l'aide de deux hommes qu'elles paient.La vente de leur production leur rapporte des revenus qui leur permettent de changer une fois l'année leur garde robe ainsi que celle des enfants.Elles en profitent aussi pour acheter des bijoux et des ustensiles de cuisine.Afin de préparer la campagne agricole à venir, elles sollicitent un pret de 250 000f pour acheter des semences.Elles ambitionnent d'agrandir leur surface d'exploitation les années à venir.
texts.en:
"Takku Liggey Paffa" is a group of ten women who work in agriculture, mainly during the rainy season. They grow peanuts and beans with the help of two men, who they pay. Selling their produce provides them with income that allows them to buy new clothes once a year for themselves and their children. They also buy jewelry and kitchen utensils.

To prepare for the upcoming agricultural season, they have requested a loan of 250,000 francs to buy seeds. They plan to increase the surface of land they sow over the coming years.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 53 years old, married and has three children who are in school. For 15 years, he has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. On the same farm, he also does crop farming. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to grow his business. With the income, he was able to support his family. He dreams of buying more cows in the future. He has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy animal feeds and a cow.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds and a cow

loans.name: Adjele Philomène

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, Adjele est une femme mariée et mère d’un enfant vivant ensemble à Baguida. Pour soutenir sa famille, Adjele vend des mèches, tissages et des pagnes dans sa boutique et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Adjele réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, Adjele nécessite ce crédit pour commander des unités de mèches outrées, sublimes et des pièces de pagnes en vue d’agrandir son stock et mieux revendre puis gagner des bénéfices et aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à couvrir certains besoins quotidiens de la famille.

loans.use: acheter 20 unités de mèches outrées, 20 unités de mèches sublimes et 04 pièces de pagnes.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Kaeiv Navy is married and father of children. He is working at the National Assembly of Cambodia, as a support staff.

He applied for a $500 loan for his wife to open a grocery shop. She used to run a similar business but the family sold it a few years ago, when her eldest son got married. Navy’s wife will use the money as a running capital to purchase spices and other goods to be sold in the shop. They are expecting 10,000 Riel ($2.5) profit from the shop every day, which will cover daily expenses for food.

This is the first time Navy is borrowing money. “If we are successful, we will increase the size of the business step by step with our future loans”, he said.

loans.use: Running Capital for a grocery shop

loans.name: Lyubov

texts.en:
Lyubov is married with two grown daughters. Her husband had problems with alcohol abuse. This motivated Lyubov to find other ways to support her family so she decided to start her own business selling household items and souvenirs. Lyubov has been in business now for 14 years and has a couple container-stores located at the central city market. Lyubov is very sociable and cheerful. Her positive attitude and smiling face attract many customers. Quick responses to any change in customer demand have helped her be successful in business. Lyubov has demonstrated responsibility and integrity in her relations with her suppliers and customers as well as when she has used lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Prompt loan repayments and stability in her business have demonstrated her trustworthiness and capability of further loan repayment. Lyubov is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase inventory wholesale. She is planning to buy dishware, towels, vases and a variety of souvenirs in bulk which will sell really well. Eventually Lyubov would like to expand her business and start selling at other locations. Increased inventory turnover will generate the necessary funds to sustain her business as well as meet her family’s needs.

Любов – одружена, в неї дві дорослі дочки. В її чоловіка були проблеми з алкоголем. Отже, Любов була змушена шукати можливостей забезпечити свою родину. Вона вирішила почати власну справу з продажу побутових товарів та сувенірів. Любов – власниця двох крамниць-контейнерів на центральному ринку міста, займається цим бізнесом вже 14 років. Любов – дуже комунікабельна та жвава. Її ввічливе ставлення до оточуючих та привітна посмішка завжди приваблюють багато покупців. Любов вміє швидко реагувати на будь-які зміни попиту клієнтів, а це допомагає їй досягати успіху в бізнесі. Любов – дуже відповідальна та порядна у відносинах з постачальниками, покупцями та співробітниками „Надії України”. Вона вже давно користується кредитними послугами цієї організації. Вчасна сплата позик та стабільність її бізнесу підтверджують, що Любов спроможна сплатити чергову позику. Любов просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб закупити товар оптом. Вона планує придбати посуд, рушники, різноманітні сувеніри, які завжди користуються попитом серед покупців. Врешті-решт Любов хотіла б розширити свій бізнес, відкрити крамничку десь в центрі міста. Більший асортимент товарів допоможе їй зібрати необхідні для цього кошти, а також забезпечити усі потреби її родини.

loans.use: To purchase inventory wholesale

loans.name: Ul

texts.en: Ul P. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and six children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  P. constructs houses on his property, which he then rents to families.  Currently, P. has only one rental house, which generates about $3.00 per day.  His wife, Marin (pictured here because P. was unavailable), works as a seamstress and usually makes about $1.50 profit per day.  Three of their children have graduated high school and work for a private company, while the other three are still students.  P. hopes to use this loan to buy the materials to construct more renal houses.  In the future, they hope to earn enough money to send their children to university.

loans.use: To build a rental house

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina  hasrun this business for 4 years. She is is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in the Fizuli region, Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
This 34-year-old woman is married and has a child. 
Previiously she bought a cow and so she supported her family. 
Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy a pregnant cow to increase the number of her cows and to meet all the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy a pregnant cow

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
I am widowed and have two daughters who go to school. Currently I am working as a schoolteacher but my income is not sufficient because of the high cost of living. I want to give a bright future to my daughters. Now I want to open a sewing school. I have a diploma in sewing. I would like to purchase a computerized sewing machine for my school. I need a loan to purchase this machine. By opening this school, I will be able to provide training for the eager girls of my locality and will be able to increase my income.

Yasmin S., Pakistan

loans.use: Set up a sewing school

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Sunantri

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Sunantri, a widow lives by herself in a simple home. Her house is made from unplastered batako, and cement floor. Her husband passed away 5 years ago, due to sickness. She lives with a child who is in college. To pay for living expenses, and child's college expenses, Ni Nyoman Sunantri is in the pig farming business. She is doing this business, since Ni Nyoman Sunantri sees a quite good opportunity in marketing pigs of roasted piglets (a Balinese specialty: after 3 months, ready to harvest), so that her investmet could circle faster. With the loan, Ni Nyoman Sunantri increase her business truely. Besides buying a mother pig, Ni Nyoman Sunantri also would add to her stall, so that the pregnat mother pig would have a place for her piglets. Ni Nyoman Sunantri works hard on this business to obtain maximal results. All this was done to support her child's education, to obtain education as high as possible. Ni Nyoman Sunantri is convince and hope that with higher education, her child could be succesful, helping family and mankind.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Sunantri, seorang janda yang tinggal seorang diri dirumahnya yang sederhana. Rumahnya terbuat dari batako yang belum diplester dan berlantai semen. Suaminya sudah meninggal dunia 5 tahun lalu, karena menderita sakit. Saat ini ia hidup dengan seorang anaknya yang sekarang sudah menimba ilmu di perguruan tinggi. Untuk menunjang biaya hidup dan biaya kuliah anaknya, Ni Nyoman Sunantri melakukan usaha ternak babi. Usaha ini dtekuninya karena Ni Nyoman Sunantri melihat peluang yang cukup baik dipemasaran babi untuk jenis babi guling ( 3 bulan pemeliharaan, siap panen ) sehingga perputaran dana lebih cepat. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, Ni Nyoman Sunantri meningkatkan usahanya dengan sungguh – sungguh. Selain membelikan induk babi, Ni Nyoman Sunantri juga menambah lokasi kandangnya sehingga induk babi yang akan melahirkan mempunyai tempat untuk anak – anaknya. Ni Nyoman Sunantri menekuni usaha ini dengan kerja keras karena ia menginginkan hasil yang maksimal. Semua itu dilakukan untuk menunjang pendidikan anaknya agar dapat menempuh pendidikan setinggi mungkin. Ni Nyoman Sunantri meyakini dan berharap, dengan pendidikan yang semakin tinggi, anaknya akan menjadi orang yang sukses yang dapat membantu keluarga dan sesamanya.

loans.use:
To buy a mother pig and build a stall

Membeli induk babi dan membuat kandang

loans.name: Maritza Angelica

texts.es:
Maritza Angélica is 40-years-old, and she lives in the district of La Esperanza in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad. She only studied through elementary school. She has 5 children, but only one still depends on her. She started her business with the help of her husband. She has a small shop where she makes children's shoes. She used to sell them as a street vendor by traveling the streets in the La Hermelinda and El Mayorista markets.

Now her shop has grown and she makes, in addition to children's shoes, shoes and sandals for women. She employs two young people. The growth has also allowed her to rent a stand in an important shopping center on a centrally-located avenue in the city of Trujillo, which a worker attends so she can continue making her sales on the streets of the city.

Maritza is a member of the Grupo Mientras Tanto Manuel Seoane. She received her first loan of 300 nuevos soles (about $101), with which she bought leather to make shoes. With this loan from Manuela Ramos of 500 nuevos soles (about $168), to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy insoles to make sandals for the end of the year celebrations. Maritza dreams about having a large shoe factory with cutting-edge technology.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maritza Angélica tiene 40 años de edad, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad.

Estudió solo primaria completa; tiene 5 hijos pero sólo uno depende de ella. La señora Maritza inició su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo. Tiene un pequeño taller artesanal de confección de zapatos para niños, ella solía vender de forma ambulante recorriendo las calles de los mercados “La Hermelinda” y “El Mayorista”.

Actualmente su taller ha crecido y ahora confecciona, a parte del calzado para niños, zapatos y sandalias para damas, dando empleo a dos jóvenes. El crecer le ha permitido también alquilar un stand en una galería importante de una avenida céntrica de la ciudad de Trujillo, donde atiende una trabajadora porque ella continúa realizando sus ventas por las calles de la ciudad.

La señora es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Manuel Seoane”, obtuvo su primer préstamos de S/.300.00 (aproximadamente $101) con el cual compró cuero para la confección de calzado. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.500.00 (aproximadamente $168), para ser cancelado en 4 meses, comprará plantas para fabricar sandalias de fiesta, las cuales venderá en estas fiestas de fin de año.La señora Maritza sueña con tener una fabrica de calzado grande y con tecnología de punta.

loans.use: Purchase of shoe insoles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a new tricycle (Comprar un nuevo triciclo)

loans.name: Soraida Katti

texts.en:
Soraida is the owner of one of the most famous grocery stores in Lambedera, in the community of Yamasá. Everyday, people in the neighborhood go to her store to purchase a wiD. range of products such as rice, milk, chocolate, juices, alcoholic drinks, and many other basic foodstuffs.

Soraida has been running her store for more than ten years. Soraida is married and has three sons aged of two, eight and ten years old. The two elder attend school.

The grocery store is the main source of income for the family, and through the business, she is supporting the studies of her sons. This determined businesswoman is requesting a loan to stock up the store since supplies are running low and she has to satisfy her customers’ needs.

loans.use: To restock a grocery store in order to face high demand from customers.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en: Hisham is 28 years old and a father of 3. Hisham lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. He owns a grocery store. This is the first time Hisham has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. He is going to buy a coffee machine and a coffee roaster.

loans.use: To buy a coffee machine and a coffee roaster.

loans.name: Holmumin

texts.ru:
Holmumin Boinazarov lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi area. He is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. He has no formal education. He is involved in livestock trade. He buys young bulls, feeds them for about 40-45 days to fatten them up and then sells them at a higher price to make a profit. This business is the sole income earner for his family. He has been doing this for 2 years. This is a common business in his rural area and it is profitable.

Right now he has less capital on hand due to a cold winter. He was forced to sell a few of his bulls to stock up on feed for the rest of the animals. He now needs to replenish his inventory and hopes to do this by getting a loan. The loan will help to revive his business and income, which his family urgently needs. In addition, his business will help the overall development of the livestock area. He hopes to repay his loan in the course of 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Бойназаров Холмумин живет в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 44 года , женат и имеет 4 детей. Образования не имеет. Занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, откармливает их 40-45 дней , а затем продает по более выгодной для него цене с учетом расходов. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Занимается этим 2 года. Этот бизнес является самым распространенным бизнесом в их местностии дает неплохой доход. На данный момент клиенту нужны средства , чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Для этого клиенту нужно получить кредити он обратился к нам. Это поможет ему восстановить бизнес и получаемый доход , который так не хватает его семье. Кроме того, его деятельность поможет развитию животноводческого сектора. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying new livestock-cattle

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um P., age 33, (her husband is pictured) a mother of eight children, resides in Kampong Cham province where she has a business selling fruit in a busy market, earning about $2 a day. Her husband, a construction worker building houses, normally earns around $3 a day. Two of their children are married and live away from home. Another child is a horse cart driver, and two daughters sell fruits and roasted eggs, the latter one of the most popular foods in Cambodia. As well, one son works as a construction worker, while the rest stay at home, earning no profit.

Um P.’s husband would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a trailer, which will enable him to augment family income through additional jobs outside of construction.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to earn additional income.

loans.name: Patzutzun Ii Group

texts.es:
The women of Patzutzun Group II come from a remote village named Concepción in the departament of Sololá. Within this group, few of the members know how to speak Spanish. This, however, is not an impediment to them in getting ahead with their businesses given that they know the local idiom of Maya Kachikel very well. At the onset of the interview many of the women were intimidated by my presence and became very shy, since in their village they had never had a visit from a “gringo”. Over time, however, and thanks to the support of the credit agent Marta Julia, they were able to gain confidence and share with me some of their experiences.

The majority of the clients are in sales. They will invest their loan into their small stores that stock basic need or convenience products. One of them, Maria Teresa S., will invest her loan in the sale of wood. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to purchase twice as much that which she bought before and she hopes that this will help her business to grow.

The other part of the group works in textiles, weaving traditional fabrics. Two of the four craftswomen contract other weavers for labor. Marcela S. currently has three employees under contract to meet the demand from her customers. Meanwhile, Lucia L., one of the older members, has six weavers under contract.

Currently, Friendship Bridge offers all the members savings products. The women commented that they are very grateful to the institution because they will finally be able to put their earnings in safekeeping. They want to reinvest their entire savings into their businesses. Another reason why they are happy with the institution is that it is one of the few that has offered financial products to their communities. When the women were asked why they chose to work with Friendship Bridge, they said simply that it was because they hadn’t heard of any other such institution in their community.

The dream of these women is to grow their businesses and, in this way, have a stable a enterprise that will help support them and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Las mujeres del grupo Patzuntzun II vienen de una aldea remota llamada Concepción en el departamento de Sololá. Dentro de este grupo de mujeres pocas saben hablar el español, sin embargo eso no es ningún impedimento para que puedan salir adelante con sus negocios, ya que el idioma local Maya Kachikel lo dominan muy bien. Al principio de la entrevista muchas de las señoras se intimidaron con mi presencia y se pusieron un poco tímidas, debido a que en su aldea ellas nunca habían visto a un “gringo”, pero con el transcurso del tiempo y gracias al apoyo de la agente de crédito Marta Julia ellas pudieron entrar en confianza y compartir un poco de sus experiencias.

La mayoría de las clientas son comerciantes. Ellas van a invertir su crédito en sus pequeñas tiendas de consumo diario o de conveniencia. Una de ellas, Maria Tereza S. va a invertir su crédito en el comercio de leña. Gracias a su crédito ella va a poder comprar dos veces el monto que ella compraba anteriormente y espera que de esa manera su negocio crezca.

La otra parte del grupo trabaja en el sector textil. Ellas son tejedoras de telas tradicionales. De las cuatro artesanas dos de ellas contratan a tejedoras como mano de obra. Marcela S. actualmente está contratando a tres empleadas para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Mientras que Lucia L., una de las clientas más ancianitas, está contratando a seis tejedoras.

Actualmente Friendship Bridge les ofrece a todas las clientes un producto de ahorros. Las señoras me comentaron que ellas estaban agradecidas con la institución porque ellas finalmente van a tener un lugar donde guardar su dinero. Ellas, van a utilizar su dinero en su mismo negocio. Ellas quieren reinvertir enteramente su dinero en el negocio. Otra razón por que las clientas están contentas con la institución es porque es la única o una de las muy pocas que ha llegado a ofrecer productos financieros a sus comunidades. Cuando se les preguntó a las señoras porque escogieron trabajar con Friendship Bridge simplemente dijeron porque no habían escuchado de otra institución en su comunidad.

El sueño de estas señoras es que sus negocios puedan crecer y de esta manera tener un negocio estable para poder mantener a ellas y a sus respectivas familias.

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities for daily use, purchase of raw materials to weave traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Justine B. is 41 years old, she is married and the mother of 4, the oldest of which is 17 and is named Bamidele. She has developed her distribution and sales of diverse products for a decade now. In the beginning she had problems financing her little business. To find a way out of this situation and to improve her display as well as better satisfy customer demand, she is asking for her third loan.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agée de 41 ans, Dame B. Justine est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont l’aîné a 17ans et s’appelle Bamidélé. Il y a maintenant une décennie qu’elle évolue dans le domaine de la distribution et de la vente de divers articles de grande consommation. Au départ, elle a connu des difficultés notamment sur le plan financier. Afin de trouver une porte de sortie à cette situation et de renforcer son étalage et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle elle vient solliciter son troisième prêt.

loans.use: To purchase 4 cartons of soap, 2 cartons of cosmetic products and one carton of canned foods.
